story:
Thanks you for supporting independet musicians/Gracias por apoyar la música independiente.

  • Hi this is Mowgly from Cusco - Perú and I´m so happy that after all these years, people, places and lived experiences finally can offers you my rock masterpiece. HEAR MY 1ST MUSIC PRODUCTION: https://open.spotify.com/artist/2Zl4koqjQttkWTm... / Hola soy Mowgly de Cusco - Perú y estoy muy feliz de después todos estos años, personas, lugares y experiencias vividas, finalmente puedo ofrecerles mi pieza maestra en el genero rock.
  • This campaign is created to take my music everywhere to connect with more places and people that believe in dreams. It is a big challenge not only in artistic production also in the economic fact to compete at the same level of big "music" inversionists and big record labels is necessary to have will power, the gift and of vourse your support/Esta campaña esta creada con la finalidad de poder llevar la música de mi producción a mas lugares y personas. Lo cual significa un reto muy grande no solo en producción artística, también en lo  económico ya que para poder competir con las disqueras y mostros inversionistas que venden pésima "música", es necesario tener mucha fuerza de voluntad, el don musical y por supuesto de tú  apoyo.
  • With your support I will be abble to pay a part of my music recording and videoclips. My final budget is 20 000 Euros but just 5000 euros is what Im asking for to finish to pay/ Con tu apoyo podre pagar una parte de mis grabaciones musicales y videoclips. Mis gastos ascienden a unos 70 mil soles pero en este caso solo necesito recolectar 18 mil soles unos 5000 Euros para terminar de pagar todo.

The world needs real and corageous music/El mundo necesita música real y valiente.

Are you tired to hear the same kind of mainstream music talking about the same topics? If the answer is YES this is a great opportunity to contribute with real music with a good message and real feelings.

Estas cansado de escuchar la misma música de moda hablando de los mimos topicos? si tu respuesta es SI esta es una gran oportunidad para contribuir con la música real de calidad con un sentimiento y mensaje real.

Mowgly is getting to inspire people everytime closer to you/Mowgly esta consiguiendo inspirar personas cada vez mas cerca de ti. 

Mowgly is travelling a lot and getting more music tours and people that support his music carrer and art around the world. thats why we invited you to be part of this project.

Mowgly esta viajando bastante y consiguiendo mas tours y gente que apoya su carrera musical y arte alrededor del mundo por eso te invitamos a  ser parte de este proyecto.

This project is on fire/ Este proyecto esta quemando.

This music production contains 10 songs all of them has a great message. Mowgly sings to real love, overcoming and especially to freedom and all these songs has a great potential to be the soundtrack of your life.

Esta producción musical contiene 10 canciones, todas ellas tienen un gran mensaje. Mowgly canta al amor verdadero, a la superación y especialmente a la libertad y todas las canciones tienen un gran potencial a ser el soundtrack de tu vida.

Being an independet musician/ Ser un Músico independiente .

Is really complex to explain... probably the best answer is that you should be nuts or ready to die for your ideals. Yes I am and wanna try my best to share my musical message. can you help me?

Es difícil de explicar... probablemente la mejor respuesta sea que debes estar loco o listo para morir  por tus ideales. Si lo estoy y voy a  hacer lo mejor que pueda para compartir mi mensaje musical. Podrias ayudar me?

No money but still wanna support? Sin dinero pero aun quieres apoyar?

Cool you can share this crowdfunding through the link with your friends that love music and art specially rock. Thank you for your interest.

Perfecto, tu puedes compartir este Crowdfunding a traves del link con tus amigos que les gusta la música en especial el Rock. Gracias por tu interes.

story:
If there is one thing that I have learned in my 10+ years of working as an artist, manager, and technician in professional theater it is this: everyone has a story to tell. Everyone. Admittedly, I did not come to this conclusion with ease or urgency. I spent years feeling like a martyr for other people’s stories, doing thankless jobs behind the scenes. I grew quite bitter. So, after a fairly routine 20-something-year-old heartbreak, I decided to skip the bangs, the Ben and Jerry’s, the swipe-right-for-a-good-time remedies and try something that would truly change my life: I resolved to tell my stories, though I had no idea how. At that time, I had an eye for lighting and design, had an ear for sound and music, had the thick skin for long days of fine-tuning in tech booths, and I had management skills, but I was still lacking confidence. It was so easy to watch other artists, with all their charm and determination, and decide that I could never be that. In the end, I learned that was true. I could never be other artists, because I’m just me. I’m just Katie Keirs. I make mistakes, I learn, I get curious, I explore. 

So, I forgave myself for being a human, and I stopped comparing myself to other humans. I stopped being concerned with how to tell my stories, and just started looking for chances to do it. I picked up an old guitar that had been neglected for almost all of the 15 years I had it, and began telling stories with music. I did not have professional training as a musician, nor did I have any experience with writing lyrics, but that didn’t stop me. I abandoned my previous career to learn as much as I could about music production on my own. I stopped wanting to be an artist and started working on just being a human who loves music. Turns out, there are a lot of us out there telling our stories any way we can (particularly at regional music festivals!), and there are a ton of resources for the DIY musician. My apartment transformed into a studio, and my stage began to vary from campfires to car rides to conventional venues. Music has brought me so much joy. Applause is nice, audiences are reassuring, but my songs, they are the only thing I get to keep. They are mine. They are my stories to share. 

I’m Katie Keirs, a regular human who has endured and will continue to endure all of the awkward growth life throws at me. I have learned to love and take great comfort in my regular human story. Now, I am determined to inspire other humans to do the same. My Roving Hi-Fi Studio will be a place where we can all record our stories through song, through poetry, through traditional storytelling. It will provide affordable, high quality production for all humans-- for those of us who grace the stage, and those of us who mop it, because everyone has a story to tell. Everyone.

All I need is the vehicle, capitol for renovations, and a little extra cash for vending fees. My goal is to raise $10,000 and have my first roving studio on the road by April 20th, 2020. I cannot do it without your help! Any amount will help tremendously, but I have some cool incentives for contributions starting at just $10. 

I really believe in this project and cannot wait to hit the road!

What I Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise $10,000. 

$5000 - buy a compact school bus 

$1500 - renovations to the bus

$500 - misc. recording equipment (new cables, a couple new microphones)

$2000 - a new computer 

$1000 - start-up vending fees

There will inevitably be some odds and ends to pick up along the way, and unexpected obstacles that I will need to overcome. Should any of my budget projections overshoot the actual cost, all surplus funds will be reserved for emergencies (flat tires, repairs, etc.), and vehicle expenses (gas, insurance, etc.). Your contributions will only be used for the Inky Pocket Roving Hi-Fi Recording Studio project!

Contribution PERKS!

$10 - a personalized shout out on instagram (@kikiandtherev)

$25 - a personalized video shout out on social media

$50 - a personalized original jingle by Kiki and The Rev

$100 - a FREE recording session with Inky Pocket Productions (in the roving studio!)

$500+ - VIP pass to the soft opening in Pittsburgh and a spot on Inky Pocket's VIP Producers List

In the event that we do not reach the full $10,000, all contributions will go towards the purchase of a compact school bus. 

The Impact

I truly believe that music is a universal love language. I just want to spread the love by making music production affordable, accessible, and exciting for everyone. Get on the bus! Try something that intimidates you, make a memory with friends, get your ideas down, learn about the recording process, get your start! The Roving Hi Fi Studio is here to help.

Risks & Challenges

I am trying something truly unique to regional musical festivals. Branding will be the first challenge. What is a roving recording studio? Who are these Inky Pocket people? Will they understand my sound?

I have a structured marketing plan for social media leading up to the soft opening, but the best way to introduce the Roving Hi Fi Studio is by showing up, giving folks a chance to have a look, and providing free 10 minute consultations to perspective clients. Music festivals are about the visceral experiences: hearing the music, dancing to the tunes, talking with new friends. I am committed to producing professional work, but am also just a regular human who enjoys music like everyone else at the festival. This shared passion will make my studio a fun and approachable attraction.

They may not know Inky Pocket's Roving Hi Fi Studio yet, but once they do, I know they will dig it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I absolutely know what it is like to not have extra cash to spare [ literally eating ramen noodles for dinner right now], so I understand if you simply cannot afford to contribute with money at this time. No worries! There are still plenty of ways to help out. 

Please share this campaign on social media. You're friends might be interested in contributing! 

Please like and share social media accounts! 

Kiki and The Rev:    FB @katierose420    IG @kikiandtherev 

Inky Pocket Productions social media and website will be launched in the new year. Follow Kiki and The Rev for that announcement!

Also, if you are interested in volunteering your time to help with renovations please reach out! 

I will take all the help I can get, and every bit makes a world of difference!

Thank you SO MUCH!

-Katie Keirs

story:
Welcome back! Since our last fundraiser, we have managed to curate several projects that have seen great levels of success thanks to our amazing players and your valuable support. Their kindness, passion and enthusiasm in committing to our projects almost every time for free has been remarkable, and we thank them from the bottom of our hearts for the help they gave our orchestra in its development.

However, we feel it is right for us to take a further step in our development and build a more professional relationship with our incredible players by starting to pay them a reasonable fee.

We are planning an exciting Spring 2020 season featuring world premieres, a continuation of our Beethoven Symphony Cycle, and exquisite soloists in programs of established repertoire. Supporting Audentia will enable many young players to take part in exciting new performances that we are sure will result in great successes. Since spring is always the season of change and growth, we hope in your kind help to make our intentions reality, and come back to you with renewed enthusiasm and exciting new stimulae. Be a part of it!

Be a part of it!

story:
(Portuguese translation below/tradução em português abaixo)

I'm a Brazilian-Canadian singer, songwriter and percussionist living in Toronto. I'm asking for your help to complete my second album. My first album, Flores Tambores e Amores got a lot of love. I was overwhelmed by the reaction from my incredible fans. It also received wide critical acclaim, ended up on several best of the year lists and earned me a Juno Award nomination. I wanted to follow it up with something truly special, which is why I took such time and care in the making of my second album. It's a very personal album. The songs reflect on my experiences as a Brazilian woman living in Toronto. It's about the blending of cultures and how you have to rediscover yourself in a new environment.

I took some big creative risks on this album. The music is experimental and eclectic and features lush vintage production. We recorded the bed tracks live off the floor to analog tape. Over 20 musicians play on the album, including a large string section. Producer David Arcus and I knew it was a gamble to invest so much in the recording process, especially on an independent album. We knew our budget wouldn't get us all the way to the finish line. But we also knew that's what the songs needed and we had to take the leap. The resulting recordings turned out even better that we could have hoped. We can't wait to share them with you. But before we can, we need some help to get this project across over the finish line!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds I receive will go towards mixing, mastering and manufacturing the album.

Mixing: $3390
Mastering: $1450
Artwork/Design/Photography: $1500
Vinyl Manufacturing: $2050
CD Manufacturing: $1250
Indiegogo Fees: $670

TOTAL: $10,310

To show my gratitude for your support, I've put together some amazing perks including advance digital downloads, CDs, vinyl records, and admission to an intimate concert at a secret location in downtown Toronto!

 

The Impact

Your support will help me realize the full potential of the album. I'm so excited about what I've achieved so far, but without a professional mix and mastering job, the songs won't shine and fully come to life. We're so close! With your help I can finish the album the way I intended. I have the team in place to do it and with your support, we can make it happen!

I'm also asking for help with the artwork and manufacturing of the records so I can have a beautiful physical product to match the music and so the album can reach as many people as possible.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, don't worry! Just spreading the word is a huge help. You can use the indiegogo share tools or just like/share my posts on social media. I'm immensely grateful to you for being a part of the process and helping in any way you can

 

 

* SEE THE PORTUGUESE TRANSLATION BELOW

Sou um cantora, compositor e percussionista brasileira e canadense radicada em Toronto. Estou pedindo sua ajuda para completar meu segundo álbum. Meu primeiro álbum, Flores Tambores e Amores, ganhou muito amor. Fiquei impressionada com a reação do publico. O disco também recebeu elogios da crítica, acabou em várias listas dos melhores do ano e me rendeu uma indicação ao Juno Award. Eu queria continuar com algo verdadeiramente especial, e é por isso que dediquei tanto tempo e cuidado na criação do meu segundo álbum. É um álbum muito pessoal. As músicas refletem sobre minhas experiências como brasileira vivendo em Toronto. É sobre a mistura de culturas e como você deve se redescobrir em um novo ambiente. Eu assumi alguns grandes riscos criativos neste álbum. A música é experimental e eclética e apresenta uma exuberante produção vintage. Gravamos as faixas guias ao vivo em fita analógica. Mais de 20 músicos participam no álbum, incluindo uma grande seção de cordas. O produtor David Arcus e eu sabíamos que era arriscado investir tanto no processo de gravação, especialmente em um álbum independente. Sabíamos que nosso orçamento não nos levaria até a linha de chegada. Mas também sabíamos que era disso que as músicas precisavam e tivemos que dar o passo. As gravações resultantes foram ainda melhores do que esperávamos. Mal podemos esperar para compartilhá-las com você. Mas antes disso, precisamos de ajuda para levar esse projeto ao longo da linha de chegada! 

O que precisamos e o que você ganha:

Os fundos que eu receber irão para a mixagem, masterização e fabricação do álbum.
Mixagem: $ 3390
Masterização: $ 1450
Arte / Design / Fotografia: $ 1500
Fabricação de vinil: $ 2050
Fabricação do CD: $ 1250
Taxas do Indiegogo: $ 670
TOTAL: $ 10.310
Para mostrar minha gratidão por seu apoio, reuni algumas vantagens incríveis, incluindo downloads digitais avançados, CDs, discos de vinil e admissão a um concerto íntimo em um local secreto no centro de Toronto!

O impacto 

Seu apoio me ajudará a perceber todo o potencial do álbum. Estou super feliz e empolgada com o que consegui até agora, mas sem uma mixagem profissional e um trabalho de masterização, as músicas não brilharão e e nao farão jus ao seu potencial.  Estamos tão perto! Com sua ajuda, posso terminar o álbum da maneira que pretendia. Eu tenho a equipe para fazer isso e, com o seu apoio, podemos fazer isso acontecer!Também estou pedindo ajuda com a arte e a fabricação dos discos, para que eu possa ter um belo produto físico para combinar com a música e para que o álbum atinja o maior número possível de pessoas.


Outras maneiras de ajudar

Se você não pode contribuir, não se preocupe! Apenas espalhar a palavra é uma grande ajuda. Você pode usar as ferramentas de compartilhamento do indiegogo ou simplesmente curtir / compartilhar minhas postagens nas mídias sociais. Sou imensamente grato a você por fazer parte do processo e ajudar de qualquer maneira que puder

With your help I can finish the album the way I intended. I have the team in place to do it and with your support, we can make it happen!
I'm also asking for help with the artwork and manufacturing of the records so I can have a beautiful physical product to match the music and so the album can reach as many people as possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, don't worry! Just spreading the word is a huge help. You can use the indiegogo share tools or just like/share my posts on social media. I'm immensely grateful to you for being a part of the process and helping in any way you can
 
 
* SEE THE PORTUGUESE TRANSLATION BELOW
Sou um cantora, compositor e percussionista brasileira e canadense radicada em Toronto. Estou pedindo sua ajuda para completar meu segundo álbum. Meu primeiro álbum, Flores Tambores e Amores, ganhou muito amor. Fiquei impressionada com a reação do publico. O disco também recebeu elogios da crítica, acabou em várias listas dos melhores do ano e me rendeu uma indicação ao Juno Award. Eu queria continuar com algo verdadeiramente especial, e é por isso que dediquei tanto tempo e cuidado na criação do meu segundo álbum. É um álbum muito pessoal. As músicas refletem sobre minhas experiências como brasileira vivendo em Toronto. É sobre a mistura de culturas e como você deve se redescobrir em um novo ambiente. Eu assumi alguns grandes riscos criativos neste álbum. A música é experimental e eclética e apresenta uma exuberante produção vintage. Gravamos as faixas guias ao vivo em fita analógica. Mais de 20 músicos participam no álbum, incluindo uma grande seção de cordas. O produtor David Arcus e eu sabíamos que era arriscado investir tanto no processo de gravação, especialmente em um álbum independente. Sabíamos que nosso orçamento não nos levaria até a linha de chegada. Mas também sabíamos que era disso que as músicas precisavam e tivemos que dar o passo. As gravações resultantes foram ainda melhores do que esperávamos. Mal podemos esperar para compartilhá-las com você. Mas antes disso, precisamos de ajuda para levar esse projeto ao longo da linha de chegada! 
O que precisamos e o que você ganha:
Os fundos que eu receber irão para a mixagem, masterização e fabricação do álbum.Mixagem: $ 3390Masterização: $ 1450Arte / Design / Fotografia: $ 1500Fabricação de vinil: $ 2050Fabricação do CD: $ 1250Taxas do Indiegogo: $ 670TOTAL: $ 10.310Para mostrar minha gratidão por seu apoio, reuni algumas vantagens incríveis, incluindo downloads digitais avançados, CDs, discos de vinil e admissão a um concerto íntimo em um local secreto no centro de Toronto!
O impacto 
Seu apoio me ajudará a perceber todo o potencial do álbum. Estou super feliz e empolgada com o que consegui até agora, mas sem uma mixagem profissional e um trabalho de masterização, as músicas não brilharão e e nao farão jus ao seu potencial.  Estamos tão perto! Com sua ajuda, posso terminar o álbum da maneira que pretendia. Eu tenho a equipe para fazer isso e, com o seu apoio, podemos fazer isso acontecer!Também estou pedindo ajuda com a arte e a fabricação dos discos, para que eu possa ter um belo produto físico para combinar com a música e para que o álbum atinja o maior número possível de pessoas.

Outras maneiras de ajudar
Se você não pode contribuir, não se preocupe! Apenas espalhar a palavra é uma grande ajuda. Você pode usar as ferramentas de compartilhamento do indiegogo ou simplesmente curtir / compartilhar minhas postagens nas mídias sociais. Sou imensamente grato a você por fazer parte do processo e ajudar de qualquer maneira que puder

story:
Intro

Hi, I'm Andy Pursell. I'm a Florida-based singer/songwriter with a rock'n country band. Since picking up the guitar at the age of 18, I've performed my music live at hundreds of venues and festivals across the south, including shows with Alan Jackson, John Michael Montgomery and Clay Walker to name a few, and I was even named "favorite new country artist" by the Tampa Bay Music Network. 

In July, 2019, I self-released the country saltwater anthem "Livin' In The Salt Life," which with little to no marketing racked up over 325,000 views. Jason Aldean meets Jimmy Buffett, it's the song you want on your playlist when you’re heading out to the beach or on the boat to party with friends - beaches, boats, beer, bikinis, banjos, water, the sun and the sand.

2019 has been a year of incredible firsts for me but I need your help.

The success of "Livin' In The Salt Life" attracted lots of new fans, music industry, brands and more, but my team and I believe the song could still be so much bigger. There's only so much I can do working a full-time day job as a lineman, I want to make MUSIC my full-time job and I'm asking for your help.

A proper campaign to re-release and market "Livin' In The Salt Life" kicked off on May 14, 2020, including a multi-faceted strategic marketing partnership with the Salt Life apparel and lifestyle company, who just made me part of “Team Salt Life.” Hell yeah!

I'd also like to go back into the studio in Nashville where I recorded "Livin' In The Salt Life" in late Summer, 2020 to record four more tracks for my first ever EP.

Then I plan to market, release and tour behind "Livin' In The Salt Life" and the new EP, and truly take the party on the road on a national level for the first time, bringing that southern Salt Life lifestyle to cities and towns across the nation.

I couldn't be more excited about everything going on and to share my music with the world. I've never had a clearer vision of where things are going and know that some of my best songs and times are ahead of me. It’s all an insane amount of work, but I wouldn’t have it any other way.

Of course, this all comes with a lot of costs. As a truly independent artist, there are so many hurdles to success - and a big one is money. My community of fans and friends have gotten me this far, and I'm asking for your help to push me over the top in 2020.

Your pledges in this campaign are going directly into the quality and reach of the single and EP itself. They allow me the means to book time at the studio in Nashville where I cut "Livin' In The Salt Life," travel there, and carefully record, mix and master the EP in an effort to capture and articulate my sound in the best way that I can. This is an important moment for me and I sincerely and passionately want to make the final outcome reflect that.

Beyond that, your funding will allow me to manufacture physical copies so that I can tour, promote, and spread the music to as many people as possible. This isn't a glamorous lifestyle and I'm not personally keeping any of the money raised, it's all going into making the best EP possible and then taking the Salt Life party on the road in front of as many people as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

Specifically, I need to raise $15,000 to support all of these activities. That includes recording, mixing, and mastering the entire EP, producing a music video for a second single off the EP,  marketing the single and EP, and covering basic costs during a tour later in the year. Even if we hit that goal, I'll still be digging into my own pockets throughout the year. 

Needless to say, I can't do this on my own. So your help is critical in helping me achieve this dream!

To thank you for your support, you can get your name in the credits of the EP liner notes, personalized and signed copies of the EP, custom t-shirts, a performance at your house, and a lot of other exciting rewards. Check out the full list of perks and see what speaks to you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute to one of these perks doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Donate ANY amount you like, with or without a reward!
  • Spread the love! Just by spreading the word about my campaign you can help me reach my goal. Share this campaign on any of your social media outlets and tag me! On Instagram, I'm @andypursellmusic, on Facebook, I'm @Singer.AndyPursell , and on Twitter, I'm @andy_pursell

Thanks again for your support. From the bottom of my heart, I couldn’t do this without you. I love you all and hope to see you out there soon!

Andy

story:
Our Campaign

There are considerable costs when it comes to manufacturing and releasing an album on multiple physical platforms. As an independent, unsigned band, we mostly generate money through playing live shows and selling merchandise/our music. This money is saved and used for things such as recording, travelling away for gigs and creating new merchandise (sadly it does not end up in our pockets).

We are looking to YOU, our fantastic fan base and supporters to help us bolster our funds towards producing a top quality end product for our latest album. With your help, we will not have to cut corners or make any compromises when releasing what we have worked so hard on over the last couple of years.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise £2000 to cover the cost of manufacturing records, CDs, cassettes and merchandise for the album.
  • There are set “perks” detailed above. Each donation amount gets something different to say thank you and show our appreciation for your support! We understand that not everyone can afford to back these amounts. So there is a “back it” button also, where you can pledge as little or as much as you feel comfortable with. Every penny helps. 
  • If we do not reach the coveted £2000 mark, the amount raised will still go toward the manufacturing of the album, it may just mean that it will take a little longer to get it “out there”. 

Risks & Challenges

The only real challenge regarding getting the album released on multiple platforms, is the issue of getting everything ready for release at the same time. We have a detailed plan of how we are going to achieve this, which has been constructed from past experiences in releasing our first album. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and we completely understand that, but that doesn't mean you can't help us in other ways:

  • Share our funding page to as many people and platforms as you can.
  • Spread the word, far and wide!
  • Keep streaming and listening to our material online.
  • Keep coming to our gigs and showing your support.

Thank you for taking the time to read through our proposal and your consideration of backing us. Let’s get this album out there and enjoy it.

story:
Hello! And thank you for checking my first crowdfunding campaign!

I'm Innessa. 

I'm here to fundraise $12000 AUD (including IndieGoGo fees and perk production costs) via this pre-sale/crowdfunding campaign to put it towards the recording of my new album "Golden Wreath". 

Here’s a brief story WHO I AM:

* Born in RUSSIA, Kirov

* Travelled EIGHT countries

* Settled down in AUSTRALIA in 2010

* TEN years of singing in a choir

* FIFTEEN years of working as a singer

* THOUSANDS of nights of writing songs.

* THREE studio albums, a few singles.

I have always been true to my PASSION for singing and writing. Today I would like to put my soul into the recording of my FOURTH album that will combine TWO of my main projects: my originals in ALTERNATIVE POP/ROCK style + TRADITIONAL RUSSIAN FOLK. I am ready for this experiment! I have heaps of ideas in my head, sketches, harmonies, melodies, lyrics. Help me to get them out! Become a part of this recording!

My Original songs are unique, quirky yet soulful. East-European folk songs always capture one’s heart. WHAT HAPPENS IF I COMBINE MY MUSIC WITH TRADITIONAL EAST-EUROPEAN MELODIES? Do you want to hear it for yourself? 

Are you intrigued enough? Then BECOME A PART OF THIS RECORDING PROCESS, be with me, let's do it together. I’m calling on you, my dear friends, family, strangers and supporters of music, to help me to create the album of my dream! ❤️️

Even if you can’t afford to get a perk, you can help me by SHARING this around and telling others about my music. You just have to copy and paste the following link to share it: https://igg.me/at/golden-wreath​

We’ve got a wonderful, talented bunch of musicians scattered all over the world ready to jump in and start working on this album. Under the current circumstances with many people, including musicians, affected by Coronavirus, remote collaboration is a perfect way to keep going and keep creating.  If the budget allows I will invite musicians from different corners of the world to put our creativity together and release something MAGICAL! ✨

HERE’S HOW THE FUNDS WILL BE USED:

• Recording, mixing, producing -  $7000

• Mastering - $840

• Creating album art, photoshoot, designing merchandise $1000

• CD duplication $742

• Rewards costs (getting together all the rewards, printing the T-shirts, cards etc) -  $1800

•IndieGoGo 5% fee - $550

 

Risks and challenges

For an independent artist like me, the biggest challenge is trying to stay afloat and record new material as the costs involved in the recording are so great. If I don’t make the target and I am unable to raise the funds, I will have to put my album on hold and it may take me another year or more of saving to raise the funds needed to record it. I have already gone through the process of releasing CDs three times in the past. I must admit I have never been as committed to my music goals as right now. Though there is always the chance of unforeseen delays I am CONFIDENT that the album will be in your hands by a reasonable date! 

 

Every backer will receive an immediate reward - my new single "Shallop" (it hasn't been released yet!!!) plus Russian Version of this song. Also, behind-the-scene footages of me in the studio and will hear stories behind songs and recording processes. (The download will arrive within 24 hours. Please check your SPAM folder if you don't get the songs or send me a message.)

 

HOW TO CONTRIBUTE.

Click "Back It" button next to the video

Select a perk

Click "Get get this perk" 

Follow check-out instructions.

There is also an opportunity to DONATE ANY AMOUNT without selecting a perk. 

To do this: 

Click "Back It" button next to the video

In the field under "Make a contribution" enter the desired amount

Click "Continue" 

Follow check-out instructions.

 

Thank you for taking time out of your day to read this. I am grateful for any contribution you can make to help make my dream album a reality. I am sure that I will be able to give back a lot of love and inspiration and fun through making this album and sharing my music with you.

Yours truly,

Innessa

I am grateful for any contribution you can make to help make my dream album a reality. I am sure that I will be able to give back a lot of love and inspiration and fun through making this album and sharing my music with you.Yours truly,Innessa

story:
Over 20 Years in the Making!

Hi there!

My name is Chris Mazurk and I'm launching this Indiegogo campaign to try to help fulfill a lifelong dream of mine - to record an album of music and press it to vinyl.

In high school, I was the guy who walked around with a guitar in his hand all the time. I spent all of my free time with my band, Alien - recording songs in our garage and having the time of my life.

After high school, I continued to write songs and play in bands until I was about 25 - when I decided to shift gears and focus on my career.

So, here I am at 40 - ready to record that album. After deliberating over writing new songs or working on old tunes I realized that the most awesome option would be to record professional versions of the songs from my high school rock band.

      Preparations

      Back in the mid-90's, my band mates and I spent hours each day in my garage rehearsing the same 14 songs over and over and over. We recorded some of the rehearsals to cassette tapes on an my old stereo. I spent the first month of this year digging through those old tapes, re-learning the guitar parts, deciphering the lyrics, and figuring out the bass and drum parts for the first time. Then, I spent the next two months recording demos of each song.

      You can find those demos here:

      • Spotify
      • YouTube Music
      • Amazon Music
      • iTunes

      With the demos recorded, the next step was to lock down the band. Here are the rock stars who will be joining me in the studio:

      • Drums: Carlos Contreras
      • Guitar: Scott Ruygrok
      • Bass: Kyle Cavaness

      The brains behind the production will be Roger Urich - a phenomenally talented music producer.

      The final step was to secure the artist for the album cover. I'm excited to announce that more details around this will be coming soon.

        What We Need

        We're seeking $15,000 in funding to rent the recording studio, commission the album art, and press the album to vinyl.

        • If we hit $5,000 we’ll record at The Omen Room - a premiere studio in our hometown
        • At $10,000 we’ll instead record at Rancho de la Luna, where bands like Foo Fighters and ZZ Top recorded (huge influences for Alien)
        • When we nail $13,000 we’ll do a run of 100 12” vinyl records (180g for you audiophiles)
        • Finally, at $15,000 we’ll add a run of 100 7” vinyl records to make sure all 14 songs are included

        What You Get

        Here are the donation tiers we've setup...

        • "Thank You" Tier: Anything less than $50 gets your name printed in the “Thank you” section of a page inserted in the record
        • Vinyl Tier: $50 gets you the vinyl (both the 12” and 7” if we hit those goals), plus the perks from the previous tier
        • Vinyl+ Tier: $100 gets your name will be printed in the “Thank You” section on the album cover, plus the perks from both previous tiers
        • Signature Tier: $250 gets you a signed copy of the album, plus the perks from all previous tiers
        • Photo Tier: $500 gets you a unique photo of the band from the recording sessions, plus the perks from all previous tiers
        • Video Tier: $1,000 gets you a video from the recording sessions with a special message just for you, plus the perks from all previous tiers
        • Ultimate Tier: $2,500 gets you everything PLUS we need backup vocalists and we might even have room for some more instruments - so, why not join us on the recording?

Finally, at $15,000 we’ll add a run of 100 7” vinyl records to make sure all 14 songs are included

What You Get


Here are the donation tiers we've setup...


"Thank You" Tier: Anything less than $50 gets your name printed in the “Thank you” section of a page inserted in the record

Vinyl Tier: $50 gets you the vinyl (both the 12” and 7” if we hit those goals), plus the perks from the previous tier

Vinyl+ Tier: $100 gets your name will be printed in the “Thank You” section on the album cover, plus the perks from both previous tiers

Signature Tier: $250 gets you a signed copy of the album, plus the perks from all previous tiers

Photo Tier: $500 gets you a unique photo of the band from the recording sessions, plus the perks from all previous tiers

Video Tier: $1,000 gets you a video from the recording sessions with a special message just for you, plus the perks from all previous tiers

Ultimate Tier: $2,500 gets you everything PLUS we need backup vocalists and we might even have room for some more instruments - so, why not join us on the recording?

story:
Dear Friends, Fans and Newcomers,

Who are we, you ask??? 

We are The Vignatis, the co-creators of the new genre we have coined, Gypsybilly.  For those of you who do not know, Fabrice is a French native with a passion for Django Reinhardt's Gypsy Jazz and Rockabilly.  Tracy is an American Air Force "brat" with an inherited first-love of Jazz and Country music.  Our musical backgrounds melded into this creation producing 2 self-funded albums, "Birth of the Gypsybilly Vol. 1" in 2008 and "Birth of the Gypsybilly Vol. 2" in 2012, both recorded with the former rhythm section of the Brian Setzer Orchestra and other Grammy winners.  Now it's time for a new album and we need your support to continue this genre not only for ourselves but for others. 

We have a bigger mission than recording music and touring just because we love it.  The 21st century is the century of humanity.  Our calling in this lifetime is to help create individual happiness one person at a time by uniting and reconnecting audiences to their humanity through the tool of music.  We are members of the International Committee of Artists for Peace (ICAP)  lead by Co-Presidents, Herbie Hancock and Wayne Shorter.  With your support we can continue this genre and continue the journey of our mission. 

The music business has changed so we must adapt and become more self-reliant.  To make an album is expensive.  We are looking to raise $18,000 for recording costs, mixing, mastering, CD replication and promotion. By making the cause to help us reach our goal, you are contributing to creating a more peaceful world.  We vote with our dollar so your contribution is voting for the music you want to hear.  We also have some really cool perks like, how about an authentic crepe dinner or cheese fondue dinner with us at our home? 

The new album is a step forward for us and hopefully will inspire others through our songs that relate to everyday life's ups and downs.  We LOVE to have fun yet creating value along with way.  In this adventure we want to include others to unite in our journey. 

There is a saying....."There is more strength in 1,000 people taking one step together than in one person taking 1,000 steps alone."   We hope you will be one of the "1,000".

From our hearts,

Tracy and Fabrice

THE VIGNATIS

story:
English is available down here!

Pour en savoir plus sur la pub à 5$

LES FOND SERVIRONT PRIORITAIREMENT POUR UN ORDINATEUR!!

Celui que j'ai, temporairement, pour le moment, ne me permet pas d’effectuer toutes les tâches liées à mon travail et à ce projet. Peut-importe si j'ai 7000$ ou pas, le plus important dans mon cœur est de réussir à remplacer ma machine. C'est essentiel pour travailler, étant travailleuse autonome exclusivement, c'est mon outil de travail. Un petit 5$ aide énormément. Je vous remercie de tout cœur de votre aide, ça compte beaucoup pour moi.  Je vous remercie de tout cœur de votre aide, ça compte beaucoup pour moi. Je veux plus que tout au monde travailler et vous offrir le meilleur de moi même. Mon but pour l'instant est de ramasser 1000$! C'est tout ce que j'ai besoin pour avoir une machine potable, assez puissante pour monter mes vidéos et travailler correctement! 

Merci beaucoup, je ne pourrai jamais vous remercier assez de votre soutiens. Sans vous , je suis rien,

Melissande

À propos de moi

Je m'appelle Melissande et je travaille dans le domaine du graphiste et du web depuis plus de 5 ans.



Cours par vidéo totalement gratuit! Chaque deux semaines je ferai aussi des cours de groupe en direct!! Je financement servira à lancer ce service et à le maintenir gratuit à jamais! 7000$ est le montant que j'aurai besoin pour 6 mois, afin de pouvoir travailler à temps plein sur le projet et de me procurer le matériel pour travailler efficacement. 


Ce que je ferai avec vos dons:


Les dons ce n'est pas gratuit! Choisissez un cadeau!! 

Pour chaque don, viens un cadeau! Que ce soit un t-shirt ou un cours privé, vous serez remercié comme vous le méritez. C'est un peu comme acheter en avance! Profitez du moment pour utiliser mes services!! 

English part!

About me

My name Melissande and I work in the field of graphic design and web for over 5 years.


Completely free video! Every two weeks I will also live group classes !! This funding will launch that service and keep it free forever! $ 7,000 is the amount I need for six months, in order to work full time on the project and to procure the equipment to work efficiently.


What i am going to do with the donations

Donations are not free! Choose a gift !!

For each donation, just a gift! Whether it's a t-shirt or a private course you will be thanked as you deserve. It's a bit like buying in advance! Enjoy the time, to use my services !!à


Les T-shirts - The T-shirts

story:
Our Campaign


The spacebetweenus is a living multi-media creative hub where inspired people work together to complete their creative mission.


Located at the intersection of 2 alleyways in downtown Toronto, "the Spacebetweenus" is a coach-house garage that houses the Vault Studio, a sound recording studio and production space, and a multi-media art studio. The band of musicians, painters, scientists, dancers, lovers and good people that keep this ship running are a kind of family, who show up for each other by creating real-time! We know our talents and we want to share them with this transforming world.

My name is Ayse Kapaklili. In my 27 years of life I have had a lot of very different experiences with people from all over the world and I have been trying to find a way to weave those experiences together, in a way that makes sense to me and that is beautiful. I have always had the unconditional support of my family and those closest to me. Their love is my glue! This foundation of unconditional love is what gives me the space and assurance to keep steady on my mission to keep the Spacebetweenus alive and kicking. 

As a painter and creative person, I am glad to be meeting and connecting with people who are on a similar wavelength. I want to take things to the next level and I need more support.

This summer I incorporated a sound studio into the Spacebetweenus. World renowned engineer Rasbagle di Dubscientis brings over 25 years of experience in Dub music to the studio. On his world tour as as head engineer, Front of House, with South African Theatre Production "UMOJA - The Spirit of Togetherness," the scientist tuned into a sound that people want to hear. His studio "The Vault" provides recording, mixing, editing, live-off-the floor services etc..

His long anticipated album "Rasbagle in Dub: Vol. 1" brings together artists from all over the world. Our vision is to launch the album in May 2016 and to bring this creation on tour, collaborating with other artists along the way.


What We Need & What You Get 

The immediate operating costs of the building have to be secured ($9000) first and very URGENTLY.

Next, we want to connect with more people, experiment with and create new media-mixes and invite more cross-disciplinary artistic collaboration into the Spacebetweenus and the Vault Studio.
You can join our movement on Indigogo by contributing to this campaign. The "perks" in our campaign are creations that are currently living in the Spacebetweenus: Ayse Kapaklili's paintings and drawings, Rasbagle di Dubscientis's sound and tickets to the shows, dances and events that we mobilize around.


*SHARE* your strength

This collaboration between the Vault Studio and the Spacebetweenus is valuable to the world because it is unafraid. We create without fear because we love what we do. I know that when I am doing things that come from my soul, the world is a better place.

The perks in this campaign are investments into our creative works. Your financial contribution is fuel and encouragement to keep us moving. I want to keep you updated on all of the positive feedback we are getting so please stay in touch via social media.

If we receive more than we are asking for on this campaign, your strength will be put towards launching the instrumental dub album and organizing more artistic collaborations and events at the Spacebetweenus. 


Potential obstacles

We can't fail on this mission because we have a clear vision and everything that we do is towards bringing our creations to the world. You might be surprised what we can create together.

The biggest challenge for me, is humbling to the creative process.  I try to remember that others are alike in that we are our own biggest obstacles.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can connect with our work by following the links provided and get updates right here on Indigogo. 

If you like what #indigogo is doing by hosting us in THEIR space, please share this link however your social media platforms: Whether it's by adding the link to your e-mail signature, tagging our campaign on social media, or posting our links through your other outlets - sharing is our fuel and our strength!

Indigogo has handy share tools that will make this campaign reach the world! Pretty amazing times we are living...


Thank you 

for hearing 

our message.


Love to the world.

Ayse :)

story:
Who We Are

Hi there!

Erin Accomando here, the lead vocalist of ELSIE BINX! As some of you know, I've been working on this project for almost 2 years now. I began the recording process of my "solo" album in January 2015 and it became something much larger than myself, and much larger than I intended. I ran crowdfunding campaigns in April and July of  2015, and managed to raise a total of $9,000 to go toward production of the album. We were able to release the debut album in October 2015 and thus began the band, ELSIE BINX.

Since then, we've been writing new music and are finally ready to begin the process of recording our second album entitled "That's What She Said".

Now, we've already worked on the album for 4 days, having gotten all the drum tracks complete, along with some bass and guitar tracking done as well. Kevin (our producer & engineer) is taking the hit for now, but we are counting on our friends and family to get us through this one. Let me break it down a little bit more...

What We Need

So we've done the math and this is what we'll need:
  • Recording/Mixing: 11 songs @ $500/ea = $5500
  • Other Musicians: (Strings, Keys, Organ, etc.) = $700 (or more)
  • Mastering: 11 songs @ $75/ea = $825
  • Distribution: Internet Streaming = $100
  • Printing CDs: $600 (or more)
  • Album Artwork: $300 (or more)
  • Licensing: $200
  • Merchandise: New T-shirts, lighters & hats = $900
  • Indiegogo 5% Fee : $10,000 x 5% = $500
With just those expenses, the total is over $9500, and I'm sure there's more that I'm not thinking of at the moment.
To put it simply though, if every one of our Facebook fans donates just $10, we'd raise $16,000. Can you imagine what we could do with that kind of funding?! We can...

What You Get

Please take a look at all the perks listed on the right side of this campaign page! When you donate just $10, you'll get the digital copy of the album before ANYONE else! And the perks just keep getting better! $20 is the digital album plus the physical CD! The list goes on and on... The bottom line is that if you donate ANYTHING at all, you're going to get a thank you from us, from the bottom of our BINXIE hearts!

The Impact 

So you may be wondering, "Why should I donate to this project?" 

My answer to you is this: it's all of our dreams (everyone in the band) to do this big. We want to go on the road, and we want to make this band our lives. I mean, this band already IS our lives. We want to use any fame or fortune toward bettering ourselves and society. We want to spread good music and love around the world. We're good people with big dreams, and only you can help us accomplish those goals.


Risks & Challenges

Since we've already begun the recording process, there is a built-in risk here. We already owe money toward studio time, merchandise and artwork. We've invested countless hours toward rehearsal, writing, and production, all working toward the common goal of making ELSIE BINX "happen". 

This campaign is 'flexible', which means we will still get the funds we raise, even if it's not $10,000. But if we don't raise that much, it will seriously hinder how much work we can do and how quickly we can do it, and Indiegogo still takes 5% of whatever we do raise. It's up to you to get us to $10,000 in 14 days!


Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that not everyone can afford to donate; trust us, we're the ones asking for your help! If you aren't able donate, please spread this campaign around your favorite social media websites, and come support us at our shows! Invite your friends and family to like our Facebook page and that's it! You never know who might see us!

Thank you for your support. We can't do what we love and get it out into the world without you ❤️

story:
Greetings community, 

A bike journey of a thousand miles begins with a single revolution.

Our Story:

This summer, we’re touring the pacific northwest from Vancouver to the bay - twenty of us, 3 bands, sound engineers, dancers, painters, puppeteers, clowns, and jugglers, all on bikes!  

The Pleasant Revolution has been putting on musical bike tours from 2008-2014, traveling through The Americas, and Europe.  More than a bike tour or music festival, this project has been the inception of a movement for an evolving culture of transportation cycling, renewable power, and greener music/community events. The entire experience is all human powered by setting up our bikes on stage, connecting them to generators, and having audience members pedal to power the system.  This summer 2016 our crew will pick up their torch as the next generation of Pleasant Revolutionaries!  

For the past three years we have been organizing bike tours from California through Mexico.  On these tours we have carried all our musical equipment on bikes, but wherever we played, we had to rely on electricity.  This year, we hope to abolish our dependence on external energy sources by purchasing a pedal-powered sound system from the good people of Rock the Bike, a Bay Area based small business who’s been working for years to develop a sound system which runs completely off of kinetic energy generated by people riding bikes.  

Purchasing a sound system from Rock the Bike not only supports their ingenuity and innovation, it also allows us to share our message in the most authentic way possible.  

Your donation:

By donating to this summers Pleasant Revolution Tour you will aid in supplementing the cost of our two month bike tour; this includes cargo bikes, touring gear, musical equipment, food, camping and ferry fees.

Cost breakdown:

3 bike Pedal Powered sound system: $10,000
Nesting Drum Kit: $2,600
2 E-bikes: $2,000
4 Cargo Bikes: $4,000
Ferries: $200
Food, gear, maintenance for twenty people over 2.5 months: $6,000

Why we need you!

Bike touring, and performing with a pedal powered sound system is 100%  community effort, which is only possible with your support.  Not only are we learning to live through alternative means, we are also realizing the power of a group of passionate people joining together to accomplish magnanimous feats.  Every donation counts, even a small amount will get us one pedal closer to our goal.  Please follow us, share our story with your friends and loved ones, and donate if you can.  We are so grateful to you, our conscious community, for helping to create the vibrant fuel free world that future we all deserve.

story:
Support Nawather to do their first video clip

Hi everybody! Thanks for checking out our indiegogo campaign !

For those who aren't familiar with our band :

We are  Nawather an oriental metal band from Tunisia .We have released  our first album ''wasted years'' . The album is out since 8th January  2016 .

We need to raise a budget of 2500€, in order to be able to realize our first video clip . In return, We have really cool stuff for you such as :

Nawather 's  t-shirts, cds, Stickers, posters ...

Other Ways You Can Help :

We know that not everyone can contribute financially to this campaign, but it doesn’t mean you can’t help in other ways. By sharing this page on social networks and spreading the word, we will be able to reach our  goals.

Informations about Nawather :

From the land of Carthage and Hannibal came...

A mixture of oriental and metal you will discover...

The spirit of a revolutionary songs you will hear

It 's '' wasted year'' : Nawather's debut album

A new beginning , a new sensation ....

Feelings  we hope to share them together

Metal and oriental like you have never heard them before

A kind of mixture that will take you to another world, to another frontier...


Nawather is an Oriental Metal band from Tunisia.
Formed in 2013 by Raouf Jelassi (Occulta, Agony’s serenades) and Hichem Ben Amara (Occulta, Melmoth, Out Body Experience, Agony’s serenades) and has been joined by Ryma vocals, Yazid (ex Melmoth) on guitar , Saif (ex Myrath) drums and Nidhal Jaoua: Qanun
In 2014 NAWATHER started the record of their first album ''Wasted years ''

In the 1st of may 2015 NAWATHER  finished mixing and mastering the album ''Wasted years''.

In october 2015 the band signed a deal with the label  M & O music for promotion and distribution .


''Wasted years ''  :

Mixed , Engineered By  Zachary Spence At Capital Arts Productions - Canada  .

Mastered  By Derek Moffat At 608 Studios - USA 

Album  Artwork By Bader Klidi - Tunisia  

Photos : Seth Photography.


Extracts of  ''Wasted years '' reviews :

''Attention, album unique, fortement destiné à devenir mythique avec le temps! ... Le premier album des Tunisiens de NAWATHER est une pure merveille, et presque parangon de la rencontre des influences orientales et occidentales...''

  ( Metal and Oddities )

''... NAWATHER s'impose comme le fer de lance d'un courant de métissage terriblement pénétrant. Et croyez moi, malgré son titre, Wasted Years ne vous fera pas perdre votre temps. Il stimulera votre imaginaire, et vous emmènera si loin qu'il vous faudra plus de mille et une nuits pour en revenir. ''

  (  Metal and Oddities  )

''... Jouissant d’une excellent production, Wasted Years a tout pour devenir un des meilleurs albums de 2016 et ce, même si l’année vient à peine de commencer. Le talent des musiciens est là, les guitares sont excellentes, la rythmique basse/batterie est solidement ancrée et les voix tant féminines que gutturales sont en parfaite symbiose avec la musique de Nawather.

Un excellent album à découvrir en ce début d’année pour ceux qui n’ont pas froid aux yeux et qui souhaitent pimenter leur Métal et s’ouvrir l’esprit pour découvrir un monde fascinant. '' 

  Note 9/10  ( hurlemort.com )

'' ...Dès son premier effort, Nawather est parvenu à se faire une place de choix à la table des « grands » du metal oriental...''

  (  The unchained .net  )

''... je ne peux que vivement vous recommander de vous jeter sur ce délicieux album qui prouve une nouvelle que le Metal apporte beaucoup à cette Culture, mais surtout que cette Culture continue d’apporter énormément au Metal…''

  (  The unchained .net  )

''...De la technique, un chant à la dualité parfaitement rendue (si l’osmose est la même sur scène, j’ai hâte de voir ce que ça peu donner), des riffs à la frontière du prog et du métal, des influences orientales clairement assumées et maîtrisées… La grande classe !''

  Note  8/10  (  Soil Chronicles  )

''...Rares sont les occasions de découvrir ce genre de talent, mais là, ces mélanges réussissent à créer un album qui nous scotch et nous hypnotise du début à la fin !''

  (  Musique Alliance  )

''... Pour un premier album, Nawather a réussi à se forger un style incomparable et qui évite le cliché même du groupe de musique orientale.''

  Note  9.5/10  (  Valkyries webzine)

''...The game of contrasts on Wasted Years has a very intriguing appeal, and I really do like to repeatedly listen to the playful parts, as can be heard on Defnouna and Succubus Romance, for instance...''

  9/10  (  Disagreement.net  )

''... Un premier album très intéressant dans le sens où il leur ouvre d’emblée une voie nouvelle, loin de tout ce qui se fait déjà. Ils peuvent s’appuyer sur les compostions réussies et variées, sur deux chanteurs qui maîtrisent leur sujet et des musiciens qui n’en montrent pas moins. Avec ces ingrédients, il y a de quoi conquérir le monde, charmer et faire bouger les lignes...''

  (  Sons Of Metal Webzine  )

''... I will say that this is well worth checking out if you want to hear something a little different...''

  (Ravenheart Music)

''... Inutile de vous dire qu'une nouvelle vague est sur le point de naître ! Le renouveau  du Metal est en marche ! ''

  (  Metal Cunt  )

''...Changebale Tempo, Abstract Compotition, Amazing Middle Eastern sound & Great Beauty and the Beast Vocals. Progressive Death Metal Album with Female Vocals and Middle Eastern Folk Instrument. This’s Masterpiece from Tunisia.''

Score: 100%, Masterpiece.  (  BDP Metal  )

''...En résumé, on a avec "Wasted Years" un des albums les plus intéressants de la fin d’année 2015 / début 2016, un album où se mêle héritage ancestral, culture orientale et modernité. Un plaisir musical...''

  (  french-metal.com  )

''... Un disque tout simplement fantastique, qui prouve que le meilleur des métal ne vient pas forcément d'où on l'attend !  Encore un fav'2016 pour ma part...''

  (  Nawakposse  )

story:
My name is Shawn Tolley and I am a digital artist, composer, and educator living in Spokane, WA.  Recently I was commissioned to turn a house into a digital art space making use of interactive art works and electronic music.  This represents a turning point for me as a composer and digital artist since it is my first large scale solo gallery presentation.  I have been working in the field of digital arts for many years both as an artist and advocate.  My works cover the spectrum from fixed media electronic music to interactive digital music spaces to computer controlled textile art works.  In my work as an elementary general music teacher I have instituted clubs in digital arts that bring technology, maker culture, and experimental art to the 4-6 graders in my school.  This campaign will cover the purchase of a 3D printer which will be my main means of fabrication and the components necessary to build the first art piece.  The piece will be made of three LED panels that can be controlled by the viewer.  As viewers rotate the panel, they will change colors of the LEDs and adjust the overall music of the room.  If I am able to build this first art work I can use it as a means of demonstrating my concept and raising the funds necessary to build the six other pieces.

I will be needing $1,800 total for this campaign.  The money will be used to purchase an Afinia 3D printer and the different types of filaments that I will need (including natural, conductive, and clear), as well as the LED Panels, accelerometers, gyroscopes, magnetometers, wireless x-bees, and even more.  To thank you for your contribution I am offering a range of perks including 3D prints in many sizes (either designed by me or of your own choice), custom songs, digital art pieces, chances to see and help me test the products before the show if you live in Spokane or do a digital walkthrough of the show, and even possibly a Makey Makey controlled conductive instrument!  If I do not meet my funding goal then the money raised will be used as seed money to get as much of the supplies as I can and to save for the 3D printer purchase which is the most expensive and necessary.

This campaign will help to introduce Spokane to the concepts of digital and experimental arts (DXArts) and increase interest in interactive electronic music.  As technology continues to expand, the world of art and music is in need of a movement toward more interactive and digitally integrated art works.  DXArts represents a group of artists trying to integrate technology more directly into their art to capture this growing interest in technology.  Last year I created an electronic music piece that gave the computer the ability to make decisions about when to perform sounds, analyze the music that was playing, and choose melodic ideas to play back.  This music interacted with a textile art piece telling the integrate fiberoptic fabric and sewn LEDs, when to light up.  Currently, I am finishing a globally interactive graphic score which will make use of online computer programs and Twitter.  Large and experimental projects like this always run risks though.  In this particular case, there is a large amount of engineering and planning that must be put into the piece to be certain that it will work as planned.  While I have the experience and knowledge to make each interactive art piece work it is possible that the overall scope of the project may be more then I am betting on.  To overcome this hurdle I am planning to build each piece one at a time and test them rigorously prior to any performance is set.  Should there be a problem with running the whole gallery simultaneously that I cannot work out, I will enlist the help of other maker friends of mine to troubleshoot.  If you are unable to help me fund this project please help me by spreading the word; talk about my campaign with friends, share on social networks, use the Indiegogo tools.  Honestly, anything that you can do to help me achieve this goal is so appreciated and hopefully you can come and see the performance when it opens.

story:
No Place Like Home 

Hey my name is Jason Jet and I am so excited about the future. For years, it has been a dream to shoot a music video at a skating rink in the community I grew up in.  This event is open to all ages. Well the time has finally come. On June 5 my team, band and you will help bring this dream to life. Not only will it be a Music Video Shoot, we'll be performing a concert as well!  For every contributor to this project I hold the deepest gratitude! THANK YOU! 


What We Have, Need & What You Get 

Up until now I have been blessed with the knowledge and capacity to be completely in-house for all of my production, live events and videos all without a Record Label. What We Already Have So Far:

  • Full Sound System and Lights (not including operators)
  • All Band Instruments
  • 1 Videographer 
  • 3 Team Members
  • CD Masters Ready, T-shirt, Poster Designs
  • Minimal Props and Decor
  • Fashion and Makeup Connections

However with where we are going, the vision is too BIG for me to manhandle everything on my own. This is where your support comes in!  

To Make This Experience Incredible We Need:

  • Kates Skating Rink $600
  • Extra Camera Man and Gear $500
  • Lights and Sound Operator $400
  • Band $500
  • Team of 7-10 individuals $500
  • Props and Decor $500
  • Fashion and Makeup $500
  • Strong Marketing Campaign  $ 1500
  • Merchandise(CD's, T-shirts, Posters, and more) $2000
Any donations toward this Fundraiser are appreciated. All of the Funds will go to making this Project AMAZING!!!!


Just A Few Rewards

Albums
Love Boulevard + Bonus Tracks

The Great Escape Pt. 1, 2, 3, 4



Apparel



Posters

and much more...


The Impact

Part of proceeds from my cd sales that night will go to T.I.M.E. A non-profit organization centered around revitalizing families and the community. 

The beautiful thing about this event is that its about the community. Its not me who makes this event special. Its you guys. In performing at public schools in CMS, it is obvious that many children have not been exposed to live music before.  We want to curate and influence change with the "Up All Nite Skate Concert/Music Video Shoot". 

I will say that formula has been working. My most recent success was in hosting an Open Mic in Uptown Charlotte in which we reached over 800 People! 

This Project is the biggest event I will have hosted so far.  I believe with the right pieces in place it will be a major success.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to be a part of the team that night please email us at info.teamjet@gmail.com

To help push this campaign: Please share it on your social media pages along with the flyer! Its going to be epic! Once again thank you for your time and support! 

You Rock!

Jason Jet

RSVP AT JETSKATEPARTY.EVENTBRITE.COM

story:
The Gist

  • We are Stabby Unicorn. We formed in 2012 and have released one album to date.
  • We need your help to put out our next release. We recorded Leland at the beginning of this year. It's a four song ep to be released on 7" vinyl and digitally.
  • Your contribution will help us cover expenses for pressing vinyl, as well as 4 videos, artwork, and merchandise . We could just release it online but we wanted to offer a tangible piece of art that you can hold in your hands.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $2000 to cover the cost of pressing, art, packaging and marketing.
  • You can donate any amount you like. For instance if you donate $5 you get a free download of all 4 songs. $10 gets you a vinyl copy. For those of you who are super generous, donate $250 and get the vinyl, a tshirt, download code, dinner cooked by the band, and a private concert for you and 10 of your friends.
  • If we don't reach our goal. No sweat, we get the money we raised and will look for other ways to raise the rest.

The Impact

  • We are proud of these recordings and the production done at Dog Water Studios. We are excited to make you a part of bringing it to life. Also, we're very excited to be working with local artists and directors on this multimedia project.
  • The money you donate not only helps us but a other Reno artists.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't show your support with a donation, please get the word out by sharing this campaign with all of your friends and often.
  • Use the indiegogo share buttons

story:
The South London Military Wives Choir are delighted to be hosting their first concert on 7th May 2016! Join us for an evening of glorious music, introduced by the ladies themselves.

This page has been set up to bring our fundraising plight and ticket sales to a wider audience. The concert in itself is incurring cost to us,  as well as the day to day running cost of the choir.

We need to raise money to pay for things like hall hire, music hire and purchasing, MD and accompanist costs, our fabulous pashminas and corsages and more...

If you would like to help us, please see the various options for sponsorship below.

We look forward to seeing and welcoming you all to our concert on May 7th!

story:
Help us bring you Porchfest!

Porchfest! LNK is a free, all-ages, community music festival coming to the Capitol area neighborhood on August 7th. This festival will showcase the vibrant music and cultural scene that has its roots in the Near South. Help us make a splash in our first year!

Bands will play daytime sets on the porches of individual residences for the free and open enjoyment of everyone in the neighborhood. This is a great way to get to know your neighbors, your local music scene, and the neighborhood itself!

It's free! Why raise money?

Our priority is a safe, clean, family friendly public festival. In order to provide this most effectively, we will need: 

  • City permits and street closures (if necessary)
  • Promotional materials
  • Public restrooms
  • Zero waste recycling facilities
  • Childcare
  • Space for food trucks and other amenities

What does Porchfest! bring to our community?

  • Lincoln's first annual Porchfest! will showcase local musical and artistic talent.
  • Porchfest! LNK will encourage people to engage their neighbors and become familiar with local performers.  
  • Common Root, our presenting nonprofit, regularly organizes free, recurring community events and festivals, including Fall for Pride and Free Saturday.
  • Common Root and Porchfest! LNK are committed to a safe, inclusive, friendly festival that promotes local culture.

Why do we need your help?

As a free festival that centers the community, Porchfest! LNK is only possible with the involvement of people in our neighborhoods. Help us provide: 

  • Performances by bands that represent the Capitol area neighborhood
  • Food trucks for participants and attendees
  • Public restrooms for your safety and comfort
  • Fees associated with insurance and permit requirements

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? That's okay! Here's how you can make Porchfest! happen:

  • Spread the word: encourage people to attend fundraising shows and to support local music in general! 
  • Volunteer to canvas or to staff the event!
  • Have another idea? Contact porchfestlnk@gmail.com and let's talk!

story:
It's been A hard Days Night, And I've Been Playing Playing like a dog, But at the end of the day We Rock The World!

No More No Less but 200 Live dates, Busking +Gigs a Year.

  • Ever Since I was  young Boy I tried to play guitar.
  • Last Few Years I'm Intesively on the road, Mostly Europe and US. Its Great Opportunity To See So many Great Cities and Meet all this Wonderful Folks! You Know Who you are! On that Road Are some UP's an some Down's
  • Gains: You Go around Many Cities, Make Living as Musician.
  •  Downs: Less Time for Family, Friends, Studio Work.
  • NOW ITS ABOUT TIME to MAKE...NEW ALBUM....PERIOD.
  • Need To Sit down and Focus and Finish The Work.
  • Your Support Will help Me Get Into My Creative Moment And Focus on Finishing and producing songs.

AND I HOPE WE ALL GONNA LIKE IT!

Well Well Well

  • We Need 5K fo Now To secure Sudio times, Production,
  • Its Gonna be  lots of home work too...
  • To be honest, I think we lost all that sense o Album release. We Need to get together and stay Strong.
  • Whatever Gets us Trough The Night Gonna See the Light Of The day!

One More Cup Off Coffee for the Road

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • I ask Myself often Why No More Albums Like Revolver, Dark Side Of The Moon, Blonde On Blonde, Whats The Story Morning Glory, Why Not ry To Bring Concept album Back?
  • We Have 5 albums Released, entered Into Grammy's 3 years.
  • New Album Suppose To reach Much more audience and Help Me Sell Music more effectively, While Touring. and is....Long...Due...
  • This is Good Way To Consolidate and Finish the Work.

Risks & Challenges

There are always Risks , but there also Commitments, To finish the project.

  • Time could be an issue, But with proper scheduling,
  • Project will be finished in proximate time frame .

Other Ways You Can Help

  • SPREAD THE WORD and ROCK THE WOLD!
  • Please use All Sharing tools

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

We are Deathrow Bodeen, a groove oriented rock n roll band from the east Texas region and we are looking to record our debut full length album. We have been playing and writing music on a combined level of twenty plus years and this project has been running strong since it hit the ground in 2014. We have been playing shows in Texas and have been sharing stages with local, regional and national acts. Now the time has come for the next phase of the band. The campaign is a modest approach to cover the expense of the studio, the pressing, and the art work to deliver the full complete package for you. It would mean the world to Deathrow Bodeen if we could meet this goal with your help: the fans, the family, and the those that love the art of music.

What We Need & What You Get

Deathrow Bodeen is seeking a goal of $4000.00

This $4000.00 will cover the studio time, the pressing via hard copy and digital as well as the artwork so it looks all snazzy and the limited pressing of merchandise.

The perks, if you choose to donate will include:  your name in the liner notes of the album, a digital download of the record, a pressed copy of the record, an autographed poster and a founding member exclusive limited run T shirt, autographed drum head, picks, sticks, setlist.  A personal handwritten lyric book to you the mega fan and a personal note from each member. A private show within a 200 mile radius and In the ultra fan pack autographed Charvel guitar that has been played by the band on stage.

The Impact

Your contribution will allow us to complete the first of many goals we have set for the year of 2016. This album will open more doors for us as artists and as a band to take it to the next level and deliver a professional product.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge will occur if we fall short of our goal.  We've got a lot of great people willing to help us out at great prices, we just need to be able to meet those prices.  If we fall short, we will still meet and fulfill the perks - the timeline will just take longer.  Right now we're hoping for a September release, but that all hinges on a successful campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate please help us spread the word on our campaign. You can still help in a huge way and thank you for your support.


UPDATE:  ALBUM ARTWORK!

We've completed our album concept artwork with renown artist Tony Midi.  Check it out!

story:
Part 1 has ended however Part 2 now Part 3 of the project is alive and well to keep this heartfelt mission alive

 

GONE TOO SOON

Have you ever wanted to share your talents with the world? What if you never had a chance to? My uncle and godfather Daniel Coulanges described as, "The world's finest guitarist" died at the young age of 28 years old on April 30th, 1989 of HIV/AIDS. At that time it was a death sentence. Today with early testing and medicine many are living and thriving with HIV/AIDS. 

Daniel never had an opportunity to share his talents with the world. Thanks to my other uncle Amos Coulanges, he was able to get rare footage of his late baby brother Daniel performing. This video is a Daniel's cover of "Killing Me Softly." With that rare footage I was able to extract the audio. However, I need your help from there. With your pledges I am confident we will able to fully commit and complete this project. The project includes

  • Digital copy of World's Finest (Live Performance in New York) album 
  • Physical copy of World's Finest (Live Performance in New York) album 
  • World's Finest guitar pick 
  • Poster
  • A World's Finest t-shirt of your own
  • Credit on the Album
  • Executive Producer credit
  • Digital Download Film of Daniel's Performance in Concert)

WITH YOUR HELP

By backing this project, it will give us the necessary funding to do three things:

1. For professional mastering. We are aiming high and will have this album mastered professionally for your listening pleasure 

2. For production. Once the album is complete, the funding you provide will allow us to bring the album into production and distribution. We have always made sure our albums are packaged beautifully & we want to maintain that standard. We will be fulfilling the orders of the t-shirts, posters and cd's

3. Wonderful graphic design. Because we are working with aged images we want those images to be restored and the graphics and text to be professional done as possible and your funding will help us get there.

4. Editing the concert video. Editing the aged footage will take some time and with your pledges the editing will be done and distributed to you to enjoy watching over and over again

With your pledges I am confident we will support this project fully funded 

Preview of the Album Tracklists

1. Daniel First Movement 

2. Daniel's Second Movement  

3. Daniel's Third Movement  

4. Daniel's Fourth Movement  

5. Daniel's Fifth Movement  

6. Daniel's Sixth Movement  

7. Daniel's Seventh Movement  

8. Daniel's Eighth Movement  

9. Killing Me Softly  (Cover)

10. Daniel's Tenth Movement  

11.  Don't Cry for Me Argentina  (Cover)

12. Daniel's Twelfth Movement  

13. Daniel's Thirteenth Movement  

14. Daniel Coulanges Nan Fon Bwa (made famous by Amos Coulanges) 

15. Daniel's Fifteenth Movement 

16. Daniel's Sixteenth Movement  

17. Daniel's Seventeenth Movement  

18. Daniel's Eighteenth Movement  

ONE LAST THING

I encourage everyone reading this to pursue your passion intentionally with purpose because if you don't no one else will. No one is promised tomorrow so why not pursue your passion with the natural gifts that you've been given right NOW.

To paraphrase a conversation I recently had with someone. We are killing ourselves softly with each moment that passes when we don't at least attempt to express and share our talents with each other. But letting your light shine you unknowingly inspire others to shine their lights as well. It is never to late until it is.

 

Risks and challenges

The risk and challenges that come with completing this project is not getting the funds to produce the album in a professional manner. With your pledges I am confident we will support this project fully funded
