story:
the Project

Hello! My name is Joshuah Noah Snel, I'm an aspiring artist trying to fulfill my goal of creating and releasing my first ever studio album! I was born and raised in Redding, a small town in northern California, and since birth have always desired to add my artistic innovative mark to the world. I recently moved to Southern California in order to further pursue my passions and gain a successful career. I'm here on Indiegogo to promote and gather support for just that! With your help, I can finally be able to share my music and passion on a significantly larger scale. Having a complete album is not only a magnificent accomplishment for myself and my supporters but, also gives a stronger value towards my career when finding venues to perform at for the future touring I intend to do.

 

How You Can Help!

The goal is to raise $2,000 for the creation of the album. All the money raised will go directly into paying for the the total cost of the process and make of the album. If the $2,000 goal is exceeded, the rest of the money will go towards making  professional music videos for the album or a community help foundation of my choosing. The sooner the goal is met, the faster I can bring you a fresh palate of music for you to listen to! A shared win win project that helps  make my dream become a reality and provides you with an engaging heart felt body of music. Let's do this!

Below is the first of many songs that would be on the album. If you like it and want to here more please donate so I can get back into the recording studio to make it for you! Donors will also get exclusive snipets of the songs on the album as the production progresses.

 

Other Ways You Can Support

It's Been a Long (at times) difficult road to get to where I am today with the opportunity before me, even though I'm still at the beginnings of my singing career. But, I am so thankful for you and all my supporters for helping where you can and believing in me. From the bottom of my heart, thank you.

Feel free to look up my youtube channel and facebook page for updates and cover songs under, Joshuah Noah snel. You can also support and follow my journey on instagram @joshuah.noah.snel

story:
Who?

Sebastian Francis is a musician and event coordinator responsible for creating the event #SoSoulSundays (https://sosoulsundays.splashthat.com) in the thriving arts district of DTLA. "Still Dreamin" is more than a project of songs, its a lifestyle. Sebastian has had his equipment stolen twice over the past 8 years, which has caused him to have to start from nothing on more than one occasion. This tour is about inspiring people to continue pursuing their dreams regardless of the setbacks that cause people to give up in life. He has been homeless, sleeping on streets, while maintaing a job, and still he presses forward with the belief that he will change lives once given the major label platform.

 

Back Story:

Sebastian started his career in music in 2007 when he decided to download FL Studios, a music production program, that taught him how to make beats. Upon graduating high school, in June 2007, Sebastian was undecided about the course his life would take and if he should attend college. With the encouragement of his family, he decided to apply to Columbia College Chicago's Music Business Management program with a concentration in Music Production.   

This is where it all began. With the excitement of living in a brand new city, with no friends or family, Sebastian quickly adapted to the change of scene and was introduced to the music industry for the first time. Here is where he developed life long relationships, which have played a major part in his journey, as he is now living in Los Angeles, California. 

A few of the people he met were a group of musicians that had been in Chicago, and had already made a name for themselves, "THEMPeople." Sebastian had a desire to learn, and members of the group openly welcomed him into their family of music, and this was a pivotal point in his life. "THEMPeople" have been responsible for a lot of the music that has come out of Chicago. They produced/recorded a few tracks on Chance The Rapper's debut project, "10 day," the Mick Jenkins "Waves" project, and a plethora of other artists from Vic Mensa to BJ the Chicago Kid.

In 2014, Sebastian Francis was offered the opportunity to move to Los Angeles. With all of the knowledge and experience he gained in Chicago, he applied what he learned and started releasing music and creating waves on the west coast. Having produced for Nuri Hazzard, THEMPeople, Gyasi Kamau, Raliq Bashard, and many others, his reach has spread from LA to Chicago, New York and DC. With him now focusing on himself as an artist, he started a project series called "Still Dreamin," which he started releasing in summer of 2015. Since then, he has made great strides in his career. From landing interviews and shows with some of the best up and coming Indie platforms, such as Prime TV, Indie Syn, and RAW Artist, Sebastian is on the brink of crossing the threshold and becoming a major label artist. He is also the owner of his own production company, "So S.O.U.L. Productions."

 

       The mission statement of the brand, "So S.O.U.L. Productions," that Sebastian incorporated is to "create opportunities for those that will create opportunities for others."  The "Soul" in So S.O.U.L stands for "Sharing Our Universal Love." Sebastian has geared all of his efforts towards helping out the community of artists he has been involved in since he started in Chicago. Now in LA, #SoSoulSundays is becoming one of the premier events in DTLA for up and coming talent and Sebastian has ambitions of making it a yearly festival on the level of "Made in America" and "OVO Fest."

 

RAW ARTIST SHOW FROM JAN. 2016:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=epvYXDWfw1I

 

What We Need & What You Get

For those that know Sebastian personally, know that he doesn't like asking for help but there comes a time in life when you have to do away with your pride. It only stifles your growth.  The reason that we would need $6300,  would be to cover travel costs for myself, my photographer (Chandler Cadet - https://www.instagram.com/lets.reflect/), and my backup singer (Skyler Reed - http://www.skylerreed.com).

 

 

Here is a breakdown of our expenses.

 

Sebastian will continue to showcase his growth as a man and an artist. Your contributions will mean the world to him and his team. He have told my photographer multiple times since we met, to be ready for the that phone call when its time to go on tour. This is that time. The reason he is on this path of being a musician is much bigger than him, and to have people travel overseas with him to see a different part of the world and experience a new culture will definitely inspire everyone to push the envelope of they're creativity. 

 

PERKS

You can also donate and receive any chapter (digital release) of Still Dreamin of your choice for $10 and a "Still Dreamin Experience DVD" for $20 which includes his documentary from New York and his full 30 minute show with RAW Artist from January 14th, 2016.

 

For $75, you will receive a Deluxe package which includes, "Still Dreamin: The Novel" which includes all 4 chapters of "Still Dreamin" and an autographed poster, handwritten thank you note and the "Still Dreamin Experience DVD" . 

 

Luxury Perks:

Donations of  $100 or more gets you VIP access to shows, shout outs on Sebastian's personal instagram page as well as his So Soul Sundays events, the Deluxe Package, and a 2 hour studio session for musicians or a 30 minute Skype performance for music enthusiasts.

 

With your help, Sebastian and his team will reach they're goal and will document the entire trip for you all to see!

 

 

He is currently waiting to hear back from a few venues to add more dates so we will keep you posted, here is what we have so far!

 

 

Dates:

Nov. 27th - #SoSoulSundays

Dec. 1st - Raw Artists Show (https://www.rawartists.org/newcastle/motif)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Please feel free to share this campaign, support the music and follow his social media pages!

 

Www.Sebastianfmusic.com

https://soundcloud.com/sebastianfmusic

https://www.instagram.com/sosoulsundays/

https://www.instagram.com/sebastianfmusic/

https://twitter.com/Sebastianfmusic

A few of the people he met were a group of musicians that had been in Chicago, and had already made a name for themselves, "THEMPeople." Sebastian had a desire to learn, and members of the group openly welcomed him into their family of music, and this was a pivotal point in his life. "THEMPeople" have been responsible for a lot of the music that has come out of Chicago. They produced/recorded a few tracks on Chance The Rapper's debut project, "10 day," the Mick Jenkins "Waves" project, and a plethora of other artists from Vic Mensa to BJ the Chicago Kid.
In 2014, Sebastian Francis was offered the opportunity to move to Los Angeles. With all of the knowledge and experience he gained in Chicago, he applied what he learned and started releasing music and creating waves on the west coast. Having produced for Nuri Hazzard, THEMPeople, Gyasi Kamau, Raliq Bashard, and many others, his reach has spread from LA to Chicago, New York and DC. With him now focusing on himself as an artist, he started a project series called "Still Dreamin," which he started releasing in summer of 2015. Since then, he has made great strides in his career. From landing interviews and shows with some of the best up and coming Indie platforms, such as Prime TV, Indie Syn, and RAW Artist, Sebastian is on the brink of crossing the threshold and becoming a major label artist. He is also the owner of his own production company, "So S.O.U.L. Productions."
 
       The mission statement of the brand, "So S.O.U.L. Productions," that Sebastian incorporated is to "create opportunities for those that will create opportunities for others."  The "Soul" in So S.O.U.L stands for "Sharing Our Universal Love." Sebastian has geared all of his efforts towards helping out the community of artists he has been involved in since he started in Chicago. Now in LA, #SoSoulSundays is becoming one of the premier events in DTLA for up and coming talent and Sebastian has ambitions of making it a yearly festival on the level of "Made in America" and "OVO Fest."
 
RAW ARTIST SHOW FROM JAN. 2016:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=epvYXDWfw1I
 
What We Need & What You Get

For those that know Sebastian personally, know that he doesn't like asking for help but there comes a time in life when you have to do away with your pride. It only stifles your growth.  The reason that we would need $6300,  would be to cover travel costs for myself, my photographer (Chandler Cadet - https://www.instagram.com/lets.reflect/), and my backup singer (Skyler Reed - http://www.skylerreed.com).
 
 
Here is a breakdown of our expenses.

 
Sebastian will continue to showcase his growth as a man and an artist. Your contributions will mean the world to him and his team. He have told my photographer multiple times since we met, to be ready for the that phone call when its time to go on tour. This is that time. The reason he is on this path of being a musician is much bigger than him, and to have people travel overseas with him to see a different part of the world and experience a new culture will definitely inspire everyone to push the envelope of they're creativity. 
 
PERKS
You can also donate and receive any chapter (digital release) of Still Dreamin of your choice for $10 and a "Still Dreamin Experience DVD" for $20 which includes his documentary from New York and his full 30 minute show with RAW Artist from January 14th, 2016.
 
For $75, you will receive a Deluxe package which includes, "Still Dreamin: The Novel" which includes all 4 chapters of "Still Dreamin" and an autographed poster, handwritten thank you note and the "Still Dreamin Experience DVD" . 
 
Luxury Perks:
Donations of  $100 or more gets you VIP access to shows, shout outs on Sebastian's personal instagram page as well as his So Soul Sundays events, the Deluxe Package, and a 2 hour studio session for musicians or a 30 minute Skype performance for music enthusiasts.
 
With your help, Sebastian and his team will reach they're goal and will document the entire trip for you all to see!
 
 
He is currently waiting to hear back from a few venues to add more dates so we will keep you posted, here is what we have so far!
 
 
Dates:
Nov. 27th - #SoSoulSundays
Dec. 1st - Raw Artists Show (https://www.rawartists.org/newcastle/motif)
 
Other Ways You Can Help
 
Please feel free to share this campaign, support the music and follow his social media pages!
 
Www.Sebastianfmusic.com
https://soundcloud.com/sebastianfmusic
https://www.instagram.com/sosoulsundays/
https://www.instagram.com/sebastianfmusic/
https://twitter.com/Sebastianfmusic

story:
The WONDER story. 

 

Hi, I'm Jean. I've been singing since before I can remember and playing violin since I was seven. My musical journey has been long and difficult at times. It was birthed in me as a child, grew in places  like conservatories and orchestras and bloomed as a recording career which has taken me to around the US, the UK and Ireland! And here I am today about to give birth to my eighth and most adventurous recording project ever! 

'WONDER' is incredible! (well at least I think so, and I am my own worst critic) What does it sound like? Well, it has a real 'world music feel'. It is ethereal, other-worldly, peaceful, worshipful, powerful, moving, and simply WONDERful. You just have to trust me on this one! I can't wait for you to hear it. I have a friend who is in a lot of pain from the effects of cancer who listens to it all the time and apparently finds it very soothing!

Who's on it? ME. What a surprise. I am singing, playing lots of violin, piano, and doing some the arranging. Billy Smiley did a stellar job producing, arranging, and finding exquisite musicians to join me. John Ellis of 'Tree63' played and sang an all new arrangement and duet of 'Blessed Be Your Name which is sooooooo sweet! Can't wait for you to hear it!  Steve Hindalong of 'The Choir' played percussion on many of the songs. So creative! Peter Furler of 'The Newsboys' also played percussion on one of the tracks which was very fun. Then to top it all off, the incomparable Michael W. Smith accompanied me on piano for a new arrangement of his song, "I Can Hear Your Voice".  I was so honored! Jonathan Crone tied the whole project together with truly anointed programming and everything else but the kitchen sink. There were many other great musicians involved whose names I don't have room to include here. YOU ARE GOING TO LOVE IT! 

 I am so proud of this work, but as a Christian artist in full time ministry, I pay all my own production costs, travel expenses, graphic design, marketing, and promotion.  We are down to the wire now. Professional recording projects are not cheap. We have paid the bills to this point but now funds are needed to finish it and launch it so that people know about it. Which brings me to...

The WONDER opportunity. 

 

  • I am estimating that I need approximately $8000 to launch WONDER well. This covers the cost of graphic design, outstanding production costs, including recording, mixing and mastering of bonus tracks, video expenses (so we can show the WONDER which is so important), and travel expenses to get me back to Nashville again to wrap things up!

As you have blessed me, I would love to bless you!  Please check out the perks I am offering. As a 'Wonder' partner, you will have exclusive access to pre-release downloads, autographed CDs, concerts, Skype voice lessons, or your name appearing in the credits of WONDER videos. I would offer to cook and clean for you too, but it's probably in everyone's best interest to have me stick to music. 

The Wonder Impact.

The exciting thing about this project is that I have partnered with a distributor called 'NAXOS' which has great reach into the secular music world. For the first time, my music has the possibility to be offered to audiences beyond the 'Christian' market which is where I believe it needs to go.  How amazing to think that people may listen to this music because they love the sound and be drawn closer to God in the process! 

The vision for my recordings has never been about entertainment. I believe God uses music to soften hearts and reveal His love. I have seen Him do it over and over again in concerts and through recordings. What a privilege to use this tool to share the love of Christ! 

I chose the Indiegogo campaign to help fund WONDER because, quite simply, I have felt burdened, and the Lord said to ask for help! I did a "Kickstarter" campaign in the past, but some people found the payment method cumbersome, and I found it stressful. 

This is NOT an 'all or nothing' campaign. In other words, there is no pressure on anyone to make a financial goal. I am simply asking for help so that I am not shouldering the costs alone and can promote it well. 

Sharing the WONDER.

Times are tough, I know there are some who would love to give financially but simply can't at this time. I completely understand. I have been there! Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Let your friends, family, Facebook friends, Twitter feed, etc etc know about WONDER! Help me make some noise! Indiegogo makes it easy with Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please pray for me and my family as we go forward in music and ministry. I have a packed schedule of speaking and singing events this autumn and will truly need God's grace! 
  • Above all, no matter how much or how little you become involved, thank you from the bottom of my heart for checking out WONDER and for encouraging me. I hope you enjoy the music and are inspired to chase after God's best for your life!

story:
Alyxis Audley was born in San Diego, California on July 20th 1993.  Raised by a single mother who struggled with alcohol abuse and a father from Jamaica, far from immediate reach, she was compelled into confronting the art of maturing at a young age. Impregnated with a need to artistically release she began writing obsessively since the age of 4, carrying her into production of poems and spoken word performances in later years. At age 18, she packed her journals and dreams and began travelling the United States in quest of, “a truth in which was applicable to all people, despite any seeming differences.”  Gifted a guitar at age 19, she continued traveling in which she found herself amongst other homeless and began to teach herself how to play. “I learned chords from other people out on the streets like me, learning music became salvation, to both others and myself.” It was then she began writing music, embodying the harsh realities of life on the road along with her truths of growing up in America. “Music for the people,” became her priority in which she developed a folk, roots-rock, reggae style and continued playing her songs on the streets to anybody who would listen. “The streets had taught me that all people are my people and music has the power of unity, which became my purpose of existing.” On a mission to unify and uplift spirits, her music exemplifies the at times strenuous pursuit of believing in one’s self and the importance of rising above life’s greatest challenges, both alone, and along.

The Impact

All contributions from my people are of  total value to the launching of the album. I have 40 original songs in which I am raising funds to be able to produce each one with as much intention, purpose, and richness possible. Just as I needed my peoples influence to be able to begin writing the songs, I need my peoples influence in order to complete them. This is a cycle in which I take great pride in attributing my people for the finished product.


Risks & Challenges

I have travelled America on and off for the past 5 years of my life. From being in a car with others doing the same, to being only on my own two feet. I do not come from an incredibly abundant financial family or background, so all that was earned, was entirely dependent on my willingness to learn. Despite plenty along my path telling me that what I had chosen to do with my life was a "mistake," I stayed committed, I believed in something more. Living in a society where success is measured by your material gain, I have been judged, condemned, and devalued because of my seeming lack. My faith of self, my gratitude of life, and my commitment to see and be change has granted me access through any hurdle I have faced, and continue to.


Other Ways You Can Help

Money is only one medium in which provides the help for the production of the album. However, a person whom cherishes inner value, help can be some good words written with intention and a seal of love. The greatest gift in life, is the gift of giving itself. My people! Share this story, let it resonate with what burns inside of us all! Love, freedom, and a day of change! A day in which all that life has to offer is appreciated, a day in which difference in another is honored, respected, and understood.

Thank you.

story:
As musicians, our goal is to create a sanctioned environment for art to thrive. We choose to busk because we truly believe in the healing capabilities of music and wish to share that with the community we live in. Currently, mainstream music is dictated by a limited number of individuals moved only by marketability and profit margins, thereby commodifying this sacred medium and marginalizing independent artists. We perform on the streets everyday to reintroduce the public to a new standard of music - one that posits music as experiential, not simply recreational. Through our busking sessions, we hope to encourage artists of all mediums to resist commodification and celebrate their inimitability. All relationships are equally unique, each experience equally valuable. 

So now the purpose of the funds and how they will actually help produce this album and keep us thriving as artist. If you check out our basement ep on soundcloud, which can also be downloaded via band camp, I'm glad some of you out there are already supporting the cause by throwing down for the album, even though it's free, it really helps out. A friend we met busking will be engineering our new album and ensuring the sound is on point. We need some more equipment too when it comes to ensure the sound quality is where it needs to be. Here is a list of the equipment & services we are looking at to ensure we have crystal clear sound. Soon we will attach links to share the items we have in mind.

~ The List ~

  • Car Batteries (2-3)
  • Power Inverters (1-2)
  • Speaker(s) (1-2)
  • 88-Key Weighted Keyboard
  • Keyboard Case
  • Laptop 
  • Cajon
  • Cymbals (2-3)
  • Cymbal Stand
  • Cymbal Bag
  • Cymbal Cleaner
  • Drum Heads
  • Drum Sticks
  • Portable Recorder
  • Microphone 
  • Microphone Stand
  • Handcart(s) (1-2)
  • Physical Album Copies
  • Recording
  • Engineering
  • Mastering
  • Sacred Geometric Prints & Posters
  • Flyers & Business Cards
  • Banner
  • Shipping Fees
  • Warranty
  • Cables

Here are some photos of our current equipment;

No grill and speaker is busted... -_-

Broken B Flat due to drunk fan... -_______-

Other than making a new album, we are very diverse in taste as artist and wish to create other projects with different sounds, such as progressive metal, post-rock, instrumental. electronic, ambient, EDM, trap, hip-hop, house, and that's just a few for now. Be sure to look through the gallery and look at some of the artwork made by Elijah and hear Ryan freestyle in an old friends basement, along with a couple of short documentaries.

 

Here's some art:

BEU ~ Heal

\

Grounds of Metatron

BIS ~ Illuminate

One Love,

o̶̶̷̤ .̫ o̴̶̷̤

Lucy Adamas 

https://lucy-adamas.bandcamp.com/releases

https://www.facebook.com/lucyadamas/

https://soundcloud.com/lucyadamas

story:
Hi! Thanks for checking out our 

Indie-go-go campaign! 


Dog Leg Dilemma is an energetic, playful, hard-hitting electric jazz quartet that borrows from a wide variety of styles including heavy metal, reggae, rock, funk, fusion, world music and movie soundtracks. 

We are a truly experimental jazz band. We're not “trying” to fuse things together. It's more about getting inspiration from a wide range of sources and then dropping all inhibitions and letting our ears guide us. This is how we operate in a live setting and it is exactly how we plan to create our first studio album. The nice thing about the recording process is that artists don’t have to make all of their decisions instantly. When you are performing live and suddenly you want there to be strings, congas or a harmony line here or there, you basically have to put those desires to rest. In the studio, anything is possible! We have already started planning a few extra layers to add to some of our songs and we are looking forward to exploring even more.

We've been gigging for about a year now in the Toronto area and people keep asking us “Where's the album? When are you going to record this amazing band?" We've heard you, and we've come up with a solid plan to make it happen! 

We picked out a fantastic studio, we got a great producer on board and we've already started working on the album art. All the details of our plan can be found below. The only problem is that we are all (near-)starving artists with extremely shallow pockets. We are hoping that you can help us overcome this ... speed bump.

Finishing this first professional album will help us achieve all our future goals. A studio album is the foundation of any good press kit. We have made a DIY live EP available, but most festivals require a professional version before they make the investment of flying artists across the continent to perform. In this way, your contribution to this Indiegogo campaign will help us play more live gigs and get our music into the hands, ears and hearts of people across the planet.


Meet the Band


Anthony Argatoff is a young alto sax player from Kelowna, British Columbia, making a name for himself in the jazz and freely improvised music scenes in Toronto. Anthony leads the dynamic trio Seldon Plan.

Scott Neary is an extremely versatile guitar player from Newfoundland and Labrador. Scott studied at St. Francis Xavier University in Nova Scotia and later the University of North Texas. Scott Plays in such groups as Hit Pickers (Bluegrass), SNEERY, Scott Neary Trio, and is the musical director of the Steven Taetz Group.

Austin Gembora is a killer drummer from the Toronto area. A recent graduate of the Humber music program, he is quickly earning a reputation as an exciting and dependable drummer. Austin is the in-house session drummer for RCMG Records and plays in such groups as ART the Band, Quarter Heads, SNEERY and the Matt Lagan Group.

Peter Bull is a bass player from Nova Scotia. He went to St. Francis Xavier University (where he met Scott) and spent a year living and playing in New York City and attending the Manhattan School of Music. Outside of Dog Leg Dilemma, Peter performs regularly with such groups as SNEERY, Scott Neary Trio, Rhythm and Vibes (Persian Gypsy-Pop) and The Harmonauts (Ska). 


Where Does All That Money Go?

Putting together a full-length high quality album costs a lot of money! Here's where it will all be going:

Tracking (initial recording process): $1800

We are planning to record in the beautiful chapel space at Coalition Music studio.. Coalition is a Toronto studio housed in an old convent. The Convent was fitted with state of the art modern equipment paired with some timeless classic vintage gear which makes for super clear, crisp recordings that still have that warm analog feeling that everyone wants. The $1800 listed above pays for renting the space for 3 days and for an engineer. David Henriques has agreed to be our live engineer and our mix engineer. Which brings us to the mixing...

Mixing: $1600 

A big mistake that a lot of people make is paying a lot of money for tracking and then cutting corners in postproduction. By hiring David (who knows our music and understands the aesthetic) we will avoid this common pitfall. David also has an excellent working relationship with Peter Letros of Wreckhouse Media, who will be mastering the record. Which brings us to mastering...

Mastering: $750

Good mastering can make the difference between a pretty-good-sounding recording and an amazing-sounding recording. But what exactly is mastering? Mastering is the part of the process where the overall tone of the sound gets balanced. Mastering engineers deal with the subtle dynamics, compression, equalization, coloration and the sense of space in the sound. This is the last step before the physical CDs are produced.

Production: $1450

This is the cost for the first thousand CDs, including shipping! We have not finished our design yet but the first draft by Brandon Johnston already looks amazing! 


Too see some of Brandon's other work go to brandonjohnstonphoto.com

Producer: $2000

We are excited to announce that Kevin Brunkhorst has agreed to lend us his ears to help make this record the best possible version of itself. Kevin has years of experience in the record industry and just as many in playing, writing, recording and producing music. The $2000 listed above includes his airfare from Nova Scotia and lodging in Toronto for the duration of the recording process. Both Scott and Peter learned composition with Kevin during their undergraduate studies at St. Francis Xavier University. This long-term musical relationship built on respect, trust, understanding and shared musical language, is sure to make this album a thing of beauty!


What's in it for You?


If you want the literal answer to this question, check out the full list of Perks! Besides getting copies of the CD, T-shirts, Skype concerts, lessons and dinner with the band, you get to play a part in creating something truly unique.

You get to help us push ourselves to the next level and see just how far we can take our art form. But more than simple curiosity for our own benefit, we do this because of how rewarding it is to share the fruits of our labour with other human beings. The purpose of this project is to dramatically increase the scope of that sharing and the size of our audience. We are both excited and proud of this work and wish to invite you to be a vital part of the process.

As creators and musicians, we need you, the listener. Without you, all our efforts are totally meaningless. This Indigogo campaign is designed to help us build a community of like-minded people that comes together to share the simple experience of music. Having this studio album will allow people to take home a reminder of the experience they had and relive it with every listen. 


What if we don't get reach our goal?

So what happens if we don't raise all the funds necessary for us to make our dream album exactly the way we want to? Easy answer: we do what we do best and get creative! Rest assured, your donation will not go into the ramen noodle fund. No matter what, we will honor your generosity by creating the best album we possibly can with all the resources we can gather. Here are some possible scenarios: 

If we raise between $4000 and $5000, the plan is to do all the tracking with our producer Kevin at Coalition Music and then hire a professional grant writer to apply for various government grants so that we can complete the postproduction. 

If we raise between $3000 and $4000 we will likely complete the tracking (with Kevin) in a less expensive studio and apply for grants to complete the record, as above.

If we don't make it to the $3000 mark would consider self-producing or recording fewer songs in a cheaper studio.

Your participation will mean the difference between our recording ourselves with cheap mics in an okay-sounding room and our going to a studio where professionals will use the best gear out there to make the CD sound even clearer than if you were in the front row at one of our concerts! We are going to make this happen on whatever budget we have to; with your help, we can create the high quality professional CD that we want and that you deserve!


Challenges

One of the biggest challenges for us will be capturing the interactive energy of our live performances on this recording. It's easy enough for us to feed off each others’ energy when we are rehearsing together in a single room or playing to an intimate audience from a small stage. But when we are in the recording studio, we will need to isolate the saxophone at the very least. This means that Anthony will either be in another room (separated by a glass wall) or in the same room but in a large box with a little window for communication. Obviously this will make things difficult, but there are solutions!

First of all, we will be doing everything we possibly can make sure that we are as physically close together as possible in the studio with clear lines of sight between all of us. If you watch old videos of the Charles Mingus group performing, they always stand extremely close together. Even if they are on a massive stage they are inches away from bumping into each other so that they can be as interactive and musical as humanly possible. 

We will try a few different techniques while we are rehearsing in preparation for the studio session, such as playing with our backs to each other so we can focus on communicating through sound alone in case we can't achieve good visual communication in the studio.

We love playing for an audience so we will be inviting people into the studio with us! (Check out "Witness the Magic" in the perks section to the right)


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are super excited about this album (like we are) but you're not in a financial position to donate we understand completely. You can still be incredibly helpful by getting the word out! You can share the link to our project (http://igg.me/at/DLD) on social media, e-mail your friends, Join our mailing list, like our Facebook page, subscribe to our You Tube channel and like our videos, follow us on Twitter and Instagram, and tell your friends and family about the band! It won't take more than a minute but it's one of the most important things you can do to help us out.
story_txt:
Hi!
Thanks for checking out our Indie-go-go campaign! Dog Leg
Dilemma is an energetic, playful, hard-hitting electric jazz quartet
that borrows from a wide variety of styles including heavy metal,
reggae, rock, funk, fusion, world music
and movie soundtracks. We
are a truly experimental jazz band. We're not “trying” to fuse
things together. It's more about getting inspiration from a wide
range of sources and then dropping all inhibitions and letting our
ears guide us. This is how we operate in a live setting and it is
exactly how we plan to create our
first studio album. The nice thing about the recording process is
that artists don’t have to make all of their decisions instantly.
When you are performing live and suddenly you want there to be
strings, congas or a harmony line here or there, you basically have
to put those desires to rest. In the studio, anything is possible! We
have already started planning a few extra layers to add to some of
our songs and we are looking forward to exploring even more.We've
been gigging for about a year now in the Toronto area and people keep
asking us “Where's the album? When are you going to record this
amazing band?" We've heard you, and we've come up with a solid
plan to make it happen! 

We
picked out a fantastic studio, we got a great producer on board and
we've already started working on the album art. All the details of
our
plan can be found below. The only problem is that we are all
(near-)starving artists with extremely shallow pockets. We are hoping
that you can help us overcome this ... speed bump.Finishing
this first professional album will help us achieve all our future
goals. A
studio album is the foundation of any good press kit. We have made a
DIY live EP available, but most festivals require a professional
version before they make the investment of flying artists across the
continent to perform. In this way, your contribution to this
Indiegogo campaign will help us play more live gigs and get our music
into the hands, ears and
hearts of people across the planet.


Meet
the Band

Anthony
Argatoff is a young alto sax player from Kelowna, British Columbia,
making a name for himself in the jazz and freely improvised music
scenes in Toronto. Anthony leads the dynamic trio Seldon Plan.

Scott Neary is an extremely versatile guitar player from Newfoundland and Labrador. Scott studied at St. Francis Xavier University in Nova Scotia and later the University of North Texas. Scott Plays in such groups as Hit Pickers (Bluegrass), SNEERY, Scott Neary Trio, and is the musical director of the Steven Taetz Group.Austin Gembora is a killer drummer from the Toronto area. A recent graduate of the
Humber music program, he is quickly earning a reputation as an
exciting and dependable drummer. Austin is the in-house session
drummer for RCMG Records and plays in such groups as ART the Band,
Quarter Heads, SNEERY and the Matt Lagan Group.Peter
Bull is a bass player from Nova Scotia. He went to St. Francis Xavier
University (where he met Scott) and spent a year living and playing
in New York City and attending the Manhattan School of Music. Outside
of Dog Leg Dilemma, Peter performs regularly with such groups as
SNEERY, Scott Neary Trio, Rhythm and Vibes (Persian Gypsy-Pop) and
The Harmonauts (Ska). 


Where
Does All That Money Go?

Putting
together a full-length high quality album costs a lot of money!
Here's where it will all be going:

Tracking
(initial recording process): $1800

We
are planning to record in the beautiful chapel space at Coalition Music
studio.. Coalition is a Toronto studio housed in an old convent. The
Convent was fitted with state of the art modern equipment paired with
some timeless classic vintage gear which makes for super clear, crisp
recordings that still have that warm analog feeling that everyone
wants. The $1800 listed above pays for renting the space for 3 days
and for an engineer. David Henriques has agreed to be our live
engineer and our mix engineer. Which brings us to the mixing...

Mixing:
$1600 
A
big mistake that a lot of people make is paying a lot of money for
tracking and then cutting corners in postproduction. By hiring David
(who knows our music and understands the aesthetic) we will avoid
this common pitfall. David also has an excellent working relationship
with Peter Letros of Wreckhouse Media, who will be mastering the
record. Which brings us to mastering...

Mastering:
$750
Good
mastering can make the difference between a pretty-good-sounding
recording and an amazing-sounding recording. But
what exactly is mastering? Mastering is the part of the process where
the overall tone of the sound gets balanced. Mastering engineers deal
with the subtle dynamics, compression, equalization, coloration and
the sense of space in the sound. This is the last step before the
physical CDs are produced.

Production:
$1450

This
is the cost for the first thousand CDs, including shipping! We have
not finished our design yet but the first draft by Brandon Johnston
already looks amazing! 

Too
see some of Brandon's other work go
to brandonjohnstonphoto.com

Producer:
$2000
We
are excited to announce that Kevin Brunkhorst has
agreed to lend us his ears to help make this record the best possible
version of itself. Kevin has years of experience in the record
industry and just as many in playing, writing, recording and
producing music. The $2000 listed above includes his airfare from
Nova Scotia and lodging in Toronto for the duration of the recording
process. Both Scott and Peter learned composition with Kevin during
their undergraduate studies at St. Francis Xavier University. This
long-term musical relationship built on respect, trust, understanding
and shared musical language, is sure to make this album a thing of
beauty!

you want the literal answer to this question, check out the full list
of Perks! Besides getting copies of the CD, T-shirts, Skype concerts,
lessons and dinner with the band, you get to play a part in creating
something truly unique.

You
get to help us push ourselves to the next level and see just how far
we can take our art form. But more than simple curiosity for our
own benefit, we do this because of how rewarding it is to share
the fruits of our labour with other human beings. The purpose of
this project is to dramatically increase the scope of that
sharing and the size of our audience. We are both excited and
proud of this work and wish to invite you to be a vital part of
the process.
As

our efforts are totally meaningless. This

listen.

story:
Hello Everybody!  

I've written and performed music all my life. In 2010 I met Bill Runge, Alcan Grand Prix Du Montreal award-winning master arranger and multi-instrumentalist. Our deep musical understanding blossomed into a CD (Nature Girl) a band, and a love story. This project is the result of that meeting. 

Following on the success of our first album, which includes the globe-trotting hit  "Serengeti," our band is simply bursting out to record a new, even deeper album," Playground." We appeal to you dear friends, fans, discoverers and listeners, supporters and angels, to propel us forward with your contribution. We'll make you proud.

Our momentum as a creative team has already driven the band to achieve recognized artistic heights. Winner of an Akademia Music Award, LA for  "Serengeti," which also held "# 1 on the Charts" in September's Berkeley Media Group Global Radio ratings. 

Our hard-working band is now poised to record what will likely be a stunning new artistic achievement. We want to inspire you and give back to you! With your essential financial support, you will become a real player in this much anticipated creation. We thank you in advance for giving this worthy project wings! 

We'll record nine pieces. Three days in the studio and overdubs, mixing, mastering, pressing and promotion. We've climbed this mountain before. We know what to do.

 There is much you can do to help our cause by using the Indiegogo share tools on this site. If you like our music, please forward our campaign to other contacts and sites, and the ripples will go out. Thank you!

Indiegogo releases funds to us two weeks after the campaign end date. Any funds we receive will be used to help cover the multiple costs of recording, pressing and promotion. 

The writing and arranging of the tunes has taken a year and includes "Love is a Traveller" "Lover's Arms" and "Brave Waking," which was inspired by text from Canadian poet Robert Service's poem, "Song of the Campfire," 

 " I am the angel and the devil,

I am the tyrant and the slave,

I am the maker and the destroyer,

I, the giver and the grave."

Our plan is to release "Playground" in Summer 2016. With you as a contributor, this will become reality. A new wave of musical beauty can be born! The new music will go out all over the world, and you, dear reader, will be an essential part of it.

Our 2014 CD release “Nature Girl” was conceived during a six-month sojourn in the Costa Rica rainforest where I gained a new appreciation for nature and all its wonders. This recording combines elements of world beat, fusion jazz, avant-pop, ambient, and enigmatic forms that defy description. Some of my wide-ranging musical influences include; Paul Horn, Diane Reeves, Hubert Laws, Claude Debussy, J.S.Bach, Betty Carter, Pat Metheny and Roland Kirk. The compositions include some moving lyric content, exciting and thoughtful improvised instrumental soloing and some infectious grooves combined with fresh harmonic content, thoughtful arrangements, brilliant performances by a crack band that includes some of Canada’s best musicians, pristine recording values, and a pervasive sense of magic and mystery.

"Holly Burke & The Naturals has gained significant momentum, audience and touring experience since releasing "Nature Girl." Their dedication to excellence and noteworthy accomplishments, commend them. It will be very interesting to hear what new and unexpected magic emerges on "Playground." - Lori Bell  - Winner Global Music Awards.

Meet Our Team:

BILL RUNGE – Tenor & Soprano Saxophones In 1990 Bill’s quintet, The Creatures of Habit won the Grand Prix at the CBC-Alcan Jazz Competition. As a leader, Bill has produced four recordings; Creatures of Habit-Live in Montreal-1990, for Justin Time Records, B3 -1994, for Roadhouse Records, Acid Test-2002, for Maximum Jazz, and A Tribute To The South American Masters-2006, also for Maximum Jazz. Bill is also a busy studio musician, recording with such acts as K-OS, INXS, Powder Blues, Traci Ullman, The Hard Rubber Orchestra, Swollen Members, Tower of Power horns, Tower of Power horns, Long John Baldry, The Vancouver Ensemble of Jazz Improvisation (VEJI), Michael Buble, Jim Byrnes and many more. Bill has performed live shows all over the world with such artists as Natalie Cole, Michael Buble, Taj Mahal, Jo Bo Diddley, Sheena Easton, Roger Daltry, John Hammond Jr., Dave Holland, and dozens more. As a composer Bill has composed several film scores including the cult favorite, Babette’s Feet; received commissions from such artists as Viveza, The Hard Rubber Orchestra, Babayaga, and Winter Harp; done scores for TV shows such as Super Kids (CBC), Code Green (CBC), and done arrangements or orchestrations for such shows as The Chris Isaak Show (Showtime), and Beggars and Choosers (Showtime).

KRISTIAN ALEXANDROV - Pianist Winner of the 2008 Canadian Smooth Jazz Award for Best Pianist, this accomplished Bulgarian pianist has a lengthy list of accomplishments. Born and raised in Sofia, Bulgaria, Kristian Alexandrov grew up in a family of musicians and was exposed to a variety of world music styles: Bulgarian folk, Classical, Afro-Cuban and Contemporary Jazz. Recognizing Kristian’s talent, his parents enrolled him in piano lessons at the age of four. At six years of age, Kristian was accepted into the prestigious L. Pipkov School of Music where he completed his musical education, twelve years of intense training as a pianist and percussionist. Kristian’s natural ability, extensive training and passion for performance enabled him to tour across much of Europe by the age of nineteen. Career highlights include performing in the orchestra for the Opening Ceremonies of the Olympic Winter Games hosted in Vancouver February 2010. July 2012, Kristian led the band in thirty-three shows over eleven days as Musical Director for the world premiere of Tails, a large-scale production incorporating music, dance, theatre and thirty horses in a celebration of Calgary Stampede’s 100th Anniversary. Highlights of summer 2013 include performances at the Bulgarian Embassy (Washington DC), Vibrato’s Jazz (Los Angeles, CA), International Trumpet Guild (Grand Rapids, MI), Brassfire at Benaroya Hall (Seattle, WA), and All Star Brass (Banff Centre, AB). On the recording front, Kristian’s excited about the release of his latest collaboration Little Wonder with Soul recording artist Shannon Gaye - a CD project he co-wrote and co-produced.

Drummer Extraordinaire RANDALL STOLL got his start in music at age eight by ripping out the baseboards in the basement and using them as sticks to drum on upturned garbage cans. By age sixteen he was driving from Calgary to Red Deer College every weekend to teach percussion 101. After graduating with top honors from P.I.T. / M.I. in Los Angeles he moved to Vancouver to record and tour with MCA recording artists Boulevard. He now has a lengthy discography (over 400 releases), several having achieved gold, platinum, Juno (5), or Grammy award status. Throughout the 90’s Randall toured and recorded with k.d. lang, including the album of the Year, Ingénue, and worldwide hit Constant Craving. Later he moved on to a seven-year stint recording and touring with Tom Cochrane. Randall has performed on the T.V. shows David Letterman (twice), Jay Leno (thrice), Larry Sanders, VH1, Oprah Winfrey, and twice on the Juno Awards (with kd, Tom C, and Shania Twain). Other notables include recording with: Ann Wilson from Heart, Dan Mangan, K-OS, Alpha Yaya Diallo, Susan Aglukark, Michelle Wright, Gene Simmons, Rankin Sisters, Chava Albertstein, Gary Burton, and many other jazz, pop, soul and Latin projects. He is also the force behind local Uber Funk and Soul group Soulstream.

BRENT GUBBELS has been a Vancouver based professional musician and teacher for over twenty years. In that time he’s worked with a diverse group of local musicians and ensembles including Van Django, the Hard Rubber Orchestra, Gypsalero, Rumba Calzada, John Reischman, the Vince Mai Project, Jesse Zubot, Dal Richards, Lee Aaron and Dee Daniels among others. He has also performed with the Edmonton Symphony Orchestra, Calgary Symphony Orchestra, Winnipeg Symphony Orchestra, Regina Symphony Orchestra and Saskatoon Symphony Orchestra as well as Stuart Maclean and Bob McGrath. He has toured North America and Europe extensively and played a variety of international jazz and folk festivals including concerts at the Kennedy Center, Lincoln Center, Southbank Center, Tonder Festival, Towersey Village Festival, Philadelphia Folk Festival and the Clonakilty International Guitar Festival. He’s also been regularly featured in groups performing at the Vancouver Jazz festival, Vancouver Folk Festival, Edmonton Folk Festival, Calgary Folk Festival and the Winnipeg Folk Festival. Brent can be heard on recordings by Gypsalero, Juno nominees Susan Crowe, Compadres and the Hard Rubber Orchestra as well as Juno winners James Keelaghan and Oscar Lopez.

story:
We've been at it for a while now. Patch began in the Fall of 2011 in the mountains of Southwest Virginia where members Benton Allen and Taylor Tazewell were living in a one room cabin on Patch Drive. We moved to Austin to pursue music, and have been honored by the additions of Wesley Maffly-Kipp and Ben Humphreys. 



What We Need & Why

        The saying goes you get what you pay for, and we want to make something worthwhile. In the past our recording experiences have been dictated by time, leading to frantic hours in the studio trying to cram in as much as possible. Therefore our biggest expense making this record will be studio time. We want to be able to not rush it; to not have "good enough" be our mantra.
       The second big expense is preproduction and mixing. We've been working with Austin musician and producer Bradley Will on fine tuning our songs and songwriting process, with the goal of making a record that is both singular and accessible. Bradley is putting in hours and hours with us, sitting in on practices, attending shows, taking notes, making suggestions and acting as our compass on this voyage, as well as mixing the record.
       The remainder of the money will go to mastering costs, an expensive yet essential step in making a record that will sound polished and play well on a variety of devices.



The Idea

            Over the years we have had many ups and downs, learned many lessons of the industry (most of them the hard way!) and we are now in a position to make the music we've been hearing in our heads all these years. We want to make something that will stand the test of time, something we can be proud of. Something that speaks to the universal truths that bring us together as human beings: Love and loss, time and space, the bittersweet essence of existence. We are all stumbling through the dark together.


Other Ways You Can Help

          If you are broke we totally know where you're coming from! Anything you can do to help is still greatly appreciated- whether it is helping us to promote via social media or just listening to our music. Spreading the word is a vital part of having a successful campaign, check us out on our website or find us on Instagram at @patchatx!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lynnea Rose, and I am a folk singer/songwriter based in Lawrencetown (HRM) and originally from Annapolis Royal, NS. I have been pursing music professionally for the better part of a decade,  and in doing so have performed all across Canada promoting my debut album "Lynnea Rose". It's been nearly  3 years since the release of my first album, and I am now ready to record and release 10 new songs!

I have the very exciting opportunity to work with Canadian Folk Music Award Winning team Tom Terrell (producer) and Karl Faulkenham (engineer). We are set to start recording in February with some incredibly talented local musicians and I couldn't be more excited! Of course, doing a project like this is quite costly, and finding funds to contribute can be challenging, especially for  an independent musician! That's where you come in! :) 

With help from contributors like yourself, I will be able to create a fresh new 10 song album which I will promote, sell at shows, tour across Canada with, promote to radio, submit for TV placement, pitch to management companies and labels...the list goes on! However, it won't just be a tool to help me further my music career. I see it as an opportunity to truly explore and express my art and find the true creative potential of the songs. I hope to create something that can be enjoyed and appreciated by listeners while contributing to and reflecting on Nova Scotian heritage and culture.

By contributing you will be making this recording project possible. I simply can't do it without your help! The money raised through this campaign will cover all aspects of creating my new album. This includes recording studio costs, producer and engineering fees, studio musician fees, mixing, mastering, digital artwork and CD duplication. 

What We Need & What You Get


The total project will cost $7500. This cost includes:

$1000-Recording Studio rental

$1500 - Producer Cost

$1800-Engineer Cost

$1000- Studio Musician Fees

$1000- Mastering Fees

$200- Digital Artwork

$1000 Duplication Fees (500 CDs)


When you contribute you get perks! Who hoo! These include signed albums of the new recording, Lynnea Rose T-shirts, Custom made Cajones and guitar stands, music lessons, a song written for you, a handcrafted table lamp and cutting boards, baby quilts, handmade slippers, dinners/concerts and even a house concert!!!
If I don't reach my goal of $7500 then the funds contributed will still go towards the recording project...it might just mean that it will have to be scaled back to a 6 song  EP unless I can raise the funds in other ways. Other forms of fundraising would include writing grants, fundraising concerts and hopefully winning the lottery! ;) 


The Impact

With help from contributors like yourself, I will be able to create a brand new album that will act as a tool to help my music career flourish. But what's in it for you you ask??? Well, my hope is that my new album will be something that can be enjoyed by listeners like yourself. Something that will evoke emotion, and something that will inspire. The best moments of music career have been the times I've been  approached by someone who was impacted by one of my songs. Music has a mysterious way of healing and shedding light when there is dark. I hope to reach people in a positive way.

And of course by contributing you get cool stuff!!!!!! 

Risks & Challenges

Of course there are many risks involved in this venture. If I do not raise enough money for the album, I will have to find other ways of gathering funds, and quick! This would involve fundraising concerts, applying for grants, working extra shifts and getting mighty creative. If I still cannot reach my intended goal, I will be forced to downsize the project to however many songs I can afford to complete. 

However, I am optimistic in this endeavour and feel that with the help of my amazing support network/community it is entirely achievable! 


Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that contributing just isn't possible for some of you, and that's totally ok! There are other ways that you can help! 

Getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign could help significantly! Please feel free to share this campaign with others. There are share tools like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to help spread the word!

THANK YOU!!!!!

story:
About Stereoshifter

Hi there! Josh and Wes here from Stereoshifter. We are a 2-piece rock band from Denver. We love playing music. We've been playing together since we were 15 years old. We grew up on 80s and 90's punk and alt-rock. We are about to finish our self-produced EP. In support of this record we are doing a small tour in the Pacific Northwest this April and we need your help to print CD's and cover tour costs. 

www.stereoshifter.com

Why we need your help and what it's for

We need to cover a variety of costs to make this happen. Even if we don't reach our goal every penny will help us succeed! Let's break it down...

  • Short run of CD printing w/cases and digital submissions ($300)
  • Rental Van ($600)
  • Hotel/Lodging ($800)
  • Gas ($450)
  • Food
  • Merch/Promo items
  • Future Recordings? (if we exceed our goal we would love to record new material in a professional studio!)

The Impact!

We get out there and expose our music to new markets! Show people that real and raw rock bands still do exist. Tour on our music. Something we dreamed of since being a teenager. In an ever-changing and challenging music industry, we want to do the basics and show people what Stereoshifter is made of...old school.

Tour Dates:

04/16 Frontier Bar - Meridian, ID
04/17 Ash Street Saloon - Portland, OR
04/19 Johnny B's - Medford, OR
04/21 Baby Bar - Spokane, WA
04/22 Calypsos Coffee - Coeur d'Alene, ID
04/23 Tim's Tavern - Seattle, WA

We've played in a lot of bands over the years and we know to keep expectations low. We know the shows may lack crowds and we might not sell a CD or T-shirt one night. That's okay. We aren't it in to make money or break even. We are in it for the love of rock n'roll. We want to be heard. We work way to hard on this to give up. We love it. It drives us. It gets us through our day jobs and life.  

This CD and tour is only going to make Stereoshifter stronger and better, so why not be a part of it?

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is tight. We know. If you can't contribute money, no sweat. If you live in any of the areas we are touring, help spread the word or even come say hi at one of the shows. We'd love to meet you!

story:
Short Summary


Hello everyone
We are Lolita Dark
We have music, photos, videos, and more on our website. We are a fusion of Japanese and American rock. We are finishing tracks on our 3rd American release and we have just sent out tracks to Japan, to be mixed, mastered, and released ,in Japan, by a company we signed a 5 year contract with. This company has invited us, to Japan, to play a string of shows, do some interviews, and appear at promotional events, to coincide with our first release in Japan, starting of with our debut at the Cure World Visual Festival, where we will be the only ONLY female-fronted band out of 35 other bands.

We cannot understate the importance of exposing our music to its other half, and this is, possibly, the most important first step to broadening our pathways to world markets.

As with any business, the level to which one invests, and prepares, directly influences the statistical probabilities of opportunities, and various levels of "success". We intend to succeed by any means necessary, but we hope to do it without falling into crippling debt, and there is a vast list of expenses, not the least of which is our desire to bring a videographer to help document our trip, and provide extra content to send all of you lovelies.
Videographer travel, shelter, and the most basic of human upkeep
Various travel expenses (transporting merchandise, instruments, and costumes adds up)
New Merchandise
Broken gear that needs fixing (amps, instruments, pedal board)
Upgrades to improve performances (mics, amps, pre-amps, in ears, keyboard upgrades, etc)
Seemingly endless accessories (strings, cables, batteries, sticks, picks, cameras, hard drives, etc)
Costumes/clothing
Rent (saddly, we still have to keep our apartments and band recording/rehearsal studio, and our landlords have refused payments of "good intentions")
Bills
Food (it takes a lot of fuel to rock this hard)


You, as our fans and contributors, have helped us out in our time of need before, showed us love and support since 2012, and rocked out with us at our shows; this is the biggest challenge we have had to encounter yet and need your help once again! With everything we have accomplished so far we have a lot of exciting things to offer to you all for helping us out by contributing toward our $15K goal

The rewards, listed to the right on your screen, are described as is and each reward includes everything that you will receive (so if you donate $100, it doesn't automatically include every reward for lower dollar amounts, unless it states otherwise). The rewards also include estimated delivery dates, which are rough estimates and aren't set in stone. This tour will not be possible without your donations.

Here are more in detail descriptions of the rewards we have listed:
Collector CD's, Posters, Tapes, and limited edition promotional material from Rayko's first 2 solo albums, leading up to Dig Jelly, and later Lolita Dark (signed by Rayko). Digital versions available too!
Any and All Previously released material, signed by the band. Digital versions available, as well as high resolution versions.
Any and all Material to be release on the new albums (Japan and US releases), High Resolution files available Too.
Any and all Material from K'lu's solo work
Any and All Merchandise
All Shibuya Obsession clothing
Custom framed artwork created by Joey Felix (and signed by Joey Felix)
Honorable Mention on upcoming US release
Impromptu video musical performance by band member(s) of choice
We are open to various combinations of the above gifts and we are willing to work with you to design your own unique gift package. contact us and let us know what you want

Thanks for checking us out and we hope you can help; if not by donating definitely by sharing this with people around you. Let's set the net on fire with the campaign; Indiegogo has sharing tools to help you out a bit more. #LDtoTokyo

You, as our fans and contributors, have helped us out in our time of need before, showed us love and support since 2012, and rocked out with us at our shows; this is the biggest challenge we have had to encounter yet and need your help once again! With everything we have accomplished so far we have a lot of exciting things to offer to you all for helping us out by contributing toward our $15K goal

The rewards, listed to the right on your screen, are described as is and each reward includes everything that you will receive (so if you donate $100, it doesn't automatically include every reward for lower dollar amounts, unless it states otherwise). The rewards also include estimated delivery dates, which are rough estimates and aren't set in stone. This tour will not be possible without your donations. 

Thanks for checking us out and we hope you can help; if not by donating definitely by sharing this with people around you. Let's set the net on fire with the campaign; Indiegogo has sharing tools to help you out a bit more. #LDtoTokyo

story:
Haz click para ver en Español

Short Summary

I'm a Venezuelan singer, guitarist and songwriter with a bluesy spirit. I’m 25 years old and I would like to spread my music out to the world. That's why I've been working very hard on my first album titled "Tus Colores" (Your Colors). This project is music being shouted from the deepest of my soul and I want all those screams to be heard, just to tell people they’re not alone. This music has all my deepest feelings and life canned into audio waves. 




What I Need & What You Get

Here is what I've already done with the help of A LOT of people

1 - Debut album “Tus Colores”:

  • Composition
  • Rehearsals
  • Recording Musicians
  • Recording/Editing/Mixing/Mastering of the audio
  • Album Artwork

2 - Debut Video clip for “Paraguas para ti”:

  • Concept
  • Production
  • Filming
  • Ilustrated artwork
  • Cartoon animation
  • Video editing

That was a lot of work done in the spare time of the 12 musicians involved and with the limited time I had with borrowed equipment. Everything was recorded from January 2014 to September 2015. All the mixing and mastering of the audio was done by Giscard Valero. “Tus colores” has 12 songs and 42 minutes of music.

What I still need to do is listed below. 

Remaining...

  • Printing CDs + Vinyl and CD Duplication + Digital Distribution - $1,500
  • “Paraguas para ti” Video Clip Promotion – 1000$
  • “Tus colores” Album Promotion – 1000$
  • “Lágrimas de Fénix” Video Filming/Production and Promotion – 1300$
  • Time capsule – 100$

This is what I need to take this project to the next level. All additional funds will go towards equipment buying, I’ve always wished to take piano lessons and I need a keyboard or midi controller to learn to play and produce music from a piano. 

If you contribute, you'll get some interesting perks like album downloads, and your name buried in a time capsule under a weeping willow. You can see all the rewards listed on the “Rewards section” or once you decide to contribute.


The weeping willow

I’ve always wanted to plant a weeping willow, I think that this tree reflects the nature of this album. Believe it or not, I’m planning to plant a tree every time I do something important in my life. In this opportunity I will bury a time capsule under the tree and I will record all the process on a video. Your name can be engraved on a metal plate with the names of all the people that contributes the most to make this album come true and that plate is going to be inside the capsule.

The capsule will also contain a copy of the album, song lyrics and all the interesting stuff I can collect from the musicians involved with the album.

All the names of the people that contribute to this crowdfunding campaign will be listed on my social networks with mentions and in a special section that will be created on my webpage www.yalungtang.com


It’s a promise

I promise to keep going on this musical path, to sing and scream out loud everything that’s coming from my soul and from my heart. I promise to keep producing music and to love every smile in every gig.

When you fund this project you will give me a breath to keep all the good energy and to share it with every person I can.


Risks & Challenges

Delays are to be expected, but expect them to be short because all the recording and editing is already done. I have set the release for May 2016, which gives me a lot of headroom, but there is no absolute guarantee that I can make that date. I'm gonna try as hard as I can to do it!

If I don't make my goal, I will have to cut costs in some way and the release could not be as expected. The only way to cut costs will be to print less albums, and to reduce marketing costs. Cutting costs could affect the success of this release.


Rewards








Other Ways You Can Help

Go to band camp and download my song "Paraguas para ti." All profits are going towards the project and even $1 helps!

https://yalungtang.bandcamp.com/releases

The MOST helpful thing you can do is to SHARE this campaign with the world. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, WhatsApp or even a phone call!  Share it with people who might be interested in helping a young songwriter achieve a professional goal, or might want to hear this music spread out to the world!


Click to see it in English

Breve reseña

Soy un cantautor Venezolano, canto y toco guitarra con un espíritu bastante blues. Tengo 25 años y quisiera esparcir mi música por el mundo. Es por eso que he estado trabajando duro en mi primer álbum titulado "Tus Colores". Este proyecto es música gritada desde lo más profundo de mi alma y quiero que esos gritos sean escuchados, solo para decirle a la gente que no están solos. Este álbum tiene todos mis sentimientos y mi vida, enlatados en ondas de audio.


Lo que necesito y lo que obtienes

Esto es lo que ya he hecho con la ayuda de un MONTÓN de personas

1 - Album Debut “Tus Colores”:

  • Composición
  • Ensayos
  • Músicos de sesión
  • Grabación/Edición/Mezcla/Master del audio
  • Arte del disco

2 - Videoclip Debut “Paraguas para ti”:

  • Concepto
  • Producción
  • Filmación
  • Arte gráfico
  • Dibujos animados
  • Edición de video

Eso ha sido un montón de trabajo hecho en el tiempo libre de los doce músicos involucrados y con el tiempo limitado que tenía con equipo prestado. Todo fue grabado desde Enero de 2014 hasta Septiembre 2015. La mezcla y máster del audio fue hecho por Giscard Valero. “Tus colores” tiene 12 canciones y 42 minutos de música.

Lo que todavía necesito hacer es lo siguiente: 

  • Imprimir CDs y Empaque + Duplicación de CD y Vinyl - $1,500
  • Promoción del videoclip “Paraguas para ti” – 1000$
  • Promoción del álbum “Tus colores” – 1000$
  • Grabación de video/Producción/Promoción de“Lágrimas de Fénix” – 1300$
  • Cápsula del tiempo – 100$

Esto es lo que necesito para llevar mi proyecto al siguiente nivel. Todos los fondos adicionales serán usados para comprar equipos. Siempre he querido tomar lecciones de piano y necesito un teclado o un controlador MIDI para aprender a tocar y producir música desde el piano. 

Si contribuyes, obtendrás recompensas muy interesantes como descargas del disco y tu nombre enterrado en una cápsula del tiempo bajo un sauce llorón. Puedes ver una lista de las recompensas en la sección “Recompensas” o cuando decidas contribuir.


El sauce llorón

Siempre he querido plantar un sauce llorón, pienso que este árbol refleja la naturaleza de este disco. Creanlo o no, planeo plantar un árbol cada vez que haga algo importante en mi vida. En esta oportunidad voy a enterrar una cápsula del tiempo debajo del árbol y voy a grabar todo el proceso en video. Tu nombre puede estar grabado en una placa de metal con los nombres de todas las personas que contribuyeron mayoritariamente a que este álbum se hiciese realidad y esa placa estará dentro de la cápsula del tiempo.

La cápsula, además, contendrá una copia del álbum, letras de las canciones y todas las cosas interesantes que pueda recolectar de los músicos involucrados con el disco. 

Todos los nombres de las personas que contribuyan con esta campaña, serán nombrados en mis redes sociales y puestos en una lista en una sección especial en mi página web www.yalungtang.com


Es una promesa

Prometo seguir el camino de la música, cantar y gritar todo lo que venga de mi alma y mi corazón. Prometo mantenerme produciendo música y amar cada sonrisa en cada evento en el que me presente.

Cuando contribuyas con este proyecto me darás el aliento necesario para mantener la buena energía y compartirla con cada persona que pueda. 


Riesgos y desafíos

Pudieras esperar una demora, pero la demora sería corta porque todas las grabaciones y ediciones están listas.He puesto la fecha de lanzamiento para Mayo 2016, lo cual me dá bastante holgura, pero no hay ninguna garantía de que pueda hacer el lanzamiento para esa fecha. De igual forma voy a tratar lo más que pueda con cumplir esta fecha. 

Si no alcanzo mi meta, voy a tener que recortar costos de alguna forma y el lanzamiento pudiera no ser como se espera. La única forma de recortar costos sería imprimir menos discos y reducir costos de publicidad, entre otras cosas que afectarían el éxito del lanzamiento.


Recompensas








Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Anda a BandCamp y descarga mi canción "Paraguas para ti." Todos los beneficios serán invertidos en el proyecto e incluso 1$ ayuda.

https://yalungtang.bandcamp.com/releases

Lo que puedes hacer y MÁS puede AYUDAR es COMPARTIR esta campaña con el mundo. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, WhatsApp o incluso una llamada telefónica! Comparte esto con las personas que creas que pueden estar interesadas en ayudar a un joven cantautor a alcanzar sus metas profesionales, o que quieran escuchar esta música y verla esparcirse por el mundo.
story_txt:
Haz click para ver en Español

Short Summary
I'm a Venezuelan singer, guitarist and songwriter with a bluesy spirit. I’m 25 years old and I would like to spread my music out to the world. That's why I've been working very hard on my first album titled "Tus Colores" (Your Colors). This project is music being shouted from the deepest of my soul and I want all those screams to be heard, just to tell people they’re not alone. This music has all my deepest feelings and life canned into audio waves. 




What I Need & What You Get

Here is what I've already done with the help
of A LOT of people
1 - Debut album “Tus Colores”:



Composition


Rehearsals


Recording
Musicians


Recording/Editing/Mixing/Mastering
of the audio


Album Artwork


2 - Debut Video clip for “Paraguas para ti”:



Concept


Production


Filming


Ilustrated artwork


Cartoon animation


Video editing


That was a lot of work done in the spare time
of the 12 musicians involved and with the limited time I had with borrowed
equipment. Everything was recorded from January 2014 to September 2015. All the
mixing and mastering of the audio was done by Giscard Valero. “Tus colores” has
12 songs and 42 minutes of music.
What I still need to do is listed
below. 
Remaining...



Printing CDs + Vinyl and CD
Duplication + Digital Distribution - $1,500


“Paraguas
para ti” Video Clip Promotion – 1000$


“Tus
colores” Album Promotion – 1000$


“Lágrimas de Fénix” Video
Filming/Production and Promotion – 1300$


Time capsule – 100$


This is what I need to take this project to
the next level. All additional funds will go towards equipment buying, I’ve
always wished to take piano lessons and I need a keyboard or midi controller to
learn to play and produce music from a piano. 
If you contribute, you'll get some interesting
perks like album downloads, and your name buried in a time capsule under a
weeping willow. You can see all the rewards listed on the “Rewards section” or
once you decide to contribute.



The weeping willow

I’ve always wanted to plant a weeping willow,
I think that this tree reflects the nature of this album. Believe it or not, I’m
planning to plant a tree every time I do something important in my life. In
this opportunity I will bury a time capsule under the tree and I will record
all the process on a video. Your name can be engraved on a metal plate with the
names of all the people that contributes the most to make this album come true
and that plate is going to be inside the capsule.
The capsule will also contain a copy of the
album, song lyrics and all the interesting stuff I can collect from the
musicians involved with the album. 
All the names of the people that contribute
to this crowdfunding campaign will be listed on my social networks with
mentions and in a special section that will be created on my webpage
www.yalungtang.com


It’s a promise

I promise to keep going on this musical path,
to sing and scream out loud everything that’s coming from my soul and from my
heart. I promise to keep producing music and to love every smile in every gig.
When you fund this project you will give me a
breath to keep all the good energy and to share it with every person I can.


Risks & Challenges
Delays are to be expected, but expect them to be short because all the recording and editing is already done. I have set the release for May 2016, which gives me a lot of headroom, but there is no absolute guarantee that I can make that date. I'm gonna try as hard as I can to do it!
If I don't make my goal, I will have to cut costs in some way and the release could not be as expected. The only way to cut costs will be to print less albums, and to reduce marketing costs. Cutting costs could affect the success of this release.


Rewards







Other Ways
You Can Help
Go to band camp and download my song
"Paraguas para ti." All profits are going towards the project and
even $1 helps!
https://yalungtang.bandcamp.com/releases
The MOST helpful thing you can do is to SHARE
this campaign with the world. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, WhatsApp or even a
phone call!  Share it with people who
might be interested in helping a young songwriter achieve a professional goal,
or might want to hear this music spread out to the world!



Click to see it in English

Breve reseña Soy un cantautor Venezolano, canto y toco guitarra con un espíritu bastante blues. Tengo 25 años y quisiera esparcir mi música por el mundo. Es por eso que he estado trabajando duro en mi primer álbum titulado "Tus Colores". Este proyecto es música gritada desde lo más profundo de mi alma y quiero que esos gritos sean escuchados, solo para decirle a la gente que no están solos. Este álbum tiene todos mis sentimientos y mi vida, enlatados en ondas de audio.

Composición

Músicos de sesión

Arte del disco

Arte gráfico


Dibujos animados
