story:
Be my Record Company...

Hey! Welcome to my first ever fundraising campaign for my third full-length album, ‘Head Full of Stars’. For those of you who don’t know me, I’m an independent Canadian artist who has been first cold-pressed from the vines and soil of Niagara's wine growing region in Ontario.

I have a secret to share...
Over the years I have had many interactions with many record labels who have struggled to find a place in the market for me. The record companies that I dealt with often would say that I was too Folk for Pop and too Pop for Folk. I kind of have to agree, I am all those things. But the problem was the "taste-makers" would try to get me to conform into the latest "popular" sound. I decided that it would be best if I just made music I loved rather than make music that wasn't true to who I am.  What do you think? 

Being an independent artist can have its drawbacks, especially in the public relations department. This is where you come in!  I need a Record Company that will be my PR machine and I'm counting on you to be that machine.  So am I looking for a record company? Well, yes… but YOU are actually the record company I'm looking for.

 


Why the title, "Head Full of Stars" ?

On November 17th, 2015, I sustained a pretty major head injury. Most people - including myself, don't really understand what a concussion is...until of course, you are forced to be in a dark room for almost a month. I could barely think straight, I was in a constant fog, dizzy, 'seeing stars', and I honestly had no idea if I would ever be able to do the things I love again. Recovery time can be anywhere from 6 months to 2 years, to even never. So I was afraid... Actually, I was terrified. I felt strange in my own skin. Noises were too loud, singing was too loud, remembering lyrics that used to come so easy was next to impossible, and trying to play chords? So mentally draining. As the months passed, I finally began to put the pieces of my mind back together again. And, after many ups and downs, I knew exactly what I wanted this album to be called. It felt so right. "Head Full of Stars" marks a turning point in my life. A renewal...and most importantly, a second chance.

I am dead set on finally making something that is honestly ‘Ariana Gillis’ – nothing more and nothing less. Sounds simple right? You would think… but I’m telling you, that from a creative standpoint, being yourself might be one of the most difficult challenges you could ever face.

However, we are all crazy excited to finally be recording the new tunes for this album. It's been such a long time coming.  And I am seriously so happy and humbled to be working with the artists, musicians, and people that I have aligned myself with. I am reaching out to all of you now to ask for your support in helping me complete this project. The musicians and producers and engineers are practically helping me for pennies because they believe in the music that I am trying to create. We all want to make something lasting, something truly great – and I hope we can succeed.

If you've liked my music in the past, I think you are seriously going to dig what's coming even more.


 The Producers

Producer Joel Moss is a celebrated American record producer who has won Seven Grammy Awards. He has worked with Tony Bennett, Harry Connick Jr., Ray Charles, Johnny Cash and Bob Dylan to name a few.  I’m so honored to even know him as a friend, let alone have him creatively involved in this project. Turns out, he is just an all around sweet dude. 

Co-Producer David Gillis aka "Gilly'
I know what you're thinking...  He may be my dad, but he's not one of those weird stage-mom types that wants a piece of the action, (honey badger don't give a shit!). He is here because he is a whimsical, creative bad-ass and ideas enter his head like musical popcorn – the producer, Joel Moss insisted that Gilly be a part of this. If you see him play guitar or hear his original songs, it will take you all of 3 seconds to get it. He has been my very first supporter, my mentor and bestest friend.


The Perks

  • Free Mp3 of "Broadway" with every donation of $5.00 or more. This song has a very relevant meaning to this new album. I wrote this song during a troublesome time when I was struggling with the decision of whether or not I still wanted to pursue music. I was traveling to New York and LA and meeting with many different Producers, Managers, Record Label Executives and music industry "experts". I'm sure many people would be thrilled and excited to be in the position I was, but I was far from happy. I was being overwhelmed with conflicting advice from things ranging to my image, music and writing style. "Frustration" doesn't even begin to describe my feelings during that year. I lost my passion, I stopped writing, and seriously contemplated quitting music. But one evening, while I was playing a house concert for some pretty amazing people, I realized, mid-song, that I really didn't care anymore, and it brought a huge smile to my face. I was going to do this my way. I was going to look, act and write like Ariana Gillis. Because that's who I am, and that's the only thing I've got. "Broadway" is my journey through a lonely industry that can try to steal your inner fire and turn you into something you are not and never will be.
  • Digital Album of "Head Full of Stars".
    You get a link to download the digital album before anyone else!

  • Hard Copy of "Head Full of Stars" (signed or unsigned).
    The physical copy of the album (either signed or unsigned) shipped to your front door before anyone else gets it!

  • Ariana Zen Guitar Picks (3)




  • Ariana Gillis T-Shirt



  • Songwriting SKYPE Workshop (Either One or Six)
    One on one time with me for 60 minutes. A how-to of songwriting without any of the usual hoopla you hear when you attend "songwriting lessons". This is an individualistic approach. I work with YOU on your own personal strengths and weaknesses so that you can improve and be inspired.
  • Cover Song
    I will record a cover song of your choice and record it on a very nice camera. I can either put it up on YouTube with a shout out to you, or it can be your own personal video that you can show your friends.

  • Artwork
    I will be designing 18 unique works of art. Each will reflect each song to be recorded on the album. These are one-of-a-kind black and white hand-drawn ink artworks. They will not be replicated, duplicated, or sold to anyone else but YOU! Here are some examples of drawings I have previously done so you can get an idea of my design style:

    • Unique Orn

    Geisha Girl

    Fire Bird



  • Full Band House Concert
    We will provide everything. The music, the sound system, the sound guy, a nice full band, and pay any travel/lodging fees that are necessary in order to bring you a superawesome house concert. The only thing you need to provide is your address. ;)

story:
All music is created equal. We are music lovers united to creating Accessible Festivals.  

My name is Austin Whitney and I founded Accessible Festivals, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, to ensure live music events are available to anyone who wants to attend, regardless of their ability. 

12% of Americans experience some form of disability, roughly 40 million Americans.

Six months after my car accident in 2007 that severed my spinal cord and paralyzed me from the waist down, I attended my first music festival. This was the first time since my injury that I was able to smile and genuinely enjoy life. The simple act of enjoying my favorite music with my best friends, did more for me than any physical therapy, any pharmaceutical, or any counselor could ever do. I was so affected, that I decided I wanted to help others with similar challenges have the opportunity to have experiences like mine. 

Through Accessible Festivals, we provide the accommodations necessary so that everyone can fully experience the beauty of live music. With the right   modifications, any temporary event can be made accessible to anyone, whether it's an ambulatory disability, hearing or vision impairment, a child with cerebral palsy or a veteran amputee. 

What We Do 

In 2015, we made 40 events accessible, whether they were small or large events, on a grass field or on a mountain. We made it happen. Our goal for 2016 is to increase that number to 60 events, and eventually create a new standard of accessibility that is adopted by any and all live music events. What is this new standard?

-  Personal Interaction:  This is the single most important component of a successful Accessibility program. Understanding the true nature of disabilities, and the corresponding needs that arise in a festival environment, is essential for providing the ability to experience live music, regardless of the situation. 

-  ADA Compliance:  Utilizing our legal knowledge, we make sure events are compliant with all federal, state and municipal disability laws, which includes assessments, action plans and implementation strategies. 

-  Infrastructure:  Depending on the event, we design a plan that includes wheelchair viewing areas, shuttle transportation, information areas, accessible parking/camping areas, convenient pathways, assisted listening systems, assisted viewing amenities, emergency services, and much more!

-  Amazing Staff:  Our staff is the heart of Accessible Festivals. Not only are our people passionate and dedicated to the work we do, they are also the best at it. Our staff undergoes the proper training in order to be as helpful to patrons as possible, while also being able to make good judgments and go the extra mile to ensure a positive experience. 


Our vision is to provide the tools necessary for understanding disability on a societal level, so that no one feels stigmatized based on something that cannot be controlled. We begin this journey at music festivals. 

We need at least $25,000 to:  

  • Cover the additional costs of creating 60 accessible events in 2016. This includes equipment such as Access wristbands, Assisted Listening Systems, LED Accessibility Signage, wheelchair accessible shuttle carts, flashlights, padlocks for accessible restrooms, additional staffing and travel expenses. 
  • Achieve our goals of educating the public on the true nature of disability by publishing an annual report that evaluates the current status of accessibility at live music events, and provides detailed analysis of how to increase the standard by efficient and budget-friendly means. In addition, we want to conduct accessibility training courses for individuals interested in the field. 
  • Even if we don't achieve our goal of $25,000, every dollar we receive will go towards establishing accessible venues and making sure live music events are possible for everyone. 
Here is how it gets broken down:

$4000 – Outreach to the Disabled Community

One of our missions is to encourage the disabled community to attend our events. We are told all the time that these events are life changing and we want every person with a disability to know that festivals can be accessible and they should attend! We will be bringing this message to a number of Ability Expos throughout the United States this year and need your support to cover our expenses in getting the word out.

$3000 – Re-stocking Our Supplies

There are many supplies that we need to reorder for our 2016 season. We need new uniforms for our staff and volunteers so that our disabled patrons can quickly identify them. Lighted signage will easily directs our guests towards accessible features such as Accessible Viewing Area that are very difficult to find at night in a crowd. We need road cases to transport our gear across the country to our events. Other supplies include new tools to build and repair our infrastructure on festival sites and captioning software.

$6000 – Wheelchair Accessible Golf Cart

Do you know that there are less than a dozen wheelchair accessible golf carts for rental in the United States? This shortage has led to us being unable to have accessible golf carts at all of our events. By owning a cart, we’ll be able to transport our guests in wheelchairs anywhere at the events, avoiding terrain that is inaccessible in a wheelchair due to hills and terrain.

$3000 – Staff Education

We are always trying to keep our staff educated on the newest trends in accessibility and event management. It is our goal to send a number of our staff to the National ADA Symposium in Denver this year so they can learn how to make our events more accessible. Additionally we’ll be paying for all our staff to complete IAAM’s Crowd Management training before the 2016 festival season.

$3000 – Report on Accessibility

No body really knows the State of the Industry with regards to Accessibility. We hear lots of anecdotes about festivals we aren’t present at but it is our goal to do a comprehensive study that will examine how accessible American festivals really are. Additionally we want to formulate best business practices for the industry so that any event, regardless if we are present or not, has a resource to make their event more accessible.

$2000 – Indiegogo

They take their cut.

$4000 – Incentives

We have to send you our appreciation for donating!



The Impact

  • We are the only organization truly dedicated to our mission. Without us, it is extremely difficult for someone in a wheelchair to get out of a heavy crowd in order locate a restroom, or someone with a hearing impairment to understand and enjoy the music. Accessible Festivals began simply because there needed to be better accommodations made available to people that need them.
  • A disability can be traumatizing in and of itself. It can be even more traumatizing when you can't do something that you love because of your disability. It's important that we help to prevent people from feeling as though they are second-class citizens. There is a disability stigma in America and it needs to be addressed. These are our brothers and sisters, mothers and fathers, friends and neighbors, and they need to be treated with the same respect as everyone else. 

  • We actively push to eliminate all forms of discrimination that people with disabilities experience in the live entertainment industry. We are developing best practices to address some of the largest problems. Such issues include:

    1. Fair ticketing policies for people with disabilities

    2. Discounted tickets for verified medical caretakers

    3. Allowing pregnant women to access ADA services

  • We are taking accessibility to a whole new level. In 2015, we not only made music festivals accessible, we assisted ADA patrons during the Pope's visit to Philadelphia! We now have our sights on municipal events, political events, fixed venue events, and much more! 


Press 

OC Weekly:  http://www.ocweekly.com/music/meet-music-festivals-hero-to-the-handicapped-6570788
Lighthouse:  http://lighthouse-sf.org/blog/start-the-music-accessible-festivals-are-a-reality/ 
The Hub:  http://www.thehubsocal.com/2015/07/17/79463/mus...


Testimonials

http://www.accessiblefestivals.com/#!testimonials-/c1gim


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word and let people know about our campaign! Disabilities occur everyday and we want to make sure it is known that our organization exists and wants to help adjust and acclimate in such a way that they can still enjoy their lives to the fullest!
  • Like our Facebook page.
  • Get involved! We are always looking for qualified individuals who share our vision and want to work with us!
story_txt:
All music is created equal. We are music lovers united to creating Accessible Festivals.  
My name is Austin Whitney and I founded Accessible Festivals, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, to ensure live music events are available to anyone who wants to attend, regardless of their ability. 


12% of Americans experience some form of disability, roughly 40 million Americans.

Six months after my car accident in 2007 that severed my spinal cord and paralyzed me from the waist
 down, I attended my first music 
festival. This was the first time since my injury that I was able to smile and 
genuinely enjoy life. The simple act of enjoying my favorite music with my best friends, did more for me than any physical therapy, any pharmaceutical, or any counselor could ever do. I was so affected, that I decided I wanted to help others with similar challenges have the opportunity to have experiences like mine. 


Through Accessible Festivals, we provide
 the accommodations necessary so that everyone can fully experience the 
beauty of live music. With the right   modifications, any temporary event can be made accessible to anyone, whether it's an ambulatory disability, hearing or vision impairment, a child with cerebral palsy or a veteran amputee. 


What We Do In 2015, we made 40 events accessible, whether they were small or large events, on a grass field or on a mountain. We made it happen. Our goal for 2016 is to increase that number to 60 events, and eventually create a new standard of accessibility that is adopted by any and all live music events. What is this new standard?-  Personal Interaction:  This is the single most important component of a successful Accessibility program. Understanding the true nature of disabilities, and the corresponding needs that arise in a festival environment, is essential for providing the ability to experience live music, regardless of the situation. 

-  ADA Compliance:  Utilizing our legal knowledge, we make sure events are compliant with all federal, state and municipal disability laws, which includes assessments, action plans and implementation strategies. 
-  Infrastructure:  Depending on the event, we design a plan that includes wheelchair viewing areas, shuttle transportation, information areas, accessible parking/camping areas, convenient pathways, assisted listening systems, assisted viewing amenities, emergency services, and much more!
-  Amazing Staff:  Our staff is the heart of Accessible Festivals. Not only are our people passionate and dedicated to the work we do, they are also the best at it. Our staff undergoes the proper training in order to be as helpful to patrons as possible, while also being able to make good judgments and go the extra mile to ensure a positive experience. 





Our vision is to provide the tools necessary for understanding disability on a societal level, so that no one feels stigmatized based on something that cannot be controlled. We begin this journey at music festivals.  We need at least $25,000 to:  
 Cover the additional costs of creating 60 accessible events in 2016. This includes equipment such as Access wristbands, Assisted Listening Systems, LED Accessibility Signage, wheelchair accessible shuttle carts, flashlights, padlocks for accessible restrooms, additional staffing and travel expenses. 
Achieve our goals of educating the public on the true nature of disability by publishing an annual report that evaluates the current status of accessibility at live music events, and provides detailed analysis of how to increase the standard by efficient and budget-friendly means. In addition, we want to conduct accessibility training courses for individuals interested in the field.  Even if we don't achieve our goal of $25,000, every dollar we receive will go towards establishing accessible venues and making sure live music events are possible for everyone. 

Here is how it gets broken down:

$4000 – Outreach to the Disabled Community
One of our missions is to encourage the disabled community to attend our events. We are told all the time that these events are life changing and we want every person with a disability to know that festivals can be accessible and they should attend! We will be bringing this message to a number of Ability Expos throughout the United States this year and need your support to cover our expenses in getting the word out.
$3000 – Re-stocking Our Supplies
There are many supplies that we need to reorder for our 2016 season. We need new uniforms for our staff and volunteers so that our disabled patrons can quickly identify them. Lighted signage will easily directs our guests towards accessible features such as Accessible Viewing Area that are very difficult to find at night in a crowd. We need road cases to transport our gear across the country to our events. Other supplies include new tools to build and repair our infrastructure on festival sites and captioning software.
$6000 – Wheelchair Accessible Golf Cart
Do you know that there are less than a dozen wheelchair accessible golf carts for rental in the United States? This shortage has led to us being unable to have accessible golf carts at all of our events. By owning a cart, we’ll be able to transport our guests in wheelchairs anywhere at the events, avoiding terrain that is inaccessible in a wheelchair due to hills and terrain.
$3000 – Staff Education
We are always trying to keep our staff educated on the newest trends in accessibility and event management. It is our goal to send a number of our staff to the National ADA Symposium in Denver this year so they can learn how to make our events more accessible. Additionally we’ll be paying for all our staff to complete IAAM’s Crowd Management training before the 2016 festival season.
$3000 – Report on Accessibility
No body really knows the State of the Industry with regards to Accessibility. We hear lots of anecdotes about festivals we aren’t present at but it is our goal to do a comprehensive study that will examine how accessible American festivals really are. Additionally we want to formulate best business practices for the industry so that any event, regardless if we are present or not, has a resource to make their event more accessible.
$2000 – Indiegogo
They take their cut.
$4000 – Incentives
We have to send you our appreciation for donating!






    The Impact  
We are the only organization truly dedicated to our mission. Without us, it is extremely difficult for someone in a wheelchair to get out of a heavy crowd in order locate a restroom, or someone with a hearing impairment to understand and enjoy the music. Accessible Festivals began simply because there needed to be better accommodations made available to people that need them.

A disability can be traumatizing in and of itself. It can be even more traumatizing when you can't do something that you love because of your disability. It's important that we help to prevent people from feeling as though they are second-class citizens. There is a disability stigma in America and it needs to be addressed. These are our brothers and sisters, mothers and fathers, friends and neighbors, and they need to be treated with the same respect as everyone else.  
We actively push to eliminate all forms of discrimination that people with disabilities experience in the live entertainment industry. We are developing best practices to address some of the largest problems. Such issues include:

Fair ticketing policies for people with disabilities
Discounted tickets for verified medical caretakers
Allowing pregnant women to access ADA services






We are taking accessibility to a whole new level. In 2015, we not only made music festivals accessible, we assisted ADA patrons during the Pope's visit to Philadelphia! We now have our sights on municipal events, political events, fixed venue events, and much more!

The Hub:  http://www.thehubsocal.com/2015/07/17/79463/mus...

Other Ways You Can Help 


Spread the word and let people know about our campaign! Disabilities occur everyday and we want to make sure it is known that our organization exists and wants to help adjust and acclimate in such a way that they can still enjoy their lives to the fullest!

story:
Hi! I'm releasing my 1st Album, with one of my favorite music producers, Srikalogy, who blends together dub, hip hop, reggae, world beats, soundscapes, and sacred mantras. The process of this album has been a transformational journey over the last few years, and it is coming to fruition. One of the songs is a sound healing track in which the music was tuned to two different solfeggio frequencies: Repair DNA (528 Hz) & Return to Spiritual Order (852 Hz.)  Some of the drum beats were sampled from tapping a water bottle. Another track is called, "Brothers & Sisters of the Revolution" inspired by the homeless on the city streets, and speaking on racism, inequality, and the "system."  My first poem was published at the age of 11, and I grew up playing piano, singing, writing, and studying acting and dance, while being involved in activist work throughout high school and college. My goal is to spread authenticity and be a vessel for transformation. Read my Bio and Mission for more. If this mission inspires you, please assist me in making this project come to fruition. The money will go towards the final aspects of musical production, album artwork, cd distribution, and potentially video work. Take a look at my video, which includes excerpts of the songs and studio clips. Also check out the "Creation of LUCID EARTH" video; as well as videos of performance footage at the top.  We R the Revolution we've been Wading 4.  REELeyes Ur Highest Self & REEL Back w/ Rhyme. We R Rhythm. 

ABOUT:                                                                                                                                                                      'Indigo Moon' is a solo artist combining lyricism, spoken word poetry, floetry, and sultry, ethereal vocals over beats, ranging from downtempo, dub, soundscape, trip-hop, tribal, house, and ambient genres, collaborating with various electronic producers."

MISSION:                                                                                                                                                                   Indigo Moon's mission is to use lyrical imagery, vocals, and music to shed light on concepts for the purpose of surfacing; and to create experiential soundscapes igniting all the senses. Her work is a birthing process of her life experience for the purpose of transformation. Her goal is to empower others, and be a voice to the voiceless, while spreading the seed of authenticity.

The Moon emanates light in the midst of darkness.  We cannot be in touch with the light without embracing our darkness.  The light and darkness must coexist and work cohesively together. The darkness needs light in order to thrive. Therefore, Indigo Moon represents synthesizing the light and darkness.

http://indigomoonfrequentzy.com/  http://srikalogy.com/  https://indigomoonfrequentzy.bandcamp.com/  https://www.facebook.com/IndigoMoonFrequentzy/  Youtube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLV63ED43...

BIO:                                                                                                                                                                              'Indigo Moon' is a lyricist, spoken word artist, vocalist, choreographer, with a background in dance and acting. Her first poem was published at the age of 11. She was inspired to do Spoken Word Poetry from the work of actor/poet, Saul Williams. Indigo Moon grew up studying classical piano for six years, along with extensive training in dance, voice, and acting. She got accepted to the BFA Musical Theatre program at Emerson College and studied theatre/media arts/radio. At Emerson she was a DJ on WERS, the top college & professionally run radio station broadcasted throughout the Northeast, for the underground electronic & hip hop station, “Revolutions.” She developed her own radio show called, “Sultry Sounds from the Lounge.” She went to Trinity/La Mama Experimental Theatre Club, and studied mixed media performance, experimental theatre, acting, movement, voice, and butoh. In 2008 she started performing in the NYC poetry clubs, while singing background vocals for reggae and african bands, such as Sekouba & The Bolomba Band (2011) and International Generation (a band she was also managing.) That's how she started pursuing music more seriously. She has performed at venues, such as, Dixon Place, La Mama E.T.C. (Poetry Electric Series), Nuyorican Poets Cafe, Nublu, Shrine, Rose Live, Leopard Lounge, Pyramid Club, Bowery Poetry Club, Zebulon, and Summerstage. She has shared the stage with artists such as, Kevin Batchelor & Cedric Brooks (The Skatalites,) and Keith Wildchild Middleton (STOMP.)

-"Creation of LUCID EARTH-" (Production Clips in Studio)

https://youtu.be/dvnkt87oB2Y

-Lucid Earth Pitch w/ Srikala: (Why it is Important to Follow Our Dreams)

https://youtu.be/3EvCvSgL7zs

story:
Gypsy Java

Hi.  I am Vanessa and I have been an art teacher for 17 years.  I was born and raised in the Portage Lakes, a town south of Akron, Ohio and when I was 24, I moved to Tampa, Florida.  In the summer of 2015, my grandfather, who was an entrepreneur and successful Akron businessman, passed away and my daughter and I flew to Akron to attend the funeral.  We stayed for most of the summer, to be with family and to grieve my grandfather.  That summer redirected my passion for the arts and made me a woman on a mission.

In July, my daughter and I flew back to Tampa, and it was the first time since I had left the Portage Lakes in 1999, that my heart ached for my hometown.  That summer, I had reconnected with the artists, writers, and musicians that had been scarce when I was living there.  The Portage Lakes are full of people who work hard, survive hard winters, and are the salt of the earth.  As I discovered this summer, they are also the sculptors, poets, and guitarists that keep the soul of the Lakes alive. 

And we need a space—to create, collaborate, and present our work.  We need an environment that draws the artists, writers, and musicians to come and share ideas over a cup of coffee or a glass of wine.  We need excellent WiFi, good coffee, and great conversation about art. 

If you contribute to Gypsy Java, you will be helping a town get in touch with its local arts community.  You will be helping foster the arts in a community that is slowly losing its art outlets.  You would be at the beginning of building a strong and vibrant arts community in the Portage Lakes.

Funding Gypsy Java

I am attempting to raise $75,000 dollars to cover the costs of opening a new business.  The building, the renovations, the licensing, the machinery, the inventory, the entertainment—all of these things are the fundamentals of why I am trying to raise money.  The more visceral reason that I want to try and fund all this money through this campaign is so that I can devote all my energy and focus towards hiring excellent people, creating a unique and inviting space, and making this a worthwhile venture for the people of the Portage Lakes to enjoy and celebrate their local artists, writers, and musicians, without the pressure of a bank loan due date.  Those due dates have a way of taking attention off what is truly important and it can warp the vision.

With each contribution, there are different levels of perks.  Shout outs, t-shirts, coffee mugs are just small ways that I can say thank you for being part of building something wonderful.

If we don’t reach our goal of $75,000, the money we do raise will go first towards the purchasing of equipment, like espresso machines and sound systems, and for renovations and construction. 

The Impact of Gypsy Java

This creative endeavor is to promote the business of art in the Portage Lakes community.  I mean to facilitate the creation of a space that fosters the creative culture, whatever form that it takes, in my hometown.  The Portage Lakes has a rich, colorful history, with lore and stories available at every pub.  I would like those stories to include its artists, writers, and musicians. 

I am an art teacher.  I value the education and enlightenment of others, above all things.  It is my sincere hope to involve all level of artists in the Portage Lakes community in Gypsy Java.  From the school-aged artists to the professionals, I want them included in the culture at Gypsy Java. For 17 years, I have collaborated and conversed with thousands of young people on different parts of their art journey, be it beginner or advanced.  I can manage a classroom with minimal effort and I can inspire the most skeptical pre-teen to create great works.  My ability to organize, problem-solve, and overcome adversity are legendary, in my classroom and beyond.  I am driven to succeed because I believe that this endeavor is a worthy one.

Risks & Challenges

Risks: 

·   Financial:  I am using my retirement and personal funds to get this project off the ground. 

·  Personal:  I am leaving my family, home, and career in Tampa, FL for over a year to create Gypsy Java.

·  Emotional:  It is scary to step out of what is normal in your life and take a risk.  I tell everyone that I am terrified, but in a good way.

Challenges:

·   Financial:  Starting and running a successful business requires money and the ability to manage money.

·  Changing fields:  I was trained as an educator, not a business person.  I will have to learn an entirely new career and perspective in order to become a successful business owner.

·  Leaving my family in Florida:  I will leave my daughter and husband in Florida to open and run Gypsy Java for over a year.  Trying to parent from a distance is going to require amazing amounts of communication and patience.

Skills to overcome obstacles:

·  Creative-problem solving:  My students call me a “recovery artist” because I can recover from any kind of perceived disaster—like a spilled paint tray on a final work or a broken sandal strap during first period.  Problems are just an opportunity for me to put my creativity to work.

·  Hard work:  Most people consider “work” a dirty word, but work builds self-esteem and confidence.  I enjoy putting in the work because it yields growth, be it physical, spiritual, or emotional.  I will work until I fall down from exhaustion and I attribute that trait to being raised in the Portage Lakes.  It is one of the qualities I value most about myself.

·  Organization:  There is no chaos or mess that I cannot put to order. 

·  Communication:  I work with over 220 children a day and my communication skills have to be top-notch to keep everything running smoothly.  Clear communication helps to eliminate undue stress for children, their parents, other teachers, and administrators.  I leave nothing unsaid and my students appreciate that honesty.  “Do you want me to be nice or be honest?” is what I ask them when they come to me for advice on their work.  100% of the time they say “Be honest.” 

Other Ways You Can Help Gypsy Java

·  Get the word out!  Post this campaign on your social media and talk about Gypsy Java when you are out and about in the community.

·  If you know artists, musicians, and writers in the Portage Lakes, lead them to me.  I want to show their work and have them perform.

·  When we open, come have a cup of coffee and chat with me.

I am an art teacher.  I value the education and enlightenment of
others, above all things.  It is my
sincere hope to involve all level of artists in the Portage Lakes community in
Gypsy Java.  From the school-aged artists
to the professionals, I want them included in the culture at Gypsy Java. For 17
years, I have collaborated and conversed with thousands of young people on
different parts of their art journey, be it beginner or advanced.  I can manage a classroom with minimal effort
and I can inspire the most skeptical pre-teen to create great works.  My ability to organize, problem-solve, and
overcome adversity are legendary, in my classroom and beyond.  I am driven to succeed because I believe that
this endeavor is a worthy one.
Risks & Challenges
Risks: 

· 
 Financial:  I am using my retirement and personal funds
to get this project off the ground.  
· 
Personal:  I am leaving my family,
home, and career in Tampa, FL for over a year to create Gypsy Java.
· 
Emotional:  It is scary to step out
of what is normal in your life and take a risk. 
I tell everyone that I am terrified, but in a good way.
Challenges:
· 
 Financial:  Starting and running a successful business
requires money and the ability to manage money.
· 
Changing fields:  I was trained as
an educator, not a business person.  I
will have to learn an entirely new career and perspective in order to become a
successful business owner.
· 
Leaving my family in Florida:  I
will leave my daughter and husband in Florida to open and run Gypsy Java for
over a year.  Trying to parent from a
distance is going to require amazing amounts of communication and patience.
Skills to overcome obstacles:
· 
Creative-problem solving:  My
students call me a “recovery artist” because I can recover from any kind of
perceived disaster—like a spilled paint tray on a final work or a broken sandal
strap during first period.  Problems are
just an opportunity for me to put my creativity to work.
· 
Hard work:  Most people consider “work”
a dirty word, but work builds self-esteem and confidence.  I enjoy putting in the work because it yields
growth, be it physical, spiritual, or emotional.  I will work until I fall down from exhaustion
and I attribute that trait to being raised in the Portage Lakes.  It is one of the qualities I value most about
myself.
· 
Organization:  There is no chaos or
mess that I cannot put to order.  
· 
Communication:  I work with over
220 children a day and my communication skills have to be top-notch to keep
everything running smoothly.  Clear
communication helps to eliminate undue stress for children, their parents,
other teachers, and administrators.  I leave
nothing unsaid and my students appreciate that honesty.  “Do you want me to be nice or be honest?” is
what I ask them when they come to me for advice on their work.  100% of the time they say “Be honest.”  
Other Ways You Can Help Gypsy Java
· 
Get the word out!  Post this
campaign on your social media and talk about Gypsy Java when you are out and
about in the community.
· 
If you know artists, musicians, and writers in the Portage Lakes, lead
them to me.  I want to show their work
and have them perform.
· 
When we open, come have a cup of coffee and chat with me.

story:
Stage Two at ROTARYFEST, The Sault's Summer Festival

If you're under the age of 95, then ROTARYFEST has been around as long as you can remember, and if you're from the Sault and area then you probably have fond memories of walking the grounds, enjoying the warm summer weather, and listening to free live music.

For ten years, part of the ROTARYFEST tradition has been Stage Two - a place where young local artists can reach a broader audience and showcase their original work.

What We Need & What You Get

This year, we invite the Sault and area to come together in support of our city's local festival, and in support of local arts and culture. 

Every donation to this campaign goes towards costs associated with Stage Two, either this year or in future years, including compensating young musicians in our community for their incredible performances.

Any donation you can give helps, but you might want to check out the sweet merch associated with giving certain amounts.

*Please use an active email to check out if you are going to be claiming a shirt, as we will be emailing you about the type of shirt you want as well as the size.

Shirt Perks

Shirts will feature this year’s Stage Two artwork across the front (similar to pictured). 

The back of the shirt will list this year’s bands and their stage times in a tour-style.

*If you are taking advantage of a perk that includes a shirt (Promoter or Rock Star) please use a valid email address upon check-out, as we will be contacting you re: how you feel about shirt sleeves and the size of shirt you’d prefer. If you don't hear back within two business days check your junk folder or use the "contact us" option at the top of this page.

The Impact

ROTARYFEST needs your support to help us safeguard this unparalleled opportunity for young musicians in our community, and continue offering a venue for original music at ROTARYFEST for people of all ages to enjoy.

Playing Stage Two is sometimes a band's first time playing a public, all-ages show on a proper stage with professional sound. Any contribution you make shows support for up-and-coming musicians - the Sault's next generation of music.

Risks & Challenges

We have always prioritized maintaining ROTARYFEST as a community festival by keeping it ungated and having the live music free for all to enjoy. This philosophy of being a community festival is at the heart of ROTARYFEST, but it does mean that we have to rely on our generous sponsors, hardworking volunteers, and community supporters to keep the grounds accessible for all. 

This campaign is a first step in creating an environment where people who are passionate about having a place for young artists at the Sault's largest festival and invested in the local arts and culture can directly contribute to the cause.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially to this campaign. We would still love to see you down on the grounds at Stage Two supporting the artists, and please consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family. 

KEEP THE SOO ROCKIN'

story:
Skinny Is 

          Who???

               Green?

'Skinny Is Green (SIG) initially was a one man band when Rav started writing and recording songs in his ancient PC and music softwares. The guitar was directly plugged into an interface and everything else besides vocal was made out of mouse clicks, including the drums tracks. It took about 3 years and that's how SIG and the first album Dreamers was born. After the release of Dreamers, Jason joined forces with Rav on drums and soon started playing live shows all around Dallas Fort Worth area. 

Their sound has been redefined ever since they started playing together. They've been playing gigs and connecting to more and more listeners who've shown their appreciation for a blend of hard rock and synths in their music.'

With this campaign you can help us achieve our goals to make our 1st Studio Album: "So, Who's Watching?".  We have entered a studio to record our instruments 'live'. At the same time we'll still keep the experimental side alive while Rav still uses the old PC to create some cool synths & licks.

We have started recording a couple of tracks at the Zig Production Studio located in Arlington, Texas. We have about 10 tracks that are ready to roll. Most importantly, we feel very motivated to make great music in a good studio environment. 

The album is set to be released on October 1st and we're going to have a grand album launch party for the release - the venue is yet to be confirmed. Yes! you're definitely invited.

(P.S. Rock n' Roll is a spirit which never dies)

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are offering everything with the highest possible value on this campaign. Most importantly, we're looking to collaborate with our fans and supporters.
  • We have CDs, T-shirts, and other merchandising available in the perks section. 
  • We are going to be filming a documentary on making of the album which will help you get to know the band better and you will get to see the creative process the band goes through in order to create their art. We will send you the video file in a USB after it's completion after you make the order.
  • Your contribution for this project will help us afford the studio time to record, mix and master the songs. 
  • It will be used towards printing and duplication of disks with professional artwork on it.
  • The funds will also go towards 2 music videos of our songs that are set to be filmed in July and August respectively and also for the documentary itself.
  • If the funding exceeds our goal, we will dedicate the additional funds for promotion and marketing of the album to connect with more listeners around the world.
  • This is a collaboration between YOU and the band. 

The Impact

  • For the past 6 months we've dedicated our time to writing meaningful songs that will appeal anyone who has struggled in life in some way or the other. 

Expected Cost Breakdown

This is the expected breakdown of how we plan to use your contribution: 

•Recording: $1,900. 

($1,400 of this will go towards recording and mixing, and another $500 will pay for mastering)

•Art work+Photography+CD Packaging: $1,000 - $1,300

(1,000 CDs in Eco-Wallet cases) 

•Music Videos+ Documentary Video: $2,000  

(We have already initiated the shoot for our first music video which is set to be filmed on July 15th and 16th)


Risks & Challenges

We're aware that this is a bumpy road we're riding on. Without a label and media support it's usually tough for indie bands like us to reach as many people as we would like to, even for this campaign.

In case we don't reach our goal, we might have to step down and get back to home recording and mixing, which could mean some compromise in the quality. However, we assure you that we will still get the album out anyhow with the best we've got. Take our previous album Dreamers for example, which was made with zero cost but that would mean a lot of drum programming and Jason might as well be dancing while Rav plugs the notes down in a music software. Definitely not a great feeling for a band! 

More importantly, it's the experience and time we spend on the studio together that is going to shape this record and the future of the band. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would highly appreciate it if you pass along this message along with your friends and share it via emails and social medias. 

Special Thanks To

Mr. Billy Herzig from Zig Production and who has been Rav's vocal instructor in the past, and the audio engineer for the album.
Akash Ranjit for capturing the video/moments in the studio.
Flash brush photography and Rachel Priya for band photography..
All our family, friends, fans and supporters.

story:
Bharati: Mein Weg zum Dunkelretreat
Bevor du dich entscheidest unser Projekt zu unterstützen, möchte ich dir gerne etwas über Dunkelretreat und meinen Weg erzählen. 
Ich habe viele Jahre in Indien gelebt. Dort erfuhr ich hochenergetische, spirituelle Einweihungen und Energieprozesse. Durch diese wirklich einzigartigen Jahre des kompletten Rückzugs aus der westlichen Welt weiß ich, dass wahre Erleuchtungszustände für jede Seele erreichbar sind. 
Ich wünsche mir, dass mehr Menschen wirkliche *echte* spirituelle Erfahrungen, wie das Verbinden mit Engeln und hohen spirituellen Seelen, auch tatsächlich selbst erleben. Die Dunkelheit, gepaart mit kraftvollen spirituellen Techniken, wie z. B. Mantren, ist ein sehr effektiver Weg zu diesen wahrhaften spirituellen Erfahrungen.
Wenn wir weit genug loslassen, hören wir auf, im Außen zu “projizieren” und wir schauen, im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes, nach innen, denn das “Außen” existiert im Dunkelretreat nur noch bedingt. Dadurch ist es möglich, von der “ICH”-Erfahrung zum “SEIN” zu kommen – ein wundervoller Zustand der Einheit und des Angekommen-Seins.

Die Quelle der Kraft
Mitten in der Natur, abseits von Ortschaften und direkt am Wald, liegt unser neues Seminarhaus. Hier stehen sechs Zimmer mit Duschbad und WC für Dunkelretreats und außerdem ein Gruppenraum zur Verfügung. Das Wasser beziehen wir aus einer eigenen Quelle. Der perfekte Ort für innere Einkehr und Ruhe.  

Von Herz zu Herz

In der ersten Phase renovieren wir den Dunkelretreat-Bereich. Dieser Bereich soll mit hochwertigem Boden und professionelle Verdunklungen versehen werden und es sind Fenster auszutauschen. Wir möchten hierfür hochwertige Materialien nutzen und alles so vorbereiten, dass Räume voller Liebe und Geborgenheit entstehen. Ein Platz, an dem du dich mit deiner Seele verbinden kannst und dein inneres Licht erkennst.

Hierfür benötigen wir deine Hilfe. Für die erste Phase der Renovierung (den Dunkelretreat-Bereich) benötigen wir 12.000€. Dieses Geld fließt in hochwertige Materialien und Handwerker, die uns beim Umbau helfen.

Für deine Unterstützung sind wir sehr dankbar. Als Austausch erhältst du die Möglichkeit, direkt nach der Renovierung in diesem wunderbaren Haus deine ganz eigenen spirituellen Erfahrungen zu machen.
 

Dunkelretreat: Heilung für die Welt

Ein längerer Aufenthalt im Dunkeln wird auch häufig Dunkeltherapie genannt, denn die Zeit ohne Ablenkungen, nur mit sich selbst, wirkt auf vielen Ebenen äußerst heilsam.

Im Gegensatz zu gängigen Therapieansätzen arbeitet man in der Dunkeltherapie nicht mit einzelnen Problemen, sondern erfasst den Mensch als Einheit. Es geht zunächst vor allem darum, sich mit sich selbst und dem Universum zu verbinden und als Einheit zu fühlen. Tief verbunden mit unserer Seele erfahren wir oft Erstaunliches über unser eigenes Sein.


Grundsätzlich ist ein Dunkelretreat eine wunderbare Selbsterfahrung für alle gesunden Erwachsenen ab 18 Jahren. Ganz besonders geeignet ist ein Dunkelretreat für drei Gruppen:

  1. Du spürst das Verlangen nach eigenen *echten* spirituelle Erfahrungen, und du möchtest in deiner persönlichen und spirituellen Entwicklung einen großen Schritt nach vorne machen.

  2. Du bist in deinem Leben an einem entscheidenden Wendepunkt angelangt. Du wirst eine wichtige Entscheidung treffen und möchtest dafür auf allen Ebenen Klarheit gewinnen.

  3. Dich spricht eines der Themen unserer Gruppen-Retreats an (Astralreisen, Meditation, Heilung, Stille, Detox) und du möchtest dich einige Tage ganz intensiv diesem Thema widmen.

Wir führen seit Jahren Dunkelretreats in Deutschland und Indien durch. Die Betreuung von interessanten Dunkelretreatgruppen hat uns sogar schon bis nach Kolumbien geführt. Aktuell erweitern wir das Betreuer-Team und starten auch eine Ausbildung. Ziel der Dunkelretreat-Ausbildung ist es, das Wissen und die Fähigkeiten zu vermitteln, um eigenständig Dunkelretreats auf höchstem Qualitätsstandard durchführen zu können. Besonderes Augenmerk liegt dabei auf der Vermittlung psychologischer Grundlagen und des spirituellen Wissens sowie auf dem Weitergeben unserer jahrelangen intensiven Betreuungserfahrungen.

Wie wird sich unsere Welt transformieren, wenn wir uns mit der eigenen Seele verbinden und unsere Berufung leben? Wir glauben, dass jetzt der richtige Zeitpunkt gekommen ist, vielen Leuten diese Erfahrung zu ermöglichen. Unsere Vision ist es, dass sehr viele Menschen, weltweit die Möglichkeit haben, diese intensive Art der Selbsterfahrung zu erleben. 
Falls du auch davon überzeugt bist, dass Dunkelretreats in der Transformation von Bewusstsein und des Planeten wichtige Rolle spielen wird, dann hast du jetzt die Möglichkeit, ein Teil dieser Bewegung zu werden.

Aktuelle Herausforderungen
Wir haben die Übernahme und den Umbau des Hauses seit einem Jahr vorbereitet. Hierbei wurden wir von Experten für Renovierung und einem Baubiologen unterstützt. Am liebsten würden wir direkt alle 6 Zimmer komplett mit hochwertigen Materialien renovieren und in Betrieb nehmen. Allerdings kosten hochwertige Baumaßnahmen eine Menge Geld. Falls wir nicht den gewünschten Betrag erhalten, so werden wir die Zimmer nach und nach renovieren und zunächst Kompromisse eingehen.
Wir sind selbst handwerklich nicht besonders begabt und deshalb angewiesen auf die Hilfe von Fachleuten, die uns helfen. An dieser Stelle auch noch einmal vielen Dank an die Helfer, die uns ihre Arbeitszeit kostenfrei zur Verfügung stellen. Falls du auch helfen möchtest, so nimm bitte Kontakt mit uns auf. 
 

Andere Wege, wie du helfen kannst

Auch wenn du uns nicht finanziell unterstützen kannst, so gibt es doch viele Dinge, die du tun kannst, um uns weiter zu helfen:
  • Verbinde dich innerlich mit uns. Schicke uns dein Licht und deinen Segen für dieses Projekt.
  • Teile diese Kampagne mit deinen Freunden in Facebook und in spirituellen Gruppen auf Facebook
  • Weise persönliche Freunde per Email auf unser Vorhaben hin
  • Komm uns besuchen und unterstütze uns vor Ort. Es gibt immer genug zu tun! Jeder ist willkommen. Jede Hand hilft. Du musst nicht unbedingt handwerklich begabt sein.
Wir freuen uns von dir zu hören!

Deine Bharati & Martin Glanert
und das Spiritbalance Team

Besonderes Augenmerk liegt dabei auf der Vermittlung psychologischer Grundlagen und des spirituellen Wissens sowie auf dem Weitergeben unserer jahrelangen intensiven Betreuungserfahrungen.


Wie wird sich unsere Welt transformieren, wenn wir uns mit der eigenen Seele verbinden und unsere Berufung leben? Wir glauben, dass jetzt der richtige Zeitpunkt gekommen ist, vielen Leuten diese Erfahrung zu ermöglichen. Unsere Vision ist es, dass sehr viele Menschen, weltweit die Möglichkeit haben, diese intensive Art der Selbsterfahrung zu erleben. 

Falls du auch davon überzeugt bist, dass Dunkelretreats in der Transformation von Bewusstsein und des Planeten wichtige Rolle spielen wird, dann hast du jetzt die Möglichkeit, ein Teil dieser Bewegung zu werden.



Aktuelle HerausforderungenWir haben die Übernahme und den Umbau des Hauses seit einem Jahr vorbereitet. Hierbei wurden wir von Experten für Renovierung und einem Baubiologen unterstützt. Am liebsten würden wir direkt alle 6 Zimmer komplett mit hochwertigen Materialien renovieren und in Betrieb nehmen. Allerdings kosten hochwertige Baumaßnahmen eine Menge Geld. Falls wir nicht den gewünschten Betrag erhalten, so werden wir die Zimmer nach und nach renovieren und zunächst Kompromisse eingehen.Wir sind selbst handwerklich nicht besonders begabt und deshalb angewiesen auf die Hilfe von Fachleuten, die uns helfen. An dieser Stelle auch noch einmal vielen Dank an die Helfer, die uns ihre Arbeitszeit kostenfrei zur Verfügung stellen. Falls du auch helfen möchtest, so nimm bitte Kontakt mit uns auf.  
Andere Wege, wie du helfen kannst
Auch wenn du uns nicht finanziell unterstützen kannst, so gibt es doch viele Dinge, die du tun kannst, um uns weiter zu helfen:


Verbinde dich innerlich mit uns. Schicke uns dein Licht und deinen Segen für dieses Projekt.

Teile diese Kampagne mit deinen Freunden in Facebook und in spirituellen Gruppen auf Facebook
Weise persönliche Freunde per Email auf unser Vorhaben hin
Komm uns besuchen und unterstütze uns vor Ort. Es gibt immer genug zu tun! Jeder ist willkommen. Jede Hand hilft. Du musst nicht unbedingt handwerklich begabt sein.

Wir freuen uns von dir zu hören!
Deine Bharati & Martin Glanertund das Spiritbalance Team

story:
2 years ago, I decided to pursue my love of music. I got my keyboard, microphone, and software and started putting old songs and poems to music. Since than, I have released 2 albums and 2 EP's along with some singles.

Hateful Decay has always been a very personal project to me, and I've always reflected myself in my songs. My newest album, The Lonely Astronaut, is especially personal and honest. I completely open up in my lyrics and delve into a lot of subjects I've kept hidden, exposing feelings and thoughts I've never before discussed.

The Lonely Astronaut takes place right after my latest album, Eclipse, an album about the lonely astronaut as robotic deities come to wipe humanity's slate clean. This leads to him going to space on his quest to find where he belongs, doing a lot of soul searching along the way.

The money raised from this campaign will be used to fund the production of my latest album. I'm also looking into getting the equipment and software needed to perform my music live to gain exposure and hype for new music.

I want to thank each of you for taking the time to read this and accompany me on my journey to space. Whether or not you choose to donate, I'm always thankful for the support and encouragement from each of you. Even if I don't reach my goal, I will still do everything in my power to make this happen. As long as I have supporters listening to my music, I will continue to make it. Thank you!

story:
"Original Swimming Party are one of the most exciting bands I have heard in years. The melodies and textures within the music together with the visuals set the tone for a musical experience like no other. This is a great example of powerful music coming out of Africa that is unmatched by anything else happening in the world. Unadulterated songwriting serving music at it’s best." 
- Gareth Wilson, Goodluck Bar & Oppikoppi Festival

About Us

We make left-field electronica with dreamy vocals and synths, mixed with thumping african influenced beats. We also create beautiful visual material that we project onto ourselves during our live shows. It looks & sounds just like this:


We’re passionate about making music and visuals that are beautiful, complex and don’t sacrifice integrity for commercial appeal. Unfortunately that means we don’t receive a lot of support from the mainstream music industry, in spite of how hard we hustle.

That’s Where You Come In

We want you to be a part of the "Hypergiant Audio Visual Tour".

We already have  some pretty beautiful visuals but we know we can make them better. We want to film new visual material with a cinematic narrative and cleverly combine it with our existing graphic material. We’ll combine all this to create a compelling live show that we’ll preview in Cape Town before taking it to the world.


Roadblocks

Being a band in the Internet age is tough. Sales are at an all time low yet there are still hard costs to making music, visual content and touring.

We already have a concept, locations, cast, director and cinematographer ready to create the visuals but we need to hire top quality film equipment to get the best results possible. We also want to pay the team who will help us, ‘cause no artist should have to work for free.

We also want to tour the show because, let’s be honest, our moms are tired of hearing how awesome we think it is. That involves costs like flights, accommodation and if we really want to get lots of people to experience it, visas too. We’ll of course be able to recoup some money from tickets sales at gigs but trying to break through in a new area with people who have no idea who you are can be brutal… It means we need to pay for flyers and online advertising to make sure people hear about the show and that can be pretty expensive too. We already have an amazing management team in the US, sisters Morgan & Meg, who have booked us a number of shows in November, we just need to get there.

All that’s missing from our magnificent plan is the budget to pull it all together.


Be The Fuel To Our Rocket

We need $7,500 to bring this dream to fruition. Here are some of the things we need to pay for.

Visuals Creation

  • Cameras
  • Lenses
  • Lighting
  • Crew
  • Art Dept. (Wardrobe, props, etc.)
  • Editing & Grading

Tour

  • Airline tickets
  • Artist's visas (these are SUPER expensive...)
  • Accommodation
  • Projector Hire

So Why Should You Be Interested In All Of This?

We want to put this show together for YOU to be a part of something transcendent and beautiful. We want to invite you to be a part of the journey.

If that isn’t enough, we have some pretty cool rewards too.

We want to give you things like:

  • Limited edition album downloads of our upcoming full-length
  • Cool OSP t-shirts and graphic prints
  • Free access to OSP shows for a whole year
  • Beautiful OSP designed alarm and ringtones for your phone
  • We’ll even play a show in Antartica
  • You could even get the chance to feature on one of our songs or collaborate with us to create an original OSP track!
Please see the sidebar for a full list of rewards.

What Will Your Contribution Do?

You will be helping this magnificent show reach it’s full potential. We already know we can do this (come catch us live sometime and you’ll see what we mean) but we’ve reached the pinnacle of what we can achieve without some help. If you’ve ever wanted to experience a truly overwhelming and spectacular live show, now is your chance to make it a reality.


I’m Broke And Can’t Afford To Donate!

Don’t worry, you can still totally help out! You can:

  • Share the campaign on social media
  • Harass your rich (obviously non-artist) friends
  • Call your mom and tell her to get involved

Risks & Challenges

We could fail. Being a band is tough. There are thousands of bands forming and breaking up each day, succumbing to the harsh realities of the music industry. To succeed not only do you have to be exceptionally good but you have to hustle hard. You also need a little bit of support from your fans. We think we’re pretty alright and we know we can hustle, we just need your support to take it to the next level.


Who Are We?

"Their ingenuity is amidst the greats and they constantly keep the tempo saturated and the inhalation smitten with emotion."

- The Fuss


Jeremy de Tolly

Jeremy is a trained vocalist and guitarist with years of experience on the road with South African alternative rock band The Dirty Skirts. He is also an experienced composer and writes music for advertising, games, dance and theatre. He has released a solo album of ambient piano pieces, ‘Piano Noctures One’

Tom Glendinning

Tom is one of three Ableton Certified Trainers in South Africa and is an expert with Ableton Live music production software as well as having an extensive knowledge of synthesis and music production. His musical career began as a drummer for numerous bands encompassing styles as varied as Jazz and Psychedelic Rock and he has a deep understanding of rhythm and groove. He is also an obsessive technophile and can spend hours tinkering with old analog synths or writing lines of code building tools to use for both sound and visual creation.


Visual Collaborators


Musical Collaborators

  • Keenan Ahrends
  • Gene Kierman
  • Greg Abrahams
  • Sdumo Viwe
  • Obie Mavuso
  • Clem Carr
  • Thuso Sebape

Please support us on Indiegogo and help make the Hypergiant Audio / Visual Tour a reality!

Lots of love and thanks,
Jeremy and Tom

story:
SIMON BENEGAS NORTH AMERICAN TOUR

[EN]Hello there! I'm Simon Benegas, a Singer-Songwriter from Buenos Aires, Argentina. Thank you so much for taking the time to check out this Campaign. Ever since I started writing songs I've been dreaming about sharing them with North America and now the time has come to make it happen!

The main focus of my music is to have a positive impact on the listener, I want you to come down to a show and go home renewed, inspired and uplifted. That's it! That's all I want and all I strive for! And it is made possible with the help of an awesome group of friends that I'm lucky to call my band. I AM ready and extremely exited to bring my music to the US and Canada this Fall!

If you want to get involved check out the perks we offer for each contribution, the band and I will be so amazingly grateful! It's never easy in the beginning and specially when your aspirations are this big! But that has never stopped us and hopefully you can fuel our drive and help us on this one! If you don't have money and still want to contribute in some other way, you can help us a lot by sharing this campaign with your friends and getting the word out! We will really appreciate it!

[SP]Hola a todos! Soy Simon Benegas, cantautor de Buenos Aires, Argentina. Muchas gracias por tomarse el tiempo de entrar en esta Campaña. Desde que empecé a hacer música que sueño con compartirla con Norteamérica y llegó el momento de hacerlo!

El principal foco de mi música es tener un impacto positivo en el oyente. Como he dicho en otras ocasiones, quiero vengas a un concierto y te vuelvas a tu casa renovado, inspirado y en paz. Eso es lo único que quiero, la verdad, y lo que trato de lograr con la ayuda de un gran grupo de amigos a los que tengo la suerte de llamar mi banda. Estoy listo y muy entusiasmado de traer mi música a EEUU y Canadá!

Para involucrarse en el proyecto pueden explorar los "perks" a la derecha de la pantalla, cada uno tiene un precio diferente por el que pueden llevarse CDs firmados, remeras de la gira, canciones inéditas, y hasta shows privados para los que estén con Muuchas ganas! Hasta la mas minima ayuda nos aumenta la "visibilidad" de la campaña y nos da mas chances de cumplir el objetivo, otra forma de ayudar es invitando a amigos a ver la campaña y compartirla en las redes sociales. Por toda su ayuda les estaremos tremendamente agradecidos! Nunca es fácil al principio y menos con objetivos tan grandes, pero eso nunca nos frenó, y con su ayuda podremos lograr esto y mucho mas! Gracias!

THE TOUR

We'll be starting off the tour in New Hope (PA) then heading to Philadelphia, New York City, New Hampshire, Montreal (CA), Ottawa (CA), Toronto (CA) and Chicago! With a total of 15 shows, and plenty more of acoustic sessions planned along the way on the beautiful Cities and landscapes that this wonderful Continent has to offer!

We're going to record and document most of the tour and make some cool videos such as this one:

 
 

WHAT WE NEED

We need an RV (MotorHome) to live in and hit the road with! We obviously can't afford a fancy new RV so we're planning on getting a used "vintage" one that looks cool and runs good enough to get us moving! That, and gas, is what most of the money will be used for. It's going to be an adventure, no doubt, but we're ready for it!

We also need to make sure we let everybody know we're coming, and that also takes some money to do (PR & all that good stuff), but first things first, let's get that RV!

THANK YOU!

Once again, if you like the project we got going and want to be a part of it, check out how you can contribute and get some cool perks on the right side of the screen. Also, if you don't want to invest money into this, but still want to help out, you can do that by sharing this page, It will mean a lot to me and the rest of the band!

Cheers!

We also need to make sure we let everybody know we're coming, and that also takes some money to do (PR & all that good stuff), but first things first, let's get that RV!
THANK YOU!
Once again, if you like the project we got going and want to be a part of it, check out how you can contribute and get some cool perks on the right side of the screen. Also, if you don't want to invest money into this, but still want to help out, you can do that by sharing this page, It will mean a lot to me and the rest of the band!
Cheers!

story:
Seventeen

Hi guys, my name is Steven "MadeSacred" Williams. I am from Pittsburgh PA and a musician to the core!! I have been rapping for about 20 years and love it. It's who I am.

This campaign is to raise the money needed to mix, master, and promote my album "Seventeen" which is already fully recorded and ready for it's May 17th release.

I have put my heart and soul into this album. And I would like to invite you to help me get it to the rest of the world!! You are the push I need!!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to have this record fully mixed and mastered. We also need to promote this album through social media outlets and blogs (which can cost a pretty penny). We are also booking a tour for the USA all summer. A portion of the funds will go towards the tour.

Every single penny will be very well appreciated and very well used to push this record.

In return for your help, we are going to give you guys copies of this album, T shirts, back stage laminates, and more!! :D

We believe in this album and the affects it can have on people's lives. This is more than music, this is life. We want the world to know of the love God has for them!! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you simply just don't have it to give, please tell your friends and family about MadeSacred!! Also, you can Like me on Facebook!! :)
