story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT

Blake's Songs are a conduit to a space beyond words and music – the inner landscape of our own soul...



The Angel is the sequel to my first album, “William Blake's Songs of Innocence and of Experience” (2011), which was made thanks to all of you who supported my Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign back then. You deserve much of the credit for the overwhelming response from listeners and reviewers, and the invitations to perform live, which took us to many parts of Europe, China, Turkey and the USA. I literally could not have got there without your generous support. And it's high time we got together to make another one, because I believe that Blake's Songs are a conduit to a space beyond words and music – keys to the inner landscape of our own soul. So we need your help once again to reach even more people with an excellent-quality album, recorded in Italy and mastered in London!

What's new

In this new collection we have been inspired by William Blake's visionary songs such as The Dream, The Angel (title track) and the ballad of Lyca (The Little Girl Lost), who falls asleep while lost in the forest, but wakes up in Heaven. The musical styles and arrangements are fresh and varied thanks to the involvement of my talented sons Leo and Maxim, and an intimate circle of musician friends. Our first album was recorded in a bit of a rush (you can sometimes hear it!) so we want to do things properly this time; 15 days to record and mix in Italy at ELFO RECORDING STUDIO and 1 day mastering the album at the historic ABBEY ROAD STUDIOS in London – where you could come along and join us on the day!

The insights are conveyed, as true wisdom always is, not from a height, but from the heart

It has taken my own experience of life to apreciate the timeless truths and emotional inteligence infused in Blake's Songs. The insights are conveyed, as true wisdom always is, not from a height, but from the heart. Every single song has its own colour, tone, rhythm and theme. They tell us of real human dramas from the point of view of the protagonists, that are still being played out by today, be they a chimney sweeper, a little black boy, soldier or youthful harlot. It was in in the early 80s that I started discovering tunes for them on a guitar and that's when they began to reveal their meaning. Just as Shakespere's plays were written to be physically performed, I am convinced William Blake's Songs were designed be sung or at least read out loud to be fully savoured. 


Who is involved

Music, Voice, Guitar Victor Vertunni,Voice, Harmonies Deborah Eckman, Acoustic, Classical, Electric Guitar, Leo Vertunni Bass guitar, Double Bass, Maxim Vertunni Cajon, Drums, Percussion Amedeo Luviè, Cello Emma Turley, 

Sound Engineer Alberto Calegari, Design Massimo Luvie', Cover artwork Maxim Vertunni

Why support us

William BLAKE WAS CROWDFUNDED! His hand-made books were made possible by a loyal group of subscribers, giving him enough money in advance to enable him to buy the copper plates and paper and survive during the painstaking work of illuminated book making. Similarly, making an album takes focused attention to do well. The production process will absorb us for a month and there are considerable costs involved. Put simply, we will only be able only make it with your support.You will receive your rewards BEFORE ANYONE ELSE*

What we need and what you get

       Your contribution will make it possible for us:

  • To record, mix and master in a state-of-the-art professional studios (ELFO RECORDING STUDIO, Italy and ABBEY ROAD, London), capturing  and rendering our performances in  ideal creative and technical conditions. 
  • To involve and reward additional musicians who commit their time and talent to the cause (travel and living expenses and fees)
  • To commission and reward the artist and designer for the CD cover artwork and packaging design. 
  • To finance the industrial replication of the first batch of 1000 CDs in an Eco-frindly digipack with full colour booklet.
  • To offer an original high quality finished album to commercial physical and digital distribution label/channels.
  • To invest in an online marketing campaign

    You will receive (BEFORE ANYONE ELSE*):
  • The finished album as a high quality download ((choose between MP3, FLAC, ALAC, AAC or Ogg Vorbis) a physical CD, plus extras such as a T-shirt and extra tracks. There are exciting special rewards, such as having a concert in your own home or all to yourself on Skype, or, spending the day with us at Elfo Studio or in the historic ABBEY ROAD studio in London where bands like the Beatles and Radiohead have been.
  • The satisfaction of contributing to an artistic project that will be able to be heard and touch the soul of people around the world

    * IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT: The album is not being released or on sale until we have posted each and all our INDIEGOGO supporters their fabulous rewards - that's a promise!

    The impact

  • There are some artists that must be heard as well as seen and read and William Blake is one of them. 
  • Your support will help realise a vision that will give the world at large words, music and images that will move the hearts and minds of many for years to come. 
  • Allow us to present the finished high-quality CD for consideration to leading labels who specialise in indie singer-sogwriter distribution 

  • Here's what the music press said about the previous album:

    “The CD of Blake songs...were beautifully played and sung.” Philip Pulman, Author & President of the Blake Society

    “a small masterpiece of musical invention...truly inspired...one of the most interesting records I've heard so far this year.” Massimo Marchini., Rockerilla (Jan 01, 2012)

    “Subtle and refined...the poet William Blake apparently used to sing his verses in public. Victor tries to recreate that magic and succeeds” - Andrea Trevaini, Buscadero (Nov 01, 2012) 

    “Victor’s voice soars high and penetrates the heart ” - Eleonora Bagarotti, JAM (Jan 02, 2012) 

    “Vertunni comes across as an old musical soul; not so much plucking items from the past and giving them new voice, but speaking and singing from some deep ancestral or universal memory that has never required remaking....William Blake's Songs Of Innocence And Of Experience, is an often seamless marriage between Blake's fluid poetry and Vertunni's arrangements. " 
    Wildy Haskell, Wildy's World Blog Review (2012)

Why can't I just wait till it's on iTunes?

Fair question. We are not asking you to pre-purchase an artefact but to actively participate in its making- become a patron of the arts!

Budget Breakdown

  • Recording, mixing and mastering                     5,000  Euro
  • CD Replication and packaging                           1,500  Euro
  • Performing artist fees and Travel                     2,500  Euro
  • Artwork and Design                                                 500  Euro
  • Perk fulfillment                                                         500  Euro
  • Total                                                                       10,000  Euro



Risks & Challenges

If we do not reach the target of our campaign, it will be a lot harder, but we will still go ahead with the recording and delivery of all perks that have been signed up and paid for by our wonderful supporters. Although highly improbable, there could be a delay in the schedule due to unforeseen circumstances. But you will be kept regularly informed on progress at each step of the production:

Schedule (End of May to end of June) :

  1.  Rehearsals; design of artwork and CD booklet content and T-Shirts. sourcing CD and T-shirt manufacturer
  2. Record at Elfo Studio (10 days in May-June 2016)
  3.  Finalise CD Packaging, T-shirts and poster design
  4. Mixing the tracks at Elfo Studio (5 days in June 2016)
  5. Mastering at Abbey Road Mastering Studio in London (1 day in June 2016)
  6. Step 6. CD Replication and printing of T-Shirts
  7. Step 7. CDs and T-Shirts arrive in Piacenza
  8. Phase 8. Post CDs and rewards to our Kickstarter supporters
  9. Hear a sample of our previous album



Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you just can't contribute,  that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

Google presents Inside Abbey Road
story_txt:
ABOUT THE PROJECT

Blake's Songs are a conduit to a space beyond words and music – the inner landscape of our own soul...



The Angel is the sequel to my first album, “William Blake's Songs of Innocence and of Experience” (2011), which was made thanks to all of you who supported my Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign back then. You deserve much of the credit for the overwhelming response from listeners and reviewers, and the invitations to perform live, which took us to many parts of Europe, China, Turkey and the USA. I literally could not have got there without your generous support. And it's high time we got together to make another one, because I believe that Blake's Songs are a conduit to a space beyond words and music – keys to the inner landscape of our own soul. So we need your help once again to reach even more people with an excellent-quality album, recorded in Italy and mastered in London!
What's new

In this new collection we have been inspired by William Blake's visionary songs such as The Dream, The Angel (title track) and the ballad of Lyca (The Little Girl Lost), who falls asleep while lost in the forest, but wakes up in Heaven. The musical styles and arrangements are fresh and varied thanks to the involvement of my talented sons Leo and Maxim, and an intimate circle of musician friends. Our first album was recorded in a bit of a rush (you can sometimes hear it!) so we want to do things properly this time; 15 days to record and mix in Italy at ELFO RECORDING STUDIO and 1 day mastering the album at the historic ABBEY ROAD STUDIOS in London – where you could come along and join us on the day!
The insights are conveyed, as true wisdom always is, not from a height, but from the heart

It has taken my own experience of life to apreciate the timeless truths and emotional inteligence infused in Blake's Songs. The insights are conveyed, as true wisdom always is, not from a height, but from the heart. Every single song has its own colour, tone, rhythm and theme. They tell us of real human dramas from the point of view of the protagonists, that are still being played out by today, be they a chimney sweeper, a little black boy, soldier or youthful harlot. It was in in the early 80s that I started discovering tunes for them on a guitar and that's when they began to reveal their meaning. Just as Shakespere's plays were written to be physically performed, I am convinced William Blake's Songs were designed be sung or at least read out loud to be fully savoured. 

Who is involved
Music, Voice, Guitar Victor Vertunni,Voice, Harmonies Deborah Eckman, Acoustic, Classical, Electric Guitar, Leo Vertunni Bass guitar, Double Bass, Maxim Vertunni Cajon, Drums, Percussion Amedeo Luviè, Cello Emma Turley, 
Sound Engineer Alberto Calegari, Design Massimo Luvie', Cover artwork Maxim Vertunni
Why support us

William BLAKE WAS CROWDFUNDED! His hand-made books were made possible by a loyal group of subscribers, giving him enough money in advance to enable him to buy the copper plates and paper and survive during the painstaking work of illuminated book making. Similarly, making an album takes focused attention to do well. The production process will absorb us for a month and there are considerable costs involved. Put simply, we will only be able only make it with your support.You will receive your rewards BEFORE ANYONE ELSE*

What we need and what you get
       Your contribution will make it possible for us:



To record, mix and master in a state-of-the-art professional studios (ELFO RECORDING STUDIO, Italy and ABBEY ROAD, London), capturing  and rendering our performances in  ideal creative and technical conditions. 


To involve and reward additional musicians who commit their time and talent to the cause (travel and living expenses and fees)


To commission and reward the artist and designer for the CD cover artwork and packaging design. 


To finance the industrial replication of the first batch of 1000 CDs in an Eco-frindly digipack with full colour booklet.


To offer an original high quality finished album to commercial physical and digital distribution label/channels.


To invest in an online marketing campaignYou will receive (BEFORE ANYONE ELSE*):



The finished album as a high quality download ((choose between MP3, FLAC, ALAC, AAC or Ogg Vorbis) a physical CD, plus extras such as a T-shirt and extra tracks. There are exciting special rewards, such as having a concert in your own home or all to yourself on Skype, or, spending the day with us at Elfo Studio or in the historic ABBEY ROAD studio in London where bands like the Beatles and Radiohead have been.

The satisfaction of contributing to an artistic project that will be able to be heard and touch the soul of people around the world* IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT: The album is not being released or on sale until we have posted each and all our INDIEGOGO supporters their fabulous rewards - that's a promise! 


    The impact





There are some artists that must be heard as well as seen and read and William Blake is one of them. 

Your support will help realise a vision that will give the world at large words, music and images that will move the hearts and minds of many for years to come. 

Allow us to present the finished high-quality CD for consideration to leading labels who specialise in indie singer-sogwriter distribution 
Here's what the music press said about the previous album:
“The CD of Blake songs...were beautifully played and sung.” Philip Pulman, Author & President of the Blake Society
“a small masterpiece of musical invention...truly inspired...one of the most interesting records I've heard so far this year.” Massimo Marchini., Rockerilla (Jan 01, 2012)
“Subtle and refined...the poet William Blake apparently used to sing his verses in public. Victor tries to recreate that magic and succeeds” - Andrea Trevaini, Buscadero (Nov 01, 2012) 
“Victor’s voice soars high and penetrates the heart ” - Eleonora Bagarotti, JAM (Jan 02, 2012) “Vertunni comes across as an old musical soul; not so much plucking items from the past and giving them new voice, but speaking and singing from some deep ancestral or universal memory that has never required remaking....William Blake's Songs Of Innocence And Of Experience, is an often seamless marriage between Blake's fluid poetry and Vertunni's arrangements. " Wildy Haskell, Wildy's World Blog Review (2012)


Why can't I just wait till it's on iTunes?
Fair question. We are not asking you to pre-purchase an artefact but to actively participate in its making- become a patron of the arts!

Recording, mixing and mastering                     5,000  Euro
CD Replication and packaging                           1,500  Euro
Performing artist fees and Travel                     2,500  Euro
Artwork and Design                                                 500  Euro
Perk fulfillment                                                         500  Euro

Although highly improbable, there could be a delay in the schedule due to unforeseen circumstances. But you will be kept regularly informed on progress at each step of the production:

story:
My Story

I have been a singer since birth and have played piano from the young age of six. While both of these things gave me the knowledge and passion I needed, I didn't consider myself a musician until I picked up the guitar in November of 2013. After an inspiring acoustic show by Chris Cornell, I knew that I needed to be doing exactly what he was: pouring out my heart and soul through music. I started rather quickly, covering songs for my friends on Facebook daily and as my chops increased, I started writing original tunes. My influences range from Prince, Bruno Mars and Justin Timberlake to Sixx: A.M., Queensryche, Papa Roach, Godsmack, Soundgarden, Alice in Chains and Stone Temple Pilots.

This is where you all come in. All My Mistakes is set to be my debut album, collecting songs I have written over the past two and a half years. Each song in its own right represents a point in my life and I cannot wait to share with you all what we have done with them in the studio.

The Funding

Let's get to the nitty gritty right away: what are you paying for? Let me break it down. Unlike most projects, the album has already been recorded and is nearing completion, now all you have to do is show your support to get it in your hands!

  • Recording $1200 - This amount goes towards the recording of the album and the use of the space it was created in. This is the most important bill to pay.
  • Mastering $600-$900 - While this amount isn't set in stone, this is the cost to get each track sounding like what you hear everyday on the radio or a CD. This is a very specific profession and we are narrowing our search.
  • Pressing $400-$600 - This price is dependent on demand for the album through this fundraiser. The more albums you want, the more I need to pay for!
In the event that we don't reach our goal, all the money we raise pays for the recording first, and the remainder goes towards mastering and pressing.
In the opposite event, if we exceed our goal, the extra money will allow me to get more copies of the album pressed for the future and beyond!

The Team

Let me introduce you to the wonderful group of people supporting me in this endeavor. Each has played a key role in the recording of this album.

Dave Andersen

  • The key motivator of this project, Dave encouraged me early on to get this album recorded and out for you all to hear. His roles have been unending for this album as he has played bass on all the tracks, engineered the recording of the entire album and has served as producer. The use of his beautiful family space (colloquially termed "The Cabin") was a godsend and served as the environment where it all came together.
Ian Flanigan

  • Words cannot describe the adoration I have for Ian. A local musician with ridiculous talent and a huge heart. Ian has played lead guitar on the album, but you should do yourself a favor and check out his own album, Lead Feather (also produced by Dave Andersen) at https://ianflanigan.bandcamp.com.
Brady Totten

  • As the drummer for the powerful Saugerties rock trio, The Beautiful Bastards, it only took one gig to convince me that I needed Brady. His percussive flare has added an unthinkable amount of depth to the entire album. His talent and power shines through particularly on the tracks Rebirth and Rearrange.

story:
New Single

Ignite The Fire is going into the studio this May to record a new single with Jeremy Dove (Defending Cain) out of Darkesville Studios and we want to get you involved!
Your contribution not only goes towards the recording of the new single but towards a lyric video, music video and other promotional materials to help push the new song into several markets across the U.S. and even the rest of the world. 

What We're Asking & What You Get

The goal is to raise $1,000 to cover many of the expenses listed above. 

What you get by contributing is your choice of many great new merch items. These items include: Paracord Guitar Pick Wristbands, Necklaces, Earings, Guitar String Bracelets, Shirts, Hoodies and other great items!

To contribute, simply choose a perk on the right of the screen and select it! Each package includes a digital download of our new single when it releases early this summer.                         

                            

The Impact

Your contribution will provide us the resources we need to release and push this song. The new single will not only be a means to further the progression of Ignite The Fire but serve as a thank you to all of our fans who have helped us along the way. This new song is for you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Next to making a monetary contribution, we're going to need all the help we can get to spread the word and let others know about Ignite The Fire and the new song.

Tell everyone, and we mean EVERYONE, about Ignite The Fire. Share us on facebook, Retweet us on Twitter, Follow us on Instagram, text a friend, call someone, or tell someone in person! Spread the word and be a part of our Ignite The Fire family.

Thank You!

This single is our way of saying thank you to all of our fans for your unrelenting and continued support. Our goal as a band is to make music that not only we like, but that others like and can relate to. You are truly the reason we do what we do. Thank you.

story:
Hello Brothers and Sisters!

Thank you for stopping by and having a look at the very 1st official Vision of God Records Fundraiser!

Please have a look at our videos for the full Vision of everything in this ministry.

We are a non profit Christian Metal Ministry. We know as believers that word of God proceeds itself. And as we are to make a joyful noise unto our God. :)

We know that in mainstream metal music the themes and lyrical structures are of evil or pagan in nature. 

Many of these metal heads will never step into a church or hear the word of God. Hearing the word of GOD thru extreme metal music may be the only way they may ever be touched by our father. As well as to be the food for those who are saved and desire to listen to metal!

We love God and we love metal! We have been given the Vision to do this ministry. We have done this ministry up to 16 releases at this point. 

To this point the ministry had been entirely solely funded by 1 individual  (just a everyday man, with a unknown illness and 5 children). Asking for pre orders to help round up the finances for releases. 

Now faced with a entirely different situation. Some great some not so great. We need to come to our Brothers and Sisters to ask for financial funding on a large scale for the 1st time. 

We are not asking for handouts, although donations to our paypal are accepted as well

At Info@visionofGodrecords.com

Prayers requests can also be sent to this same email.

We ask that you consider a support purchase or a pre order item for you or the metal head in your life.

Many great perks available

 Please help us continue to plant Gods seed throughout the world.

story:
Dear Friends,

Thank you for taking the time to read this! Over the past year, I have worked tirelessly to assemble a collection of new material and bring my old band, the new underground, back into the recording studio. the new underground was originally formed in 2003 as part of my senior recital project as a music major at the University of New Hampshire. We played a number of shows around the Seacoast area for about five years, and in that time we recorded our first original jazz album, "Urban Suite" as a five-piece band with Sean Berry (tenor sax), Ryan Parker (piano), Ben Zecker (Hammond B3 organ) and Bridget Kearney (upright bass).

Since then, Sean moved to New York to pursue jazz performance, Ben went on to LA to become a music producer, and Bridget went on to tour with her band, Lake Street Dive. In the interim, I wrote a number of new pieces and with the encouragement of producer Ryan Parker, I decided to call Sean in Brooklyn and invite some new friends including Chris Klaxton on trumpet, Mike Effenberger on Hammond B3 organ, Jim Dozet on electric guitars, and Nate Therrien on upright bass (actually, a founding member of the band) to include their talent on the session.

I also enlisted the expertise of Ryan - who not only plays piano on the album, but who also engineered the recording session and produced the initial mixes and Chris Magruder at Thundering Sky who mixed and mastered the final project. Dan Blakeslee contributed not only all of the artwork for the album, but also the inspiration for the title track "The Instrumentalist" from his artwork for the famed Vermont brewery The Alchemist. A big thank you goes to Ed Gleason at Max Out Studios for allowing us to record once again in his beautiful studio in Durham, NH.

As you can imagine, the process of booking a recording session and producing an album takes a tremendous amount of time, effort, and yes, funding! It was a priority of mine to make sure that my professional musician friends who dedicated three days of their time to the recording session, and the recording engineers and artists were compensated for their work on the project. Not to go unmentioned is the cost of printing and duplicating the actual artwork and the CDs themselves! While the project was put on hold for a brief time, we are now all set to send the final masters and artwork out for duplication and we hope you can help support the project by pre-ordering a CD, or a digital download of the new album (and, if you like it, maybe the first album as well!)

As a token of our appreciation for pre-ordering the new album, we are also offering you a free instant digital download of the first cut on the album, "On Pepper Hill" (once I figure out how to get this to you). Please feel free to share the music and the campaign with your family and friends and link to this page on social media. We thank you very much! With much appreciation, yours truly,

Eric

"The Instrumentalist" track listing (all songs written by Eric Donnelly unless otherwise noted):

01: On Pepper Hill 02: All My Friends Have Been To New Orleans 03: The Instrumentalist (Donnelly, Therrien, Dozet) 04: Signed, Sealed, Delivered (I'm Yours) (Stevie Wonder) 05: On Common Ground 06: Illucination 07: Wild Honey (Dr. John) 08: Confidential Informant (Donnelly, Dozet) 09: Spiritual No. 1

While the project was put on hold for a brief time, we are now all set to send the final masters and artwork out for duplication and we hope you can help support the project by pre-ordering a CD, or a digital download of the new album (and, if you like it, maybe the first album as well!)As a token of our appreciation for pre-ordering the new album, we are also offering you a free instant digital download of the first cut on the album, "On Pepper Hill" (once I figure out how to get this to you). Please feel free to share the music and the campaign with your family and friends and link to this page on social media. We thank you very much! With much appreciation, yours truly,Eric"The Instrumentalist" track listing (all songs written by Eric Donnelly unless otherwise noted):01: On Pepper Hill 02: All My Friends Have Been To New Orleans 03: The Instrumentalist (Donnelly, Therrien, Dozet) 04: Signed, Sealed, Delivered (I'm Yours) (Stevie Wonder) 05: On Common Ground 06: Illucination 07: Wild Honey (Dr. John) 08: Confidential Informant (Donnelly, Dozet) 09: Spiritual No. 1

story:
Under Ground LA (TBP The Dream)

So who are you-

Juny D is an MC, A father, a creative, Raw Genius & a Teambackpack top 64 Underground LA contest!

 

So What is Team Back Pack?

TeamBackpack is a hip-hop music platform, movement and media/live event production company that is changing the way hip-hop music and culture is consumed today. Why is this important? TBP the movement has inspired & givin hope for Artist across the world For over 7 years! They've put together hundreds of “content parties” in which the best hip-hop artists from all over the world congregate and celebrate the art of music. Each event is filmed and audio is recorded to provide bite-size content to distribute via Internet, television, and radio, in an effort to expose new talent to new audiences. TBP artists and content now reach 10’s of millions of people weekly and is some of the most viewed hip-hop content on the internet. This June 2nd & 3rd in LA i will compete in a single elimination TOP 64 tournament LIVE in front of a panel of select industry A&Rs, label executives, TBP producers, a crowd of 1000+ attendees this summer. So why is this important, this is a opportunity any artist without a following dreams of to make the next step a step worth taking. . and I'm asking you to join this journey with me!!!

 

Why indigogo campaign?

 Indiegogo is an international crowdfunding website founded in 2008. The site is one of the first sites to offer crowd funding. Indiegogo allows people to solicit funds for an idea, charity, or start-up business.

 

Why you should fund this campaign?

Well I'll keep this short and simple. I can't afford it alone! I'm a server making 4.80 hr with a fluctuating tip average. Its like this, I'll be in LA may 31 leaving the 4th of June. Soooo basicly . $650 is hotel cost and that's the cheapest I could find . $250 Bus ticket . $150 for food . $200 to make this the best documented experience ever! So my goal is 1200 I'll be in LA for 4 days . I really plan on making this experience one that we all can dive into & grow with together .picture

 

What do you have to gain from this experience?

 There is a rewards system set in place for those who decides donate.

$1 or more gets a special acknowledgment

$5 or more pen with acknowledgments &

$10 dollars or more gets all the above plus digital exclusive download to my new project & 10% off the Ohio Dayton mall location GC. .

 

 And everybody who donates gets a chance to be on my next upcoming project!

The Impact

  • This WIll Allow me To start my career a gain a following of 100,000 OR MORE, in just two days!
  • This platform has started careers, I plan on making this a successful experience!

Risks & Challenges

Well The Risk If I don't come up with enough money for the trip is I would possibly stay in an homeless shelter until I leave and use my cell phone for navigation to get around lol!!!!

  • What Qualifies me to overcome these hurdles, my ambition, my family, my passion for who I am as an Artist wont allow me to stop. So I created this Campaign as a way of mendful outreach to obtain a dreamers Goal!
  • I plan on working two jobs to pay bills and raise money for my trip as well as my campaign to make this theh best Documented Experience Ever!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean You can't help:

  • Folks, get the word out and make some noise about This campaign. you can share, share, share, share! & if you cant donate today, please try another time Before the campaign times out!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hello fellow brethren of the human experience!

Thanks for taking a look! My name is Sarah Schrift. I’m a New Yorker that hails from the environs of Detroit, MI. I’m a cross-genre singer/songwriter and visual artist. I’m working towards putting out my first solo album and I need your help!

The nitty gritty:

I am 90% done with recording an album (with my own $$ so far) that I am really proud of, bursting at the seams about, and I’m sure it’s going to knock your socks off. What I need now is to get this little baby mixed, mastered, printed, and put out there into the big world. That’s where you come in and I want to make sure that you get something good in return for your generosity. I was a bit worried about what I could offer but then I took a look around me and was like, oh yeah….the thing I went to school for…visual art. I have an enormous amount of artwork because I am constantly compelled to make it and then I carry it with me because I am a hoarder of it along with stacks of song lyrics and other fancy things. So I have the physical artwork from the album to offer to you. I have sketches that were originally intended for liner imagery. I have lovely ink paintings on handkerchiefs, an oil painting of Leonard Cohen, and two oil paintings that are the imagery for the front and back covers of this album. I can also play music for you and I can write music for you. My studio is essentially open to you at less than wholesale prices and I want you to walk away with something that you love. By making a contribution you’ll receive quality art and music AND be helping me put out one of the most important and personal pieces of art that I have ever dared to make to this date.

Get it:

$15 Digital Download: You will receive a digital copy of the album. (When it's done, y'all...but before everyone else!)

$25 Digital Download, Signed CD and Love: A Digital Download and a copy of the CD. I’ll sign it and send my love out to you on social media.

$50 Name Game: All of the above and your name on the inside of the CD jacket.

$100 Original Drawing or Painting on Handkerchief: (You must specify and this is while supplies last. First come first serve. You can see them via the link.) All of the above and an original drawing or painting on handkerchief. http://www.sarahschrift.com/#/ice-cream-for-astronauts-album-fundraiser/

$200 Rough Love (Caveat: I will maintain the copyright): The digital download, the signed CD, love on social media, your name on the inside of the CD jacket and I’ll write a love song for you or someone that you love (I may need details). I’ll compose it and send a rough copy over to you to have forever and ever. This is a big deal because I never write love songs.

$300 Perfect Love and Perfect Trust: All of the above and I’ll record your song in the studio.

$400 Leonard Cohen: An original oil painting of Leonard Cohen…..because it’s Leonard Cohen. (There is only one and this is while supplies last. Details via the link.) http://www.sarahschrift.com/#/ice-cream-for-astronauts-album-fundraiser/ Plus you’ll get a digital download, the signed CD, love on social media, and your name on the inside of the CD jacket.

$500 Album Art: Cover art oil painting originals (You must specify and this is while supplies last. First come first serve. Details via the link.) http://www.sarahschrift.com/#/ice-cream-for-astronauts-album-fundraiser/ Plus you’ll get a digital download, the signed CD, love on social media, and your name on the inside of the CD jacket.

$1000 Wild Card: I’ll perform the album for you in person. It has to be in the 5 boroughs of NYC or in NJ or I can paint anything you want on a 15” x 15” surface in oil and send it off to you once it is dry. Plus you’ll get a digital download, the signed CD, love on social media, and your name on the inside of the CD jacket.

Your generosity will help cover:

One last recording session, mixing, mastering, marketing, graphic design, distribution, CD making, postage for artwork and CDs, and Indiegogo and PayPal fees. =$5500

What about the album:

This album is one of the most deliberate things I’ve ever done. I’ve made strides vocally when it comes to expression: I let my accent come out, I let my voice crack, and I let the genre be what it needs to be. The flavor of the music is fluid. It’s not totally indie or country or spiritual or folk or rock or progressive. What I want to say is it’s untethered, it’s free. There is a sort of nakedness that comes through via the writing and vocal expression that are at times comforting and at times unnerving. It has playful and fun moments but it also hits on some very serious things and here they are in no particular order: judgement, religion, sobriety, sex, debauchery, possessive coupling, breaking up, and giving up. The album offers up a tumultuous saga but in the end the heroine metaphorically escapes the bad guys and rides off into a blazing sunset at a break neck speed towards a sexy secret rendezvous. My kind of gal.

Production:

Ok. I am totally going to brag here. The album is being produced by Gary Atturio from Studio G in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. (Google Studio G, Google Gary….I know! Fancy schmancy, right?) The place is magical and so is Gary. Gary really has a virtuoso ear. His knowledge about orchestration, composition, musical instruments and production through the lens of history is unparalleled. He can sing and play the heck out of so many different instruments too! Every time I’d go into the studio I’d come out with a song that I loved. I carved a sculpture of sorts and Gary made it walk.

The album is being co-produced by my friend Clay Russell. Clay is a musician as well as an actor/comedian. (Google him but maybe don’t do it at work. There is another Clay Russell out there in the porn industry. Go ahead and enjoy both Clays in the privacy of your own home.) Gary has produced many of Clay’s albums and having Clay in the studio made the album more adventurous and lent another informed ear. Clay helped direct the album by giving me instruction and moral support throughout the process. He also played the heck out of many instruments and sang some backing vocals as well.

The album has a few special guests with stellar resumes and I’m not gonna spill the beans about that just yet. Just know that I have been BLESSED.

It's about time:

Honestly, I know! My last album with The Sours came out in 2013. We got great reviews: http://www.thesoursmusic.com/praise/

I'm really excited because I feel that Ice Cream For Astronauts is like a different element altogether. If the last album was water then this one is fire. You're going to see how much I've grown and how brave I've become.

Timing:

All of the artwork that is sold will be sent to their new homes as soon as the campaign is over. The digital downloads and CDs will go out as soon as they are available to me. I'm hoping for the end of August 2017.

Risk:

Nope. There really isn't one for you. You're going to get a tangible thing for your money. All my years of elbow grease, talent, love, and a twist of heartache went into it.

Other ways you can help:

I totally get it. You're broke but you want to throw me a solid. Cool! Just share my campaign! I can dig it, you can did it, we can dig it.

You can also like my page on Facebook and follow my DAILY Facebook Live chats. There will be at least one for every single day of this 30 day campaign! (Technology is scary to me. What's also scary is that I consider Facebook Live to be technology....it's going to be interesting!!)

One last thing:

Thank you. I mean it. Lots of love! I hope your dreams come true too!

oxoxo-Sarah

story:
Artist's Summary

I have been writing songs for a lifetime.  At about 3 years old, I began to rock myself to sleep to original rhythms and melodies echoing in my mind.  Around the age of 13,  I got a guitar and my songwriting reached a new plateau. I started playing in bands at the age of 15, and since I could never master a top 40 tune I only performed my originals. By the time I was 25,  I believed I had written several hits. Unfortunately, I wasn't in a position to professionally record them and my 30 year old cassette demo tapes have faded away.  

I hit a major turning point when I turned 45 and decided I wanted a simpler life. I started to make digital recording of my performances and placed them on YouTube, CD Baby, iTunes, Spotify, and Facebook to name a few.

I thought everything was moving along pretty good until I was diagnosed with colon cancer on Feb 3, 2015.  After several treatments I realized that I better make the album I always dreamed of.  In celebration, I am calling my album Alive @ 55.

You support helps me distribute the album, get airplay, have a CD party, create some swag and a whole lot more.

 

What We Need & What You Get

As with any project we need to raise funds in order to produce the best possible product and derivatives.  No matter how much money is raised, I will be recording the album and producing CDs.  If you received a CD from me at any of the 2016 American Cancer Society's Relay For Life Events you know the value of my self produced CD product.   If we hit our goal of $10,000, I will take the project to the next level.  Anything contributed the project will go towards making the best product possible for the budget at hand, so every dollar counts and every dollar will be used for the project even if we only raise one dollar.

The Impact

I have been playing live for years and on occasion I have been asked if my music is available.  Unfortunately, I have never had the resources to make my original music available.  

Recently, we scheduled some studio time and planned on working with the raw material, burn CDs and generate CD covers using my home computer.  While this is an option, I want to be able to take this project to the next level and master music files and professionally produce the CDs.

Risks & Challenges

Everyone who participates will receive an Alive@55 CD and certain levels will receive the additional bonus CD.  The quality of the products depend greatly on the funds raised from the campaign.  With limited funds the CDs will be produced from a home computer.  Our goal is to hit a fund raising level that allows to produce a professional quality product. No matter how much or how little funding we will distribute of Alive@55 CD and out take CD.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not in position to help us raise funds your support is greatly appreciated.  Please join the Bradley Weinholtz Project on Facebook and subscribe to my YouTube channel.  Plus I always appreciate it when you come a gig.

story:
The Big Ask!

I know that it's not really the done thing to crowdfund in our little ol' d&b scene, but without it, this album won't happen.  I'm sure there will be some people that hate the idea, but I'm hoping enough of you like the idea that we can make it happen.

This may come as a suprise to you, but as a business, Spearhead Records is literally only me.  Back in 2005 when I started the label, for the first 18 months I didn't even own a computer, let alone have any idea what I was doing or what I'd started.  I was living in Ibiza and running things from internet cafe's and a USB stick. Here we are 11 years later and if you have ever ordered anything from the shop, it's been picked, packed and taken to the post office by me.  I do everything from a&r to the hoovering and everything in between.

While it may just be me who is employed, I've build some amazing relationships with artists, designers, engineers, promoters, event managers and loads of other people that have totally embraced things and created the wider disfunctional Spearhead family.  People who without their hard work and general amazingness Spearhead wouldn't have made it this far.

So why crowdfund for a new BCee album.  Well, to be honest with you, without your help, I can't afford to do it.

I want to make this one special, I want to be able to concentrate on songwriting, production and pouring my heart and soul into the music.  I have some great vocalists lineup up to write and record with and some other producers ready to collaberate, but regretably it all costs a lot more money than I have. 

Just to reassure any loyal fans, if I wanted to be the next Sigma or someone else that you can find on Radio 1, then I'd try and get backing from a major label.  But I don't.  I want to stick to my roots, keep things rolling and just do what I do best, make drum & bass full of depth and emotion that I hope people can continue to connect to.  There are no plans to change what I do, I just want to do it bigger and better than ever before.

Your funding will help me to bring you the biggest and best BCee album yet, and I want as many of you as possible to feel a part of making this one happen.  Even if you can't contribute, then just share it on facebook or twitter or whatever you people much younger than me use that's cool!

The funding will cover the vocalists, mastering, manufacture, session musicians, additional production and all of the costs to kick this project off.

I've tried to offer a load of perks that I think you will like or find useful and perhaps you just can't get me to do otherwise and I'm open to offers on anything else.  Essentially, just pre-ordering the album as a 'perk 'will really help.

Thanks in advance for your support.

Steve BCee
story_txt:
The Big Ask!
I know that it's not really the done thing to crowdfund in our little ol' d&b scene, but without it, this album won't happen.  I'm sure there will be some people that hate the idea, but I'm hoping enough of you like the idea that we can make it happen.
This may come as a suprise to you, but as a business, Spearhead Records is literally only me.  Back in 2005 when I started the label, for the first 18 months I didn't even own a computer, let alone have any idea what I was doing or what I'd started.  I was living in Ibiza and running things from internet cafe's and a USB stick. Here we are 11 years later and if you have ever ordered anything from the shop, it's been picked, packed and taken to the post office by me.  I do everything from a&r to the hoovering and everything in between.
While it may just be me who is employed, I've build some amazing relationships with artists, designers, engineers, promoters, event managers and loads of other people that have totally embraced things and created the wider disfunctional Spearhead family.  People who without their hard work and general amazingness Spearhead wouldn't have made it this far.
So why crowdfund for a new BCee album.  Well, to be honest with you, without your help, I can't afford to do it.
I want to make this one special, I want to be able to concentrate on songwriting, production and pouring my heart and soul into the music.  I have some great vocalists lineup up to write and record with and some other producers ready to collaberate, but regretably it all costs a lot more money than I have. 
Just to reassure any loyal fans, if I wanted to be the next Sigma or someone else that you can find on Radio 1, then I'd try and get backing from a major label.  But I don't.  I want to stick to my roots, keep things rolling and just do what I do best, make drum & bass full of depth and emotion that I hope people can continue to connect to.  There are no plans to change what I do, I just want to do it bigger and better than ever before.
Your funding will help me to bring you the biggest and best BCee album yet, and I want as many of you as possible to feel a part of making this one happen.  Even if you can't contribute, then just share it on facebook or twitter or whatever you people much younger than me use that's cool!
The funding will cover the vocalists, mastering, manufacture, session musicians, additional production and all of the costs to kick this project off.
I've tried to offer a load of perks that I think you will like or find useful and perhaps you just can't get me to do otherwise and I'm open to offers on anything else.  Essentially, just pre-ordering the album as a 'perk 'will really help.
Thanks in advance for your support.
Steve BCee

story:
Hello! I'm Tash Bird, a contemporary pop singer/songwriter from Nottingham, UK.
I released my debut EP 'Normal is Boring' back in September and I am now hoping make a music video for the track 'Talk This Over'. But I can't do it without your help because I'm a full time musician so I'm broke. 

The concept for the video is a contemporary dance following the storyline of two people going through a mutual break-up. (more info in the video above)

James George Oshoba is a filmmaker who is a typical Italian. I'm talking espressos, pasta, hand gestures, the lot. He is extremely talented and passionate about his craft which is evident in his work. He has recently written, directed and filmed a short film that has been shortlisted in various film festivals around the world.

 

The dancers/choreographers are trained dancers originally Nottingham and now working within the industry whether it's dancing in professional shows or passing their expertise on to other people by teaching.

How your money will be spent:

  • Camera
  • Lighting
  • Props
  • Van Hire
  • Catering
  • Dancers
  • Cinematographer 
  • Producer
  • Grip
  • Crew

Depending how much you're willing and/or able to donate, there's a whole load of  ‘PERKS’ that you could receive as a huge thank you for helping me reach my goal.

They're just over there! Have a cheeky gander. —> —> —>

If we don't reach our goal, we'll use whatever is raised to make the best music video we can with a more limited budget. 

I understand if you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Just get the word out and make some noise about my campaign by sharing this page! EVERYWHERE!

story:
Hi, my name is Michael Hampton and I make music under the name Soft Robot! With this campaign I am wanting to release my first big album entitled Holographic Wonder Boy. For the past three years I've been writing and recording the 14 songs that make up this hour long album. I have gone back and forth, working with drafts and trying new things, until I finally landed on a collection of songs that I was happy with!

It is my aim to have 100 physical copies printed through a service called CD Baby along with distribution rights for multiple platforms. I'm excited to continue my musical adventures and this would be an amazing accomplishment, but I need your help!

Any contribution to this campaign will go into having the album design executed properly with good quality and ensuring that my music is digitally distributed out into the world. Getting all this done on my own doesn't seem realistic or attainable at the moment so I must turn to the ancient power of the internet and plead for a helping hand! With your help we could make this wild dream a reality! And I would be eternally thankful for that.

PERKS

Contributions of $5

You get a big whopping shout out in my thank you video. I know it may not sound like much but I really couldn't do it without you!

$10

You get a download code for the album! ANNNND, if I ever see you in real life I'll give you the best hug you've ever had. 

$15

You get a physical copy of the album! I'll mail it to you or if I know you in person I'll just hand it to you aha! You'll also get a super shout out in my thank you video! 

$30 

You get a physical copy of the album, a signed original soft robot poster, extra download code, and a mega shout out in my thank you video.

$50

You get a signed physical copy of the album, two signed original soft robot posters, and a download code for an upcoming release of songs featuring my expanded band! (Drums, Bass, Electric, oh yeah, that's right baby)

$100 

You get a signed physical copy of the album, two signed original soft robot posters, and a download code for an upcoming release of songs featuring my expanded band! And I'll do a facebook live, skype, periscope, or google hangout private online concert. That's right! I'll play 15 minutes of my music just for you (and whoever else you want).

$200 

You get all the before mentioned Perks, And I'll do a facebook live, skype, periscope, or google hangout private online concert of 30 minutes of my music just for you (and whoever else you want).

Any amount is highly appreciated and will help in the long run! If you cannot support monetarily but are interested in helping please share this campaign with as many people as you can. It may not seem like much but it truly does help! Thanks for reading this long thing, I appreciate your time and hope you're well!

- Michael (((soft robot )))

story:
Hey guys, we have been offered a large opportunity to spread our message in Europe and the United Kingdom from Feb. 1st - 28th, 2017. This is something we must do but we need your HELP in order to make this happen. This is very important to us and  with your donations, sharing, and word of mouth we can accomplish anything. #itlieswithin #stayposi #ilwtourfund

Throughout the year we have been saving for opportunities like this and have come up with around $8k ourselves. The truth is that we need about $7-$8k more but we feel with the help of $5500 we can make this work. There are some awesome perks available for your donations including exclusive content. Even if we don't fully reach this goal we will continue to spread our message and continue to work to make this amazing tour happen. 

We have done a similar fundraiser like this to raise $2k for a new transmission and you guys donated almost $2,600. That allowed us to tour our crazy schedule as always this year and continue on. There are so many costs to travel overseas such as passports, work visa fees, plane tickets, van rental, fuel, and food. We aren't even concerned with lodging at this point. We are road warriors and always get in where we fit in. That's the power of positivity. 

During this holiday season we understand it's not easy for everyone to donate. It would be amazing if you could still help share and spread the word about our cause. Everything and anything helps! There are some awesome sharing tools right here on Indiegogo to make it easy. This is the biggest key for us to succeed. Please tell the world! 

Thank you all so much for taking the time to visit our fundraiser and we can't express how thankful we are to those who donate and share. You make the world go round. Thank you for all your die hard support and remember IT LIES WITHIN us all. We love you eternally! 

UPDATE: We are now raffling off a NEW 55" Sharp, Smart TV for only $5 a ticket. Check the perks for more info. Thank you all!

story:
Music Drama Through Art Song: In Wonderland

My name is Alondra Vega-Zaldivar, I am a composer, performer and teacher who wants to promote and perform new classical music from all around the world. Along with composer and pianist Edgar Suski, we created a Call for Scores project that aims to bring composers from around the world together in an unspoken collaboration. 

Each composer selected wrote a different song for Soprano and small chamber ensemble, and we have arranged it to form a Music Drama based on Lewis Carroll's Alice in Wonderland.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to fund our project and promote New Classical Music

  • Expenses include: rental of the venue, rental of recording equipment, rental of video equipment, printing costs, CD and DVD manufacturing, and of course paying our musicians for their hard work. 
  • We have some great perks for you! For a donation of at least $10 you get a discounted tickets to the Performance. We will have CDs and DVDs of the Concert in case you can't make it. You can also come to the dress rehearsal or even have a chat with me, Edgar or any of the musicians regarding our project.

The Impact

Our unique project brings composers from different countries in an unexpected collaboration. This year we selected the theme of Alice in Wonderland to open our concert to younger audiences as well. We are hoping to continue to grow and expand our Music Drama Through Art Song into a workshop where we can bring the composers together to better organize the collaboration. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help monetarily, there other ways you can. Spread the word about our campaign, project and performance.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone, I'm Peter Rogan and I've been a working musician most of my life but have never stepped out to write and record my own songs until now. In all the years I performed music, I certainly enjoyed myself, playing with friends and entertaining people, but I always felt like I needed to be creating music of my own. So a few years ago I decided to finally pursue my dream. I wrote some songs by myself and with others and have been lucky enough to be a finalist twice now in the Great American Songwriting Contest, in 2014 and 2016. I began the recording of my first full length CD last fall in Nashville entitled "Kickin' the Can". 

I'm running this campaign to raise awareness of the project and to get friends and family involved and to hopefully gain momentum. What this campaign can help me achieve is a finished product by early summer. The music is a somewhat unique blend of blues, rock, americana, funk, and jazz. Please check out my website PeterRogan.com for a free download of the first release "Still Tryin' to Believe".

Purpose of Campaign 

I'm hoping to raise $4500 to complete the mixing, mastering, CD duplication and background vocals. I've already funded the first two-thirds of the project myself and would love to get it over the finish line much quicker with your help. 

In return, we've set up some fun Perks, including Craniosacral therapy treatments, guitar lessons, songwriting discussions, t-shirts etc. And all perks will include a physical CD and digital download of the album. And with your contribution/presale you will receive updates on the progress of the record and advance releases which will become available as the songs are finished.

I'm very excited with how well the music is coming out. I recorded basic tracks last fall in Nashville with some fantastic players and singers. The engineer on the sessions just won a Grammy for engineering Sturgill Simpson's latest release "A Sailor's Guide to Earth". And I have a team in place currently for mixing, mastering and overdubs.

Thank You So Much!

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign and please spread the word about the record! And please sign up for my email list on my website PeterRogan.com and receive a free download of the first released song. Thanks and lots of love!

Pete

story:
Wat willen we eigenlijk? En wat krijg je ervoor terug?

Vandale is echt terug! Een aantal succesvolle shows in Nederland ligt de release van het nieuwe album KanNieBale binnen handbereik! 11 vette rocktracks, met de vertrouwde Vandale-sound uit 79/82, door backbones Bert van Klaveren en Eddy Bopp! Vandale heeft niet stilgestaan, teksten en spel zijn meegegroeid de afgelopen jaren en nieuwe vandalen Freek Bos, Anton Masius en Eddie Claessens hebben meegeschreven aan KanNieBale! Het resultaat? Een dikke rockplaat van Nederlandsche bodem, luchtig en kritisch, hard en heel soms iets minder hard.. ;)

Waarom crowdfunding?

Mixen, masteren en artwork is kostbaar. Daarnaast zijn nogal wat zaken op voorhand moeilijk in te schatten; hoeveel exemplaren bestellen we? Vinyl? CD? Downloads? 3D print? We kunnen door middel van crowdfunding met jou deze kosten tackelen! Door pre-orders kunnen we een bepaald aantal CD's en vinyl drukken, afhankelijk van de vraag. Goed voor het milieu en voor beide portemonnees, want hierdoor kunnen we de de verkoopprijs alleszins redelijk houden! Iedereen blij, toch? En trouwens, wie gebruikt er nog onderzetters? Dus op dat gebied hebben de teveel geperste platen ook al geen toekomst..;)

Kortom: door KanNieBale te bestellen, verzeker je je van een uniek gesigneerd exemplaar en wij kunnen een goeie inschatting van aantallen maken! Naast pre-orders kun je ook deelnemen aan exclusieve Vandale-evenementen en merchandise bestellen, zoals:

  • studiobezoek met commentaar/vragen beantwoorden over KanNieBale, of andere weetjes;
  • show thuis of op je werk;
  • tshirts
  • gesigneerde items, zoals drumvellen, drumstokken, gitaarpicks;
  • Ticket voor exclusieve release-show, inclusief CD of vinyl;
  • Je (bedrijfs)naam in de platenhoes (of die van je lief..);
  • ...

Risico

Gelukkig kunnen we melden, dat je geen risico loopt wanneer je een bestelling plaatst. We hebben garantie dat alle platen gedrukt worden. Ook kunnen we beloven dat we ook echt naar je tuin- of bedrijfsfeest komen, en dat we alle merchandise opsturen. Zo. Dat is eruit, zo doen we dat bij Vandale! Geen geouwehoer ;)

Andere ondersteuning?

Soms wil je wel, maar zit een financiële ondersteuning er even niet aan. Je kunt ons dan ook helpen door deze crowdfunding te delen en te liken op Facebook, twitter, instagram en alle sociale netwerken die je kent. Ren met een megafoon over straat in je buurt en roep heel hard: "Vandale! Pre-order! KANNIEBALEEEEE! Zoiets. Werkt altijd! 

Dank. Dank. Dank!

Iedereen die de ons steunt, financieel of op een andere geweldige wijze: ENORM BEDANKT! Zonder jullie wordt de release van KanNieBale onnodig vertraagd, en wij vinden dat jullie al lang genoeg hebben gewacht op de nieuwe Vandale plaat! En wij eigenlijk ook! 

 

VANDALE: Bert, Eddy, Anton, Freek en Eddie

Basically...

Hello, this is Catastrophe and Cris here, and we are here to make a video for our new and upcoming song, Stay Alive. We have been making music for a while and we came together many times to make great music. Now we made this song and friends are raving about how "dope" it is. We want your help right now to make a video to give the song some story and visual structure.

What We Need & What You Get

We need you, yes your money, but you are going to help make this video possible:

  • By pledging to this project, you get your name memorialized in the video
  • You can get access to behind the scenes stuff, that no one else will have
  • And all of this will go to the production of this video and make this song having a lasting impression

Other Ways You Can Help

There is one scene that requires lots of extras and we need your help to make that possible, bring a friend, and be in a really cool music video. Lunch might not be included but with your help and donations, you can make that possible.

 

And that's all there is to it. We can't wait to see what all of you future pledgers think.

- Cris and Catastrophe


Check Out Our Music Bellow

Cris: https://soundcloud.com/officialcrismusic

Catastrophe: https://soundcloud.com/catastrophemusicusa

Our last music video: VIBE



;)

story:
Hello dreamers! It’s Laurelle and 3ple here. Coming to you all with some exciting news! A while ago we came up with this crazy, adventurous idea to go on our own tour across the USA from coast to coast! The name of the tour is “Make It Change” and it is going to last for two months starting October 5, 2017 to December 5, 2017.

As two independent artists, we want to play and tour all around the world, but we thought before we take over the world let’s take over our own backyard! Our journey will take us from New York to Florida, from Florida to California and then from California back to New York. We will also be stopping off in many other cities to play so everyday we can spread the change to as many of you as possible.

We will be posting daily vlogs on Youtube to share our incredible experience and to make it feel like you all are there with us every step of the way. We also want to help you all feel inspired to pursue your own dreams, because anything is possible once you decide to take the risks and make your dreams a reality!

We are so excited about this journey, but we need your help to make this dream a success! We are looking to raise $5,000 and any contribution you decide to make will really help us out more than you know. And to thank you all for supporting us, we are giving away perks to specific donation amounts! Be sure to look on the sidebar to see what you will obtain when you support this tour with your donation. :)

Thank you all for taking the time out to read about our incredible adventure. We appreciate every single one of you. We would love to personally meet you, so please be sure to leave your name and what city you’re in in the comments below so we can try and secure venues near that specific area! So get ready. Get set. And Make It Change!

The name of the tour is “Make It Change” and it is going to last for two months starting October 5, 2017 to December 5, 2017.As two independent artists, we want to play and tour all around the world, but we thought before we take over the world let’s take over our own backyard! Our journey will take us from New York to Florida, from Florida to California and then from California back to New York. We will also be stopping off in many other cities to play so everyday we can spread the change to as many of you as possible.We will be posting daily vlogs on Youtube to share our incredible experience and to make it feel like you all are there with us every step of the way. We also want to help you all feel inspired to pursue your own dreams, because anything is possible once you decide to take the risks and make your dreams a reality!We are so excited about this journey, but we need your help to make this dream a success! We are looking to raise $5,000 and any contribution you decide to make will really help us out more than you know. And to thank you all for supporting us, we are giving away perks to specific donation amounts! Be sure to look on the sidebar to see what you will obtain when you support this tour with your donation. :)Thank you all for taking the time out to read about our incredible adventure. We appreciate every single one of you. We would love to personally meet you, so please be sure to leave your name and what city you’re in in the comments below so we can try and secure venues near that specific area! So get ready. Get set. And Make It Change!

story:
The Thrive East Bay Choir

The Thrive East Bay Choir is a diverse group of musicians, artists, activists, educators, healers, and community organizers based in Oakland, California. Their heartfelt and soul-stirring music is a fusion of gospel, soul, funk, and folk. As part of Thrive East Bay - a new purpose-driven community focused on personal and social transformation - the Choir's music provides people with an emotionally grounded and hopeful response to the systemic challenges we face in this time.

Along with offering uplifting and expansive music at our Thrive East Bay monthly community events, the Choir is starting to perform at conferences, direct actions, and special events around California. As the Thrive East Bay community grows and as the Choir is invited to perform more widely, we are ready to purchase our own sound system and to record an EP album so that the gift of this music can live on in our daily lives and be shared with wider audiences. 

     

    What The Funding Is For

    Below is a breakdown of what we are raising funds for specifically:

     

    A Sound System - $6,895

    At the most basic level, we need to be heard. Currently, the Thrive East Bay Choir has to rent a sound system every time we perform. This is not a sustainable model, and the basic sound system we rent does not capture the fullness of our textured, rich, and complex harmonies. We need to invest in quality speakers, microphones, and monitors so that our audiences can hear us and so we can hear ourselves.

     The sound system we plan to purchase includes:

    • A Mixer - A Behringer X32 Compact Mixer ($1799)
    • Microphones - 14 Shure Beta 58a mics with stands & cables ($2366)
    • PA Speakers - Mackie Thump15 Package w/ stands & cables ($850)
    • Monitor Speakers - Two JBL EON612 Packages w/ bags ($1800)
    • Boom Mic Stands - Six on-stage boom mic stands ($149.70)

     

    Recording an EP Album - $5,000

    The Choir already has a growing number of original songs it performs along with soulful classics that open hearts and bring people alive. We are planning to record a 3-track EP album featuring some of our most beloved songs so that our music can infuse the daily lives of our community and wider audiences can also experience the gifts we are bringing into the world.

    The costs for creating this EP include:

    • Sound recording
    • Sound mixing
    • Sound mastering
    • Album cover design
    • CD printing

     

    Total Budget for Sound System + Album = $12,000

    We believe in the power of love and community, and we are deeply grateful for any amount you are able to contribute to help us reach our goal.

    Thank you for helping us sing the world alive!!

     

     

    Thrive East Bay Choir Members

    The Thrive East Bay Choir currently includes:

    • Kyle Lemle (Co-Director) came out the womb singing and has performed music around the world with his a capella group "The Brown University Jabberwocks" as well as across the USA with various funk and soul bands. When he is not singing gospel, Kyle is planting trees - with community-based natural resource management projects from Bhutan to Thailand to California. 
    • Austin Willacy (Co-Director) is a singer/songwriter who has produced four full-length albums of his original music. He has toured extensively throughout the U.S. as a solo artist and through the U.S., Europe and Japan with the celebrated a cappella group The House Jacks.
    • Cherine Badawi is an accomplished experiential educator and instructional designer who has worked globally to bring people together across lines of difference and empower them to create a more socially just, thriving, and peaceful world. 
    • Joyous Dawn is an emerging singer-song writer who sings about the interconnection of grief, loss, love and healing. She's loved vocal expression since emerging from the womb, and is currently in the process of stepping into her power as a community and solo performing artist.
    • Jason Reeder is an Arabic linguist, a part-time guitarist, and a lifetime punslinger. After spending most of the last 10 years away, he is grateful to be back home in the Bay Area making music in support of the Thrive Choir.
    • Jasmine (Jazz) Vassar is an educator, presenter, healing artist who is passionate about creating sacred spaces for youth and young adults to explore identity and health, with the intention of greater social transformation. A native Californian, she enjoys the wonderment of connecting youth to the bountiful nature surrounding the Bay Area.
    • Erin Honeywell is an Oakland-based singer-songwriter and educator dedicated to promoting empowerment and justice through song and the all-powerful human voice. 
    • Stevie Greenwell is a teacher, singer, lover of the ocean, and brunch enthuistist. For the last five years she has been the vocal director at Marin School of the Arts and performs with various vocal groups across the Bay. 
    • Jasmine Saavedra Fuego is a singer, performance artist, educator, and co-founder of the Permaculture Action Network. Jasmine is an animated mover, shaker, and cross pollinator dedicated to bridging entertainment, education, and ecology to bring about a just and generative cultural narrative.
    • Jesse Sachs is an outdoor educator, builder, artist, and mentor. He is always looking for ways to activate his whole being to engage meaningfully with his community, which is why he LOVES Thrive!
    • Mallika Nair is an environmental activist, yogi, and permaculturist. She is the founder and director of Growing Together, which works to empower, educate, promote peace and increase access to nature and healthy food with Oakland students and community members, through planting fruit trees in urban spaces. Mallika loves singing from the heart, in community, and is a carrier of many circle songs and a lover of kirtan and all devotional music.

     

    About Thrive East Bay

    Thrive East Bay is a purpose-driven community of people who are committed to transforming our lives, the places we live, and our world. We offer a new kind of community that is relevant for our time, one that is both secular and spiritual, informed by modern science and ancient wisdom, infused by a deep sense of love and interconnectedness, inspired by the arts and focused on social change.

    Through personal growth, social action, and finding healthy ways to meet our physical, emotional, spiritual, and social needs, Thrive East Bay hosts monthly Sunday gatherings and small group circles guided by the following core principles:

    • Thriving Lives - We support each other in overcoming personal challenges and injustice, and creating lives filled with purpose, joy, and creative expression.
       
    • Love in Action - We let love guide us toward compassion, gratitude, empathy, and community among diverse groups of people. 
       
    • Shared Learning & Practice - We seek to deepen our understanding of the world through conversations and critical inquiry, and to grow together through transformative practices and action.
       
    • Systemic Change - We unite to build equitable systems where we can flourish as individuals, as communities, and as a planet.

    Learn more and contact us at team@thriveeastbay.org if you'd like to partner, participate, and support our work in larger ways!

     

    Ways You Can Help

    There are a number of ways you can help us:

    • Make a financial contribution today and let others know you're supporting us!
    • Share the campaign on your social media!
    • Send a message about the campaign directly to people you know who may be interested!
    • Like the Thrive East Bay Facebook Page & stay connected!
    • Join us for an upcoming Thrive East Bay event!

    Contact us at team@thriveeastbay.org if you have questions, suggestions, or would like to support our work in larger ways.

    Thank you for your partnership!!

story:
Increate -- Void

Increate is an instrumental progressive metal band from Portland Oregon, consisting of Sean Chiodo and Dustin Behm on 8 string guitars, Zev Levine on bass, and Johannes Jans on drums. For our debut album VOID we were lucky to recruit master producer Jocke Skog of Sweden. The album also features the amazing talents of Gianluca Ferro and Julian Cifuentes as guest soloists. We all came to this project with a desire to push the technical boundaries of instrumental death metal. We're thrilled with how the record is sounding and we want you to be part of the process!

So far we've funded every aspect of the project ourselves through our many day jobs but now we need help getting the music on physical media. We're making it happen by offering pre-release downloads, cds, lessons, merch, and live shows. This way anyone who wants our music can take part in its creation in a seriously meaningful way. Of our $3,290 goal, $2400 will go to production fees and $890 will go to purchasing and printing cds. If we don't reach our goal, we will still devote 100% of proceeds to finishing the project and getting our music out to the masses. 

Want a Vinyl LP? – So do we. If there is enough interest (and we hit our goal for production fees) we'd love to produce VOID on vinyl. If you are interested type “Vinyl” in the comment section. Those who commit to buy one of the other perks can upgrade to vinyl if it becomes available. Vinyl pricing would be $20 for advance orders from a limited pressing of 200 copies; an additional $2200 above our goal. If this interests you please share our music and this page with your friends!

Want to help but financially challenged at the moment? We can use all the promotional help we can get. Please pass along our videos and share our info.

Thank you!

story:
Hello friends.

Please help me produce a CD of inspirational music that will calm your soul, uplift your spirit, and bring joy to your heart. With gratitude and love, I sincerely thank you. Francia

http://www.broadjam.com/franciamcnally

Living in trust and faith!

This album of songs is all about letting go of my inhibitions and living life more fully! And I have been given an opportunity to do that. And that is because through these songs I am being led out of my comfort zone. And I am being led because I cannot imagine anything other than recording and singing them!

I could get someone much more experienced to sing them. But why? I want to sing them!

With this endeavor I am allowing myself to live a more adventurous life. I know there have been inhibitions I've had which have kept me back from living my life fully as a musician and I am beginning to refuse to let that continue to happen. I have not been extremely inhibited but I think, like some of us out there, there are some things in life to which I've given way too much importance and head space. And it was not good things. So now, all good things!

 

My Backstory

 

I’ve been playing the piano since I was 9 years old.

But the truth is I always really wanted to play the guitar. When I was very young, my two older sisters had guitar lessons. And I thought that when I was old enough, I would have them too. But just when I thought I was going to start, the guitar teacher moved away. So instead, I started taking piano lessons with another teacher, Mr. Charles, on the third floor of Charles Music Studio in Brooklyn, NY.

 

So I continued to play the piano. I studied music at the University of New Mexico in Albuquerque, because I could not think of anything else I wanted to do. I got a degree in Music Theory and Composition and I’m a pretty good composer. I even won our senior year composition contest, and I was pretty happy about that. Eventually, I produced 3 solo piano CDs generating good reviews. I wanted to release others, but between my job (I worked at a record company in Universal City), forgetfulness and living life I just never got around to making any more.

 

Currently . . .

Fast forward to now – I’m playing the guitar! And singing!

 

I am a musician with a new and different vision for myself! My goal is to record at least 10 of the songs I have written over the past few years. The difference is these are singer/songwriter tunes, and singing them is: Me! This will be the first time that I will release an album with me as a singer. I am both exhilarated and tingly, knowing that this desire is possible for me. And so far 6 of them are in various forms of preparedness!

 

Making Herstory  

So, I’ve organized this crowdfunding campaign to generate income to record and mix these singer/songwriter tracks and I’m asking you to help me fund the project by purchasing my older CDs and the new album as a download.

 

I’m going for the gusto!

I’m really excited about this and positive because it feels right. And I know it will all turn out great – and with your help and support, I will succeed even sooner. Won’t you please add your Yes to my Yes!

Thank you so much from the bottom of my heart!

Francia

Please perk away! All perks include the perk above it!

story:
Spanish version (English version below)

¿Quien es Osamu?

Hola amigos!  Soy un artista Cubano residente en Miami, y espero que les guste mi música. Quiero agradecerle a todos los artistas que trabajaron en este disco y a todos ustedes por su contribución.

¿Que necesito?

Necesito mandar a hacer las copias físicas de este disco "Mandala," hacerle promoción y también distribuirlas por el mundo.  Espero que con su apoyo pueda alcanzar esta meta.

¿Que ofrezco? La opportunidad de:

  • Escuchar mucha música
  • Estar en los agradecimientos en mi próximo disco
  • Ser un Productor Ejecutivo en mi próximo disco
  • Ayudar a difundir mi música

¿No puede contribuir?  ¡No importa!  Hay otras formas de ayudar.

Por favor compárte esta campaña de indiegogo en sus redes sociales.

English version (Spanish version above)

Who is Osamu?

Dear friends!  I am a Cuban Artist resident of Miami City, and I hope you like my music.  I want to thank all the Artists who participated in this album, Mandala, and I want to thank all of you for your contribution.   

What do I need?

I need to make copies of this album "Mandala" and I need to promote it and distribute it throughout the world.  I hope that with your help I can reach this goal. 

What do I offer?   The opportunity of: 

  • Listening to a lot of music
  • Be listed in the Thank You notes on my next album
  • Be listed as an Executive Producer for my next album
  • Help me spread my music throughout the world. 

You can't contribute?  It doesn't matter!  There are other ways to help.

You can still help by sharing this campaign with your friends and family.  Please post this campaign to all your social media channels.
