story:
My core belief is that we have been given this gift of life and it is our duty to live it as fully as possible. To that end, I have faced the things that scare me the most, like learning to paraglide when I’m terrified of heights, like becoming a paramedic after having been an actor for years, like learning harmonica, and even resigning from the fire department to follow a dream.

I feel the pulse of my ancestors pounding within me - my great uncle, Jack Albertson, both my grandmothers, my brother, Bryan (an insanely talented drummer), and my mother Cloris Leachman, who not everyone knows, is a concert level pianist. Because my family was so musically accomplished, I shied away from playing an instrument as a kid. But I carried a secret dream: that I would be able to pick up a guitar and jam around a campfire with my friends and family, singing the songs we loved so well.

When I got away from home, after high school, I found an old guitar and an Eagles chord book and taught myself how to play “Peaceful Easy Feeling.” That was the start. Since then, I have played around many campfires and at all kinds of events. I’ve realized that dream.

A few months ago, I found myself thinking about my life and my songwriting. I believe I have more to give this world before I die. For two decades, I put my artistic aspirations on hold to make sure that I was there to raise my kids. As a paramedic and firefighter, I served the citizens of Los Angeles, Ventura, and Oxnard the best I could. I’m not getting any younger. I know that if I really want to succeed at something I need to give it 100%.

So, here’s my revised dream: I want to give one song everything I got. I want to come up with a product that, when it’s finished, I can say, “Here you go, this is my best.” No excuses, no “wish I would’ve.” I give this unconditionally, with all of me, to all of you.

I have that song. It’s called Homeward Bound (A Firefighter’s Song). The song is recorded and it is my best. But to complete the vision, I need to shoot the video. My dear friend, Andrea Shreeman, has written a dynamite script and will be directing the music video. I am so excited to be working with her. Several years back she directed me in a show I wrote and from that very positive experience I can say there’s no better person to direct this video.

I have launched this crowd-funding campaign so that you, my community can join with me in making this music video. I'm asking you to help me raise $10,000 toward the $15,500 it will cost to make the video.

We are thrilled to have a team of award-winning and talented artists working on this music video. While everyone is working beneath their regular rate to fulfill the elements of our shoot and edit, we still want to compensate them for their time, and keep them fed and hydrated. Approximately twenty-five artists will touch this project before its completion, including animation compositors, visual editors, set decorators, prop specialists, wardrobe and makeup designers, and a solid camera team. Approximately 35% of our budget is labor cost, 20% will be spent on art and design, another 20% will go to equipment costs, 15% will be spent on locations and insurance, and 10% is for campaign perks and fees.

As you can imagine, I have been torn between leaving my post at the fire department and following this thumping in my heart. But, I found a way to honor the men and women who still sacrifice, day after day, to keep us all safe and solve the problems that we as individuals can’t overcome.

I am over moon to be partnering with the Los Angeles Fire Department Foundation. Raising money and awareness for their amazing cause with the Homeward Bound song and video, is a dream come true. Once we pass the $10,000 mark, we'll be making direct donations to this 501c3 with your help!

We’ve come up with some great ways to thank you for being a contributor. Some highlights are the $75 contribution that comes with admission to our Bonfire Party Scene - you’ll appear in the music video and help us celebrate wrapping up our three-day shoot. We created a perk for Guiding Light fans to have a video chat with me for a donation of $150, it comes with all the digital downloads. For $250 you can join me on a special group tour of an LAFD Fire Station. There’s much more, just take a look at the list of perks in the right-hand column.

If we don’t reach our $10,000 goal, we'll use every dollar you have contributed to make the best version of our story that we can. I’m prepared to make up any needed cost from my own pocket to fulfill this vision of excellence that I have. I’ll put your money toward the most important pieces of the puzzle, our key artists (director, cinematographer, art director and editor) and the safety structure for our shoot (permits, insurance, food, water) - then I’ll come in to provide the details on art department, camera department, lights, sound, wardrobe and more. Together, we will make this happen.

The true sacrifice that early responders make is not known by the public. It’s a constant physical sacrifice of body, mind and spirit - meeting the demands of daily challenges and tragedies. But there is also a huge toll that firefighting takes on one’s personal life and family. We plan to illuminate this through the story and lyrics of the music video for Homeward Bound. But also, we will prosper my brothers and sisters still of service, and their families, through the Los Angeles Fire Department Foundation.

I have never asked for anything in my life, I started dishwashing at 14, I worked as a paramedic for 17 years, a firefighter for 12 years, and I raised two kids as a single dad. I’ve slept on rooftops in New York city, I’ve given my last dollar to a woman in need. I’m not asking for you to buy me this video. I am asking, if you see this spark, to help us light the tinder, to come along for the ride. We need people in all kinds of ways. If you can’t donate money, come be a driver on the set for a day, or spread this project on the internet, or send me an encouraging note. The point is, let’s do this together.

The toughest part about a campaign like this is putting myself out there, publicly sharing my goals and risking failure. But I have accomplished every major goal I have set in my life. If we fall short of our $10,000 campaign goal, where we will suffer most is in the time it takes to get this project finished. Because I’ll work (shooting real estate videos with company eXtreme Drone Shots) to raise the money to make up for any gap in funding this dream. And if we need to push our shoot, we may lose our top artists, which means even more time in regrouping and rebuilding for excellence. But, as a team of established artists with an inspiring song already recorded, we confidently move forward now and we know that YOU will truly make the difference.

If you can't support the campaign financially you can still participate by:

  • Emailing 3-5 friends who you think would love the song.
  • Log into Indiegogo, visit our campaign, and share the campaign by clicking the Facebook and Twitter buttons on our campaign page.

Whatever you can do, I am so grateful for your support!
story_txt:
My core belief is that we have been given this gift of life and it is our duty to live it as fully as possible. To that end, I have faced the things that scare me the most, like learning to paraglide when I’m terrified of heights, like becoming a paramedic after having been an actor for years, like learning harmonica, and even resigning from the fire department to follow a dream.I feel the pulse of my ancestors pounding within me - my great uncle, Jack Albertson, both my grandmothers, my brother, Bryan (an insanely talented drummer), and my mother Cloris Leachman, who not everyone knows, is a concert level pianist. Because my family was so musically accomplished, I shied away from playing an instrument as a kid. But I carried a secret dream: that I would be able to pick up a guitar and jam around a campfire with my friends and family, singing the songs we loved so well.When I got away from home, after high school, I found an old guitar and an Eagles chord book and taught myself how to play “Peaceful Easy Feeling.” That was the start. Since then, I have played around many campfires and at all kinds of events. I’ve realized that dream.A few months ago, I found myself thinking about my life and my songwriting. I believe I have more to give this world before I die. For two decades, I put my artistic aspirations on hold to make sure that I was there to raise my kids. story:
Who I am..

 

If we haven’t met, hello! My name is Troy Petty. An indie/alternative/pop artist from Chicago, IL USA currently residing in Columbus, Ohio. Music has been the foundation for most of my life yet, until recently, too far in the background. 

 

About 3 years ago I crossed that wobbly bridge into a full time music career. The risk continues to pay off: I feel the rewards from the very first note I play or sing, until my music is finally inside your ears, mind and hopefully, your soul. 

 

This is why I am here. My purpose. My job. To reach you. To reach out to you and share what makes us so similar and the mysteries that bring us closer. 

 

Since the independent release of my “Departure” EP in 2015, I’ve earned several momentum-building opportunities; from solid reviews, taking first place in a local songwriter competition, networking with the international music community in Cannes, France to 30 day tour in Germany!

 

And with over 200 shows and thousands of miles traveled in 2015-16, I can proudly announce my partnership with a wonderful record label and promotions company in Bremen, Germany, Songs & Whispers along side the well known publisher Budde Music! 

 

What I am doing..

 

After signing to an independent label and a publisher in October, my timeline for opportunity is set and the bar has been raised! With the plan to release “Departure” in an extended special edition entitled “DepartureS” in July, my window to record the full length follow up “Director’s Cut” is narrow.

 

Why I am doing this on indiegogo..

 

Welcome to the modern age of the music industry, where many artists and labels are creating closer and more personal relationships with their audience. Yes, it has and always will be up to you, the fans and friends! You are the bread & butter, the longevity, the deciding vote and the reason we persevere in this life!

 

With just a few months until scheduled recording sessions begin, I am inviting you to be the reason and the way this album, my proudest to date, is made and released into the world! 

 

Everything is ready to go except for our budget! This invitation is as much about asking you to share in the success of this album, as it is encouraging you to join us as we journey into the next 6 to 12 months and beyond. 

 

So, please join me and my new family in Bremen, Germany as we set out to produce, promote and celebrate our purpose. Our passion. Our art!

 

What your backing dollars paying for:

 

Studio time at JSR Recording Studios in Columbus, Ohio: Recording, mixing and mastering the full length album “Director’s Cut” of 9 -11 songs.

Hired musicians performing on the album

The physical production/duplication of CD’s 

Fees of videographer and Indiegogo 

 

What you can get:

 

Exclusive Downloads

Autographed Special edition CDs

Your name in the credits section on the album

Personalized (virtual) concert 

Private house concerts

YOUR performance on the actual record “Director’s Cut!”

Lifetime of bragging rights

You get to be a part of the most exciting moment in my career!

 

What if I exceed my monetary goal?

 

Every penny that is received will help fund all things associated with this new album: from the recording, production to the thousands of dollars in travel expenses for the Summer 2017 tour in the US and Europe. Trust me, the money will be used to get me to you!

 

Thank you for taking the time amidst the ongoing craziness in this world and always remember, music is love, and love is what all we need.

 

Excited to see you soon!

 

Love,

 

Troy

story:
Short Summary

Greetings from Colorado!

     First, we wanted to thank you for taking the time to check out our Indiegogo campaign! It means the world to us! Danielle and I are very excited about this project! It's a project that we've had on our hearts and minds for some time now. We believe that with today's technology and the amazing idea of crowdfunding, that there couldn't be a better time to start than now!

     For those who don't know, Danielle is an amazing singer/song writer, with an incredible gift of taking songs and arranging them in a new and fresh way! For me (Kali'i) my background is more behind the scenes in recording and mixing (with a little dabbling as a drummer).  Together with the help of some amazingly talented musicians, singers, and all of you, we want to bring to life a music album that we hope will bless all those who listen to it!  

     

What We Need & What You Get

     So what do we need? Though we have a lot of our own equipment to record and mix it, making an album still takes time, energy and money. We would use the funds for a few equipment upgrades that would allow us to speed up the process to get the album completed quicker as well as bring an even higher quality to the sound of the album. We would also be able to hire a few musicians and vocalists (for a couple of surprise collaborations on a few of the songs!) as well as pay for the licensing for the cover songs that will be on the album.

     The great thing about crowdfunding, and really one of the main reasons we are going this route, is because it is a win/win partnership. As you are supporting us in making this album we offer rewards, a way of saying thank you for partnering with us! We really love that this is something we can all do together!

When you give at least:

  • $3 - you will get your name listed on our physical CD, and a free download of one of Danielle's original songs "You Reign".
  • $5 - You will get all of the $3 rewards, plus granted access to a private Facebook group that will be posting picture and video updates. 
  • $10 - All of the above, plus your choice of either the physical copy or digital copy of the finished album!
  • $15 - All of the above, plus you will get an EARLY SIGNED copy of the CD. (before it goes out to the public).
  • $25 - All of the above, plus if you fancy yourself a singer, you will get additional karaoke tracks to each song. (sing to it around the house or in an epic Karaoke battle with friends, the uses are endless!)
  • $50 - All of the above, PLUS you will be a part of an exclusive group that will help us decide which songs to use. (Danielle and I will have it narrowed down to about 20 or so, but you will help us decide which ones stay and which ones get cut) PLUS we will also have your name in a special Thank You section of the physical CD, as well as your name in the scrolling "Thank You" credits of our promotional/thank you video that we will release when the album is done.
  • $125 - All of the above, plus you'll get to be a part of the creative process! We will send you audio files of our rough mixes to get your feedback on each song. PLUS you will receive digital copies of the behind the scene videos we will be making!

 

     One thing that we believe separates us from several other crowdfunding projects, is that for us it's not an all or nothing deal. We don't need the full $4,000 in order to make this happen. Without the proper funding for this project, it just means that it would take longer. Our goal if it's fully funded, is to be done (start to finish) with this album no more than 3 months after we start it.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

     We know that not everyone can support this project financially, and that is totally cool. We don't want to pressure people into giving. That's not our goal. In fact, this album will get done one way or another. It might just take a lot longer, but it will get done. This campaign is for those who want to help in any way they can. So if you can't give financially, (or even if you can) we ask that you pray for us, as well as for this project. Another way that you can help is to help us get the word out! Share this with others. There are tools that Indiegogo has that makes it easy to share with your friends and family. Also, and submit requests in the comments section of this webpage of songs that you'd like us to do!

     Again, thank you so much for taking the time to read this! We are excited for what the future holds, and we look forward to presenting a great completed album to the world!!

God Bless and have a great day!!

story:
Music is life.  Mine is informed by a deep spiritual practice, by the beauty of nature, by the wilderness both inside and out.  "Begin" is my second album.  It will take you on a full spectrum, emotional journey.  It's the work of my heart and soul, and it's time has come. There are 11 tracks on this album, with a play time of about 45 minutes.

The late, great Kenny Edwards' musical genius is woven throughout the album.  Kenny was one of the founding members of the Stone Pony's with Linda Ronstadt, and toured for several decades with Karla Bonoff.  He generously mentored and added his brilliance to many musicians works throughout California and beyond.  I'm ever grateful to him.  He co-produced the album along with one of Santa Barbara's most well-respected recording engineers, Robinson Eikenberry, and myself.   I owe it to the world to finally share this amazing body of work.   I owe it to Kenny, and to all of the fantastic musicians who helped to bring this album to it's fullness.   I owe it to the one who gave me these precious gifts.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm targeting a goal of $3000 to complete and market this album.  Graphics and support through CD Baby, production of 1000 discs.  

For contributions of $10, I'll send you a copy of "Begin" once complete.

For contributions of $20, I'll send you a copy of each of my albums.

For contributions of $100  to $300 you can choose a corresponding amount of jewelry from my website; www.whitmoregallery.com

For contributions of $500 and over, I'll create an original multi media artwork for you.  Details in the "perks" section.

The Impact

Thank you from the bottom of my heart.  Your contribution will help to launch a project that will shine a light of love and brillance into the world, at a time when we need it most.

I am passionate about promoting this thing of beauty once it's finished.  The songs are more relevant than ever, and timeless in theme.   My hope is that this music enriches and touches many, many lives.

Risks & Challenges

It will take a bit of time to get all of the graphics together, but I do not anticipate it taking past the end of May at the very latest.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't forget to use Indiegogo share tools, and spread the word to friends and colleagues!

There are 11 tracks on this album, with a play time of about 45 minutes.
The late, great Kenny Edwards' musical genius is woven throughout the album.  Kenny was one of the founding members of the Stone Pony's with Linda Ronstadt, and toured for several decades with Karla Bonoff.  He generously mentored and added his brilliance to many musicians works throughout California and beyond.  I'm ever grateful to him.  He co-produced the album along with one of Santa Barbara's most well-respected recording engineers, Robinson Eikenberry, and myself.   I owe it to the world to finally share this amazing body of work.   I owe it to Kenny, and to all of the fantastic musicians who helped to bring this album to it's fullness.   I owe it to the one who gave me these precious gifts.
 

What We Need & What You Get
I'm targeting a goal of $3000 to complete and market this album.  Graphics and support through CD Baby, production of 1000 discs.  
For contributions of $10, I'll send you a copy of "Begin" once complete.
For contributions of $20, I'll send you a copy of each of my albums.
For contributions of $100  to $300 you can choose a corresponding amount of jewelry from my website; www.whitmoregallery.com
For contributions of $500 and over, I'll create an original multi media artwork for you.  Details in the "perks" section.

The Impact
Thank you from the bottom of my heart.  Your contribution will help to launch a project that will shine a light of love and brillance into the world, at a time when we need it most.
I am passionate about promoting this thing of beauty once it's finished.  The songs are more relevant than ever, and timeless in theme.   My hope is that this music enriches and touches many, many lives.

Risks & Challenges
It will take a bit of time to get all of the graphics together, but I do not anticipate it taking past the end of May at the very latest.

Other Ways You Can Help
Don't forget to use Indiegogo share tools, and spread the word to friends and colleagues!

story:
Über Uns & und unser Projekt

Ihr Lieben,

vielen Dank, dass ihr auf der Crowdfunding Seite für unsere 2. Studio CD vorbeischaut!

Wir sind die Band „Deep River“, Ingo, Svenja und Stefan und kommen alle aus dem schönen Hann. Münden in Niedersachsen.

Seit 3 Jahren machen wir zusammen Musik, nennen wir es mal Soulful Indie Folk, unsere erste CD „91“ ist vor 2 Jahren erschienen, auch mit Hilfe eines Crowdfunding Portals.

Seitdem haben wir mehr als 70 Konzerte deutschlandweit gespielt, ein Video produziert und im letzten Jahr eine Live DVD aufgenomen.

Jetzt ist es soweit, wir haben eine große Menge toller neuer Songs und vor allem auch jede Menge kreativer Produktions Ideen, neue Instrumente, neue Beats und Sounds schweben in unseren Köpfen und uns ist klar, das die Umsetzung mehr Kapital brauchen wird, als bei unserem ersten Album.

Wir wollen das perfekte „Deep River“ Album hinbekommen und an Ideen mangelt es nicht.

Jetzt kommt Ihr ins Spiel!!

Wir haben in den vergangenen 2 Jahren nach Erscheinen des ersten Albums soviel positive Energie von euch bekommen, dass wir fest an euch und eure Unterstützung glauben und uns sehr freuen würden, wenn ihr Teil unseres neuen Projektes werden wollt!

Das Ziel dieser Crowdfunding Kampagne ist es, genügend Unterstützer zu finden um die Aufnahmen, den finalen Mix, das Artwork und die CD Pressung zu finanzieren.

Letztendlich hängt es von euch ab, ob wir das, was wir im Moment planen auch umsetzen können. Alles was oberhalb unseres geplanten Budgets liegt, wird unsere Möglichkeiten erweitern.

Album, Perks & Budget

Die Aufnahmen für die CD starten jetzt im Matamatic Studio. 12-13 Songs, alles „Deep River“ Originale, komponiert von Ingo und Stefan möchten wir aufnehmen und möglichst noch in diesem Jahr veröffentlichen.

Wir haben uns vielfältige Möglichkeiten ausgedacht wie ihr uns unterstützen könnt, das geht vom Download  der CD bis zum Auftritt der ganzen Band bei euch im Wohnzimmer.

Projektbudget:

Aufnahme & Mix

 1.000,00 €

Finaler Mix

 300,00 €

Mastering

 400,00 €

GEMA Gebühr

 100,00 €

Reisekosten

 100,00 €

CD-Pressung

 600,00 €

Grafik

 500,00 €

Gesamt:

 3.000,00 €

Stand der Dinge 

Wir sind also jetzt voll fokussiert im Aufnahme Modus. Über die weitere Entwicklung werden wir euch natürlich zeitnah auf dem Laufenden halten, stay tuned!!

Wie Du sonst noch helfen kannst 

Die Zeiten sind hart, und vielleicht hast Du keine Möglichkeit unser Projekt finanziell zu unterstützen? Helfen kannst Du dennoch, und zwar indem Du deinen Freunden & Bekannten auf Deinen Social Media Sites über dieses Projekt erzählst. Bitte nutze dafür das Tool von Indiegogo.

Liebe Grüße

Svenja, Ingo und Stefan

- Deep River -

story:
Reiatsu Records Campaign Summary

Reiatsu Records is a indie label based out of The Bronx, New York. In its 3 year existence we have released 6 albums , 3 EPs , and dozens of singles and DJ Mixes. With very little funds we have begun cultivating the sound of the future for The Bronx and in turn New York City and with your help and support the World. 

What We Need & What You Get

Reiatsu Records is seeking to raise $10,000 to get the label off the ground and moving to make the change we seek to see in the world. The funds will be allocated to the Creative Direction budget and rent for our in-house studio. 

Perk 1- Reiatsu Accessories

Perk 2- Reiatsu Merchandise

Perk 3- Reiastu Merch and Signed CD

Perk 4- Complete Discography and Merchandise

Perk 5- Reiatsu Master

If we do not reach our goal of $10,000 the raised funds will be still be allocated towards Creative Direction and the rent for our home studio to ensure that Reiatsu Records continues to put out quality content.

 

The Impact

 

Reiatsu Records is a record company built on the foundation of unhindered self- expression coupled with top tier professionalism and high quality. In a time where music has become increasingly over-saturated and disposable, Reiatsu looks to bring true artistry and craftsmanship back to the art form by tapping into the roots as well as looking ahead towards the future. Our goal is to continue to innovate and create art and product on its highest level.

 

Risks and Challenges

 

Reiatsu Records is a small company with 4 key members attending to day to day operations. In the future the company will need to work with a larger number of employees in order to execute effectively. Roles such as operations manager, working with publicist, and social media management need to be filled.


Also without financial backing we cannot pay for musical/artist expenses, marketing, promotion, and rent with income from musical sales alone.

Knowing these problems exist is half the work , we will continue to work day and night to cover these short comings and strengthen the infrastructure of the company to guarantee success and the satisfaction of our supporters. To the solve the challenges our plan of action is to find candidates for our vacant positions who are not only capable but excel and are visionaries at their specific skill sets. And by diversifying our sources of income we will insure that musical sales alone do not determine whether or not Reiatsu Records succeeds or fails. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you cannot contribute financially to the Reiastu Records Start Up Campaign we would love it if you could help us by sharing and communicating with others about Reiatsu Records and its artists. Contact us via email ( reiatsu.records@gmail.com) if you would like to volunteer your help and/or guidance. The power of word of mouth should never be underestimated . Thank You!

 

You can visit reiatsurecords.bandcamp.com to listen to the albums we have released and soundcloud.com/mizou-hitokiri to hear singles, EPs , DJ Mixes and Interviews.

story:
Remembering Lemmy

Beginning in 2010 Staffordshire University graduate Nile Plumb launched a campaign to immortalize rock legend Lemmy permanently in his native city of Stoke-on-Trent.

To date the campaign has drawn the support of thousands of people and been featured in international rock magazines and news reports,

We believe Lemmy is deserving of a long lasting monument due to his achievements, inspiration and legacy of music career. Speaking on BBC Radio Stoke, he said: "There's a lot of interest and people really want to get behind it. The musical genius of Lemmy is something for this community to celebrate."

Since its launch, the campaign has chosen noted figurative sculptor Steven Whyte, to sculpt the rock hero. The former Vice President of the Royal Society of Portrait Sculptors, Whyte was educated in Stoke-on-Trent and now lives in California. Whyte first saw Motörhead when he was 14 years old and has been a big fan of Lemmy for decades. His last sculpture sold for over $1,700,000 so when it comes to qualifications for this project, Steven Whyte is "Definitely the Ace! Overkill!" says Plumb.

We have the talent, we have official measurements as well as portrait session sittings taken with Lemmy whilst he was still rocking the world, we even have the cities councils approval. We just need the final funds to cast the statues in bronze and ship them worldwide.

Support from Lemmy Himself

Luckily, the long-standing support for the project and Whyte's involvement allowed the sculptor to meet with Lemmy for a series of live portrait sittings.  These sessions are the only one the rock god participated in prior to his passing.  The ability to sculpt his likeness from life, will help assure the monument's authenticity and speaks to Lemmy's support of the project and the artistic team.

Various Motorhead’s fan clubs across the world have shown tremendous support and have requested multiple casts of the statue themselves.

The sculpture is well underway already once funds have been raised we will be able to bring Lemmy home to Stoke-on-Trent and deliver other castings to his fans around the world.

Every little bit helps, please joins us in this exciting project or share our story with others who might be able to assist. Donors beginning at the $5 level will have their names entered into a time capsule that will be placed inside the monument earning a place in rock n'roll history.

Lemmy's fans were among the most loyal and passionate in the world.  We know that they can make this tribute happen.

story:
Echoic: Coöccur

My name is Otto Nuoranne, and I'm a musician from Helsinki, Finland. I've run Echoic since 2013, when I released the first album "Springbook". Echoic has been almost quiet for five years, but now nine new songs have grown too big for any nest and they're about to be released into the wild.

I'm asking for your support in the long process that has been and is making this album. The songs were written between 2011 and 2016, recorded between 2017 and 2018, and polished during this spring. With your support, I'll be able to pay the super-skilled and big-hearted musicians that helped me through this with no guaranteed income for themselves, and maybe water the Echoic plant for the future growth that it deserves.

"Bloom", featured here with a little video, is the first track out, and I hope it feeds your appetite just enough to hold it until July, when the rest bursts out. "Bloom" was written and produced by myself, and I sang and played everything except drums, which were provided by Niklas Romo. It was recorded and engineered by Ilari Heinilä, mixed by Ilmari Apajalahti, and mastered by Jonas Verwijnen at Kaiku Studios. The video was produced by Eliel Kilkki and Joel Grandell at Superreel.
 

The Money

I'm hoping to raise 4,000€ for the project. This is far from what a label-funded album would cost, but I've had an awesome privilege of getting help from some very professional friends, who have generously helped me get this far. This is roughly where the money from this campaign would go:

1,500€ to production help & featured musicians
1,000€ to mixing & mastering
500€ to printing the CDs
1,000€ to printing the vinyls (if we get there)*

Any extra will go to the musicians who helped make this happen and Echoic's future in the form of gear, merchandise, maybe even a tour budget at some point. If I don't reach the overall goal, the album will still be released on time and all the perks will be realised (except probably the vinyl one), and I'll fund the project myself.

And if you don't feel like supporting Echoic with money, it also means the world to us if you share the word about the campaign and the music, in the real world as well as online. During the campaign, you can point people towards the "Bloom" video, and that should give them an idea of what this is all about.

*About the vinyls:

It's any modern-day indie musician's dream to print vinyls, but it's also expensive. It's only realistic if at least 30 people or so want it, so any perk that includes the vinyl is conditional. If you pledge for the vinyl record, but it doesn't get made, you have the following options:

1. Get the rewards from a different perk of the same value
2. Upgrade or downgrade to another perk by paying a bit more or getting a partial refund
3. Keep the pledge as future "vinyl credit" - I will get vinyls printed sooner or later, either once Echoic finds a more stable group of followers or once I've robbed a bank
4. Get a full refund and withdraw your support from the project completely (This would be sad.)


The Album

Whatever happens with the money, in July you'll be able to hear "Coöccur", Echoic's new album. It's about 45 minutes and nine songs about coincidences, and the overwhelming idea that while so much is going on in our own head, a different but similar rich mess is wreaking havoc in everyone else's head. Sometimes lines cross, sometimes paths cross, sometimes two things happen at the same time.

It's a patchwork of organic and electronic elements. There's a lot of cello, acoustic guitar, and piano, but also some club beats, synth arpeggios, and my beatboxing into a broken microphone as heard through a cheap loop pedal. It'll eventually be up on all the major places where people get music these days.

I made it with all my <3 and I really hope you'll like it.


The Cover Images

Each song on Coöccur has a cover image of its own, and you can order postcards and prints of them as part of some of the perks. If you want to do this, the checkout will ask you to select out of some options. Here, you can see previews of the images for the prints or the postcards:

1 Bloom

 

2 Airbourne/Groundbound

 

3 Focus Back

 

4 A Dream Sequence

 

5 Hollow Sun

 

6 Coöccur

 

7 Nightingale

 

8 Mystery

 

9 Sleepwalking

story:
Short Summary

Hi my friends. I'm runnin g a very short Indiegogo campaign to find some folks that would be interested in the final funding for my new project "MUSIC & OTHER SUNDRIES".  This will be the first time I'm putting out an album (Literally) on VINYL  with the help of an amazing cast of musicians and my producer Geoff Wilbourn.  Geoff and I had a #1 on the Billboard Blues Chart in 2015 with "LOVE & MONEY" and he produced "LIVE  IN MADISON", "THAT'S WHY I DON'T SING THE BLUES" and "WELCOME TO DELTAVILLE". We start recording on July 13th in Nashville, TN.

  • I would assume most people reading this know who I am... LOL
  • This campaign is to come up with final funding. 
  • The reason I'm running the campaign so late was that I was waiting for closing on a small PPP loan with the SBA and at the last minute, I (and thousands of others were denied)
  • Check Out The Musicians on this record.
  • Kinny Landrum (Robert Palmer, Benny Mardones, Twin Peaks"
  • Brad Clancy (David Ball, Confederate Railroad, Bobby Messano touring drummer)
  • Kirby Barber (Bassist Extraordinaire)
  • David Northrup ( Travis Tritt, Wynona)
  • Tracy Nelson (The singer sent by angels)

What I Need & What You Get

  • I don't need much. Just enough to be able to cover costs and musicians.
  • The perks are just a few...A Signed Record, yes an actual record , a Signed Record and a T shirt (Package) or the full package and your name on the album as an executive producer
  • If I don't reach my goal, the funds will still pay for musicians and the studio.

The Impact

  • I've learned over the years that I have great fans and many have asked me to release on vinyl..It's time, especially after not working for a year because of COVID 19
  • I've had a few successes with Indiegogo over the years, but truthfully, I fund my own projects with very little help. I believe that because I do that, it keeps my integrity as an artist because I am willing to risk funding my own projects.
  • COVID 19 in 2020 destroyed many musicians careers and this is my attempt to keep moving forward with as much steam as possible. Thank you.

Risks & Challenges

  • This has been a tough time for ALL musicians. Without moving forward and creating new music I fear that music, especially Indie Music will disappear completely. This is my way of moving my lifetime career foorward....THANK YOU ALL.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate, please folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign and use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi my friends. I'm runnin g a very short Indiegogo campaign to find some folks that would be interested in the final funding for my new project "MUSIC & OTHER SUNDRIES".  This will be the first time I'm putting out an album (Literally) on VINYL  with the help of an amazing cast of musicians and my producer Geoff Wilbourn.  Geoff and I had a #1 on the Billboard Blues Chart in 2015 with "LOVE & MONEY" and he produced "LIVE  IN MADISON", "THAT'S WHY I DON'T SING THE BLUES" and "WELCOME TO DELTAVILLE". We start recording on July 13th in Nashville, TN.

I would assume most people reading this know who I am... LOL
This campaign is to come up with final funding. 
The reason I'm running the campaign so late was that I was waiting for closing on a small PPP loan with the SBA and at the last minute, I (and thousands of others were denied)
Check Out The Musicians on this record.

Kinny Landrum (Robert Palmer, Benny Mardones, Twin Peaks"

Brad Clancy (David Ball, Confederate Railroad, Bobby Messano touring drummer)

Kirby Barber (Bassist Extraordinaire)

David Northrup ( Travis Tritt, Wynona)

Tracy Nelson (The singer sent by angels)


What I Need & What You Get

I don't need much. Just enough to be able to cover costs and musicians.
The perks are just a few...A Signed Record, yes an actual record , a Signed Record and a T shirt (Package) or the full package and your name on the album as an executive producer
If I don't reach my goal, the funds will still pay for musicians and the studio.


The Impact

I've learned over the years that I have great fans and many have asked me to release on vinyl..It's time, especially after not working for a year because of COVID 19
I've had a few successes with Indiegogo over the years, but truthfully, I fund my own projects with very little help. I believe that because I do that, it keeps my integrity as an artist because I am willing to risk funding my own projects.
COVID 19 in 2020 destroyed many musicians careers and this is my attempt to keep moving forward with as much steam as possible. Thank you.


Risks & Challenges
This has been a tough time for ALL musicians. Without moving forward and creating new music I fear that music, especially Indie Music will disappear completely. This is my way of moving my lifetime career foorward....THANK YOU ALL.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, please folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign and use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
To nurture Mother Earth. 
To recognize that all people deserve refuge and welcome, 
no matter how far from home they travel. 

These are the potent messages, carried in Bone Lhamo Kyap's ancestors' native tongue, a dying language, set in the ethnic music tradition of Northern China, that your donations will help the world to hear. 

Bone's music is born of passion and his commitment to healing; he asks you to do more than just listen. You have to feel.

This campaign begins with the funding of an album produced by Grammy-award winner Michael Starita but it is the launch of experiential music and performances the world over. 

Backers will be some of the first to hear Bone's album and to practice his message through yoga and live-experiences in the San Francisco Bay area and beyond. 

The time is now. 
Set his music in motion.

 

FROM THE ARTIST

 

"My name is Bone Lhamo Kyap. I come from the highland mountainous area of Northwest China, Gansu Province. I was raised by my Grandma. Her ancestors are an ancient ethnic tribe, called Sangemao, who live in the south of Gansu, Jone area. The spirit of the land and the soul of those people inspire me deeply, with the spirit of Mother Earth and the illumination of the Divine.  

I choose to sing in that ancient tribe's language as it will be soon become extinct. 

Music is what I can give.

It is the language that communicates deeply to all souls in life."

 

 

ABOUT THE JONE（CHONI）

SANGEMAO NATION

 

In 1928 the explorer Joseph Rock discovered the Jone. He wrote, 'I—in common with some 300 million Chinese and perhaps as many foreigners— was totally unaware of the existence of the Choni [Jone].' A more recent source explains, 'the people of this ancient tribe have their own way of life. Due to their complex tribal structure, their lifestyle, customs, housing and costumes are visibly different from those of most of the local nation, making them a unique branch. As the tribe's women sport a hair-do with three thick plaits, locals call them Sangemao 三格毛 in the local dialect, literally meaning "three bundles of hair".'

Bone grew up, as many of his peers in the modern generation, without much concern for the preservation of his ancestors' culture. Instead he looked to city life as a way of fulfilling his dreams of a new livelihood and a career in music. It wasn't until his mid twenties, his soul longing for authenticity, did he discover the truth of his root culture. Returning to his homeland, he spent many nights talking with his Grandmother and discovered a unique language she spoke in her youth but now is quickly being forgotten.

As only the elder generation speak this language... time is running out.

 

 

ABOUT BONE

 

Bone grew up in the Gannan highland of Northwest China between Tibet, Mongolia and the Huangtu high ground. He was raised by his grandmother in a rural community and although his family had limited resources and opportunities, his passion for music filled his mind with possibilities and his heart with dreams. He began singing at a young age and at thirteen was afforded the rare opportunity to play guitar when he was gifted an old hand-me-down by a relative. He spent the rest of his teenage years experimenting with music on his own and with the help of his step-father. 

At eighteen, Bone left his home in Gansu and moved to Shanghai with two of his hometown brothers. They shared a small space in the loft of an old lane house and began working in an electronics factory. Despite the hardships of his new life,  Bone’s vision remained set on his greater purpose for music. Later, he and one of his brothers found work in a Turkish restaurant and encountered foreigners for the first time. Bone began to learn English and changed jobs, next working as a bartender at live music bars and eventually as a salesman in music shops on Jinling Road. He started to perform and mingle with Shanghai's best foreign musicians. Recognizing his unique voice and powerful charisma, they instantly became his friends and mentors and continue to encourage him to this day. Bone’s music has evolved from performing Western cover songs to turning back to his roots, seeking an authentic sound and message that is healing for himself and anyone lucky enough to listen, while simultaneously preserving a dying cultural treasure passed to him from his earliest days in Gansu. Bone has been performing internationally since 2014 and his live music performances have become increasingly popular in Yoga Studios in Shanghai, China and now in California, in the San Francsisco Bay Area. 

 

https://www.bonelhamokyapmusic.com

 

"Bone is one of those artists who can immediately transport you to a different place.... who can pull you into the world his songs are painting. It's an amazing experience to work in the studio with him because there is this unspoken message and guidance that is being channelled through his songs which directs our every decision. It's much more than the notes played or the words sung....it cannot be explained with words. Bone has a gift."

- STARITA

 

 

THE PROJECT

 

This Indiegogo Campaign is the next step in Bone’s musical progression, launched with the goal of raising enough funds to record and produce a complete LP,  "When Mother Earth Cries," consisting of twelve tracks that will capture Bone's potent message and pure intention of preservation and connection. 

 

This project is much more than the recording and production itself - it is music in motion. This fundraising campaign kickstarts 90 days of performances and yoga with live music events to fully convey the power that drives the music through direct and intimate communication. Though the recordings are vital, in order to ultimately reach a greater world audience, Bone will be starting his outreach and engagement in the San Francisco Bay area. He is collaborating with his wife Laura and other talented and dedicated yoga instructors and yoga studios across the region.

 

 

THE SONGS

 

In 2016, Bone visited the the US for the first time with his wife Laura. They combined forces with Grammy record winning producer Michael Starita to record and produce two incredible songs that not only will appear on the final album, but also sparked the passion among all of the parties to continue to work together to create a complete album that fully captures all the facets of Bone’s voice and message.

 

Listen to the tracks:

 

 
Mother Earth is Crying is sung in Chinese Mandarin so that Bone's message can be understood by his Chinese audience. Having experienced first hand China's rapid urban development, his lyrics lament the dire situation our society faces today:  
 
"You obtained too much, what‘s left?... 
Her pain is becoming more and more, she is becoming less and less...
Oh, mama...
Last night I dreamed she will leave us soon..."
 
 
This Pitiful Life sung in his hometown dialect tells of Bone's first experience arriving in Shanghai as an ethnic minority with limited income. The melodies and lyrics of this song are inspired by the traditional 花儿 "Hu'aer" * songs of his homeland. Bone contemplates his "Pitiful Life" in Shanghai, homesick for his traditional food and grandmother's love, yet his message extends beyond... to embrace the humility of all who experience the cruelness of reality. 
 

"Under the bed is a bottle of nice drink...

but what I really miss is the "tieper" from home.

Even my shoes, already broken, many pairs broken, because I have walked for so long...

Nobody asks. Nobody cares. The tears just really hurt to swallow.

Hey...

This Pitiful Life."
 
*"In Gansu and Qinghai Provinces and throughout north-central China, people of nine different ethnic groups share a music tradition known as Huaer. The music is drawn from an extensive traditional repertoire named after ethnicities, towns or flowers (Tu Peoples ''ling,'' White Peony ''ling''), and lyrics are improvised in keeping with certain rules for example, verses have three, four, five or six lines, each made up of seven syllables. Songs may tell of young love, the hard work and weariness of the farming life, the foibles of men and women or the joy of singing. The songs are also a vivid oral record of recent social developments in China as singers comment on the changes they observe around them. Huaer singers may have little schooling, but the most successful and widely respected singers today have become household names, performing widely and even creating their own institutes to pass on their art to apprentices. Whether it is being sung spontaneously by rural people working in the field or travelling or performed more formally at one of more than a hundred traditional Huaer festivals held annually in these provinces, Huaer is an important vehicle for expressing personal feelings in a social setting and cultural exchange across ethnicities, as well as a popular rural entertainment. "
 
UNESCO: Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity -2009
 
 

The additional songs will be selected from compositions that Bone has already written and performed. The songs are sung in his grandmother's native tongue and also incorporate elements from the Native American traditions such as Navajo and Andes flutes.

The songs express deep affinity with the land and recall the traditional culture of Bone’s ancestors. Bone's most recent work transcends the hardships of his humble beginnings; the music he now performs evokes an expansive and uplifting tranquility that has yet to be fully captured by professional recordings. 

Bone and Starita work intuitively and passionately together and will complete a body of work that expresses the rich tapestry of Bone's sound, his pure intention to touch and inspire and his powerful, healing voice that echoes with his heritage and the diversity of his experiences.

 

"My intention is to connect with a greater universal spirit that can move and enliven listeners from all over the world."

- BONE

 

THE TEAM

 

 

PRODUCER

 

MICHAEL STARITA

 

 

STARITA IS A 2-TIME GRAMMY® RECOGNIZED ENGINEER/PRODUCER

He has worked with many top artists and musicians in the industry such as: A Tribe Called Quest, Phife Dawg, Childish Gambino, Michael Franti, Third Eye Blind, Los Amigos Invisibles, Rebelution and many more.

Starita is a yoga teacher and dedicated practitioner of Tibetan Buddhism. He is deeply connected with the spiritual and cultural aspects of Bones work. He has worked with other popular artists in the conscious musical community such as Trevor Hall and recently, his work with Laura Sullivan won the Grammy®for Best New Age Album.

 

http://staritasf.com

 

Starita will be working together with Bone to extract the essential message and potent sounds of his songs and adding modern elements such as synth, drums and harmonies in order to create an even more expansive yet accessible experience for listeners.  

Starita has a deep understanding of Bone's music and cultural heritage and their combined talents create a musical experience that is imbued with modern relevance while remaining true to Bone’s process and authentic to his roots.

 

MARKETING

 

KRISTA RIPMA 

 

 

ELEVATING BRANDS THROUGH CONSCIOUS BUSINESS & INTUITIVE MARKETING.

 

Krista is a brand and marketing expert, obsessed with conscious business and authentically connecting her clients with their audience. She is the co-founder of Authentic Audience, a full service marketing agency.

She has worked with notable artist, musician and yogi clients such as Trevor and Emory Hall, Yandara Yoga Institute, Debra Silverman Astrology, Ritual Hot Yoga, Susannah Freedman Yoga, Red Light Lit and most recently MC Yogi. 

 

https://www.authenticaudience.co

 

Krista and her business partner Clay Ripma with be working with Bone and his wife Laura to support, advise and manage the marketing of the project campaign as well final album launch. Their Authentic Marketing Program will take them through the fundraising and beyond...equipping them with the resources to raise not only funds but also awareness, build an authentic following and to develop a sustainable and profitable project with positive impact. They will guide Laura and Bone through the intricacies of Facebook and Instagram advertising in order to fully optimize their marketing and ad spend.

With Krista and Clay's support and expertise, Bone and Laura will be able to reach and impact a wide, global and authentic audience. 

 

 

THE BREAKDOWN

 

Production 10 x Songs x $1700 = $17,000

Session Players 10 x Songs x $500 = $5,500

7 Days of Recording = $7,000

7 Days Mixing = $5,500

Mastering = $500

Authentic Marketing Program = $4,000

Marketing Ad Spend = $1,500

Final Album Launch Venue Rental = $2,000

Indigogo Fees (5%) = $2,300

 

TOTAL = $45,300

 

Thank you for all of your love and support! 

If we exceed our fundraising goals, the additional funds will help support the final album launch and album tour. 

 

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

 

DONATE / SPONSOR / HOST / SHARE

 

 

DONATE

 

 We are so grateful for your contributions and we want to share with you our signature offerings. 

 

Donate $15 or more and receive the final digital recordings (including "Mother Earth is Crying" and this Pitiful Life").

In addition, Bone and Laura want to share with you their passion for yoga and music meditation by offering you the opportunity to meet them both and to experience Bone's healing music and spiritual wisdom in an intimate, private and personalized setting. 

 

* see the perks to the right of the campaign!

**or email contact@rigpaarts.com for more information!

 

SPONSOR

 

The mission of this project is not only to produce an album, it is to share Bone's pure passion for music and healing as well as his unique and distinctive hometown culture with you. 

 

Sponsor the costs of recording, marketing ad spend or production, and you will receive an incredible, once-in-a-lifetime experience, you will be gifted the opportunity to savor the music and the rich flavors of Bone's culture first hand. 

 

* see the perks to the right of the campaign!

**or email contact@rigpaarts.com for more information!

 

HOST

 

We want to spread Bone's healing music and powerful message to more people. His presence and his performances are unmistakably transformative. Host us as a way to support the campaign and help us to engage and impact a greater audience. 

 

Whether you have a large living room, a community hall, a corporate conference room, a yoga studio or an outdoor space suitable for an event or performance, we would love to collaborate with you for a Fundraiser Music Concert or Yoga with Live Music Event!

 

* email contact@rigpaarts.com for more details!

 

SHARE

 

The most powerful way you can help us is to GET THE WORD OUT!

to spread his healing music and powerful message 

 

ON SOCIAL MEDIA, VIA EMAIL, OR WORD OF MOUTH

 

* Click the links links at the top of this page to repost!

** email contact@rigpaarts.com for further images, videos and promotional material

story:
OVERVEIW

I’m Stephen Spender a Canadian indie folk singer songwriter currently working as a musician in London, England. 

 

I’ve written and released three albums Stephen Spender, Daylight Coming and Crowded Heart.  I’m really happy with these songs for the next album and I think it’s going to be a leap forward. The songs are about love and loss, the borders inside and outside ourselves…oh and Marlon Brando ( see video below). 

I’ve been fortunate to play all across Canada, England and Europe over the past few years. I’m planning a European tour in 2019 in support of this album and hopefully in Canada. 

Funding an album is challenging which is why I am asking for your support to produce this album to its highest quality and to get it out as soon as possible.

 

How you can get involved

So if you want to come on board and be a part of this exciting project there's a few options.

Pick your reward (to the right)

Contribute ( top right button)

Help spread the word ( check share buttons at the top )

 

WHAT WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS GO TOWARD?

 

 

Time’s ticking!  I only have 45 days to reach my $10,000 goal! It can be done! 

 

During this entire process I will be allotting funds to my recording musicians,  engineers, studio time, post production, T-shirt’s, printing CDs, album artwork  and rehearsals. I only have 45 days to reach my $10,000 goal! It can be done! 

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If it's not possible to financially contribute towards my campaign, no worries i get it. That being said, there are some things you can do that would make a huge difference and don't cost a thing.

It would be great if you could share my video or campaign through your social media ....you never know who's going to want to help and be a part of this project.

     

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign 

Any questions - please get in touch!

Stephen

story:
Hello, my name is Joe Belmont and I have made my living as a musician my whole life.  I started off as a self-taught guitarist (and songwriter). Later I took lessons and graduated from the City University of New York as a Music Composition major.  I've played in bands and studios in New York City where I grew up, then later moved to Massachusetts.  I’ve played in bands  with styles ranging from original Rock, Jazz-Fusion, Classical, South American, you name it.  We’ve toured, played gigs and recorded CD’s.  It’s been a good life!

I’ve got this great band now: The Joe Belmont Experience.  We’ve played maybe 60 times this past year and we have developed a real sound.  We’d like to record a first-class studio album/CD.  I feel like this album could be the culmination of my life’s experience as a musician and composer.

Money will be spent on:

-Recording at Rotary Records, West Springfield,MA-              $2,500

-Mixing and production.                                                                      $1,500

-Paying the musicians:                                                                        $2,500

-Graphics/Artwork.                                                                              $   500

-Manufacture CD copies :                                                                   $1,000

                                                                                                                      ————

                                                                                                                      $8,000

 There are some great perks available.  Depending on the contribution it’s possible to get signed copies of the CD, a concert played in your house or venue, or even being listed on the CD as executive producer!

I have had a lot of experience producing, recording, and managing CD projects.  I am looking forward to this one.  It should be great!

Your help with this project will be so greatly appreciated.

All the best, Joe

story:
Songbelly: The Concept

 

Meet Heather Blush (Hazlett): 

I am a singer/songwriter who has been recording and performing music for over 20 years.  I began my career as a music therapist and later launched a business as a music educator, teaching music to young children in daycares throughout the Calgary area, and hiring other music teachers to help as my business grew too big for me to handle by myself. This led naturally to forming a children's music duo, along with my husband and long-time musical collaborator Steve Hazlett, called Rattle and Strum (we have also performed together with Heather Blush and The Uppercuts for 16 years).  Over the years I have taught many songwriting workshops for children and adults, beginners to professionals, and I have written songs with and for people in therapy sessions, as education, and just for fun or personal growth.  And - I'm a mom to three kids.

I want to use my ability to express myself and help others express themselves through song and be able to provide that music in a physical format that is cherished  in this time where music is streamed rather than owned....

So What is Songbelly?

Songbelly is: personalized songs in adorable, handmade stuffed animals.  

Personalized songs: high-quality recorded songs with a personal message for the recipient that includes their name. Choose between three songs (so far) with inspiring messages and your chosen name inserted OR opt for the Deluxe or Ultimate package and receive a truly unique song with more personalized details.

Handmade stuffed animals: ADORABLE handmade in Canada plush animals. Choose from different animal options (teddy bear, penguin, etc.) and receive a one-of-a-kind stuffy to love! 

Why This is Important to Me:

As a mom, I value time and experiences over "stuff". I aspire toward fewer quality items that will be treasured for years in our household rather than large quantities of throw-away items.  So I want to offer a cherished keepsake rather than a toy that will be discarded after a few days of play.

As a musician, I value high-quality sound and music.  I want to offer music that will be enjoyed by all who experience it, adults and children alike, a song that you will want to hear over and over. 

As a music therapist and educator, I know the power that music has.  I want to use my expertise to offer impactful, inspiring messages of love and acceptance. 

What We Need & What You Get:

We are aiming to raise $12,000 in this month-long campaign.  This will allow us to complete research on the final touches, build up a supply of the materials needed, upgrade recording equipment, and invest in some marketing to build up a following.

You get: Songbelly Buddies! The first batch of up to 200 will be sent out by June of 2021.  We've included more fun options on the perks list, including printed frameable lyrics, a handwritten message from Heather, and even a personal Zoom concert for our biggest supporters! 

We also want your input! As this idea is still in the development stage, we want to update you on progress along the way and incorporate your feedback into the design.  

​What happens if the $12,000 goal is not reached?  We will still aim to send out your Songbelly Buddies by June of 2021.  We will adjust by waiting to invest in marketing and renting equipment instead of more long-term investment in recording supplies.  The business will grow more slowly, but we are still committed to making it happen. 

​What happens if you exceed the $12,000 goal?  This will help us grow more quickly, market to a larger audience, and maybe even start looking at expanding the product line - lots more ideas cooking up... 

The Impact: 

If you choose to invest in this start-up business you will be helping to:

Provide positive messages and high-quality music to our future generation.

Continue to develop this product and be able to ensure the highest quality sound. 

Support independent Canadian business. 

Support an artist in this challenging time when sales of music recordings are being replaced by streaming (with little to no money being directed back to the artists), and live performances have been put largely on hold due to the current Covid-19 crisis.

Aspirations and Challenges

This product is still in development, which means there are some challenges ahead, AND there is still room for some input to find out what you want.  

Some of the things that are in development: researching and sourcing the best speaker option to ensure a high-quality product; re-recording the original 3 song options and tweaking the process for personalization; ironing out the details of the stuffed animals: which types of animals to offer, final design features, etc. And of course, all along, ensuring that we meet or exceed safety standards.  

Some of the things we are aspiring towards in the future: sharing the love by being able to donate some of our products to children in need; offering more songs to choose from; expanding to include more products (got some fun ideas!); building up a compelling marketing campaign. 

I am happy to be working with a team of a few trusted people to conquer these challenges, meet our goals, and continue to progress.  And I wanted to introduce Songbelly here on Indiegogo while still in development in order to get YOUR input and keep you posted as it all develops. The most important goal is to make sure we provide what you want. 

Other Ways to Help:

There are lots of important ways to help out without investing money.  Your help in getting the word out is greatly appreciated! If you like what you see, please share with any and all you think may be interested:

Like and follow us on Facebook and Instagram: http://facebook.com/songbelly   http://instagram.com/songbellybuddies

Use #Songbelly if you post on social media. 

Send a message to heatherblushmusic@gmail.com if you have ideas or input you would like to share.

story:
An alternative/indie/neo psychedelic/rock/pop influenced band hailing from Corpus Christi, TX, Narjeetos have been carving their own path since their formation in the spring of 2019. The band consists of lead vocalist, songwriter, and guitarist RJ Ramon, drummer Johnny Peppercorn, bassist Joseph Soto, keyboardist Gary Graves, and, the newest addition, lead guitarist Jose Felix. With a sound that evokes a dreamy, clearly coastal induced haze, Narjeetos looks to expand and explore the magic of their sound while also striving to reach the hearts and minds of all who are willing to listen.

We're ready to release our first, full length, studio album!!!!!!!  With the album being filled with catchy, lustrous sounds the band is excited to share their art with their listeners. The album was recorded live over a September weekend at Sound Machine Studio in Skidmore, Texas by the talented Mason Shirley.

We appreciate the patience of our friends and fans since this has been long awaited, but with justified delay. We've been working hard to raise money to get the album out by playing as much as possible since inception, however we're still lacking the funds necessary to do so. We're creating this campaign to bring the community together in hopes to make this album a reality. If you like what we do, please consider pledging for a copy of the record or one of the other perks being offered. Every contribution, big or small, helps and is greatly appreciated!!!!!

______________________________________________________________________________

WHAT WE NEED:

Recording: $3,500 (PAID)

Mastering: $1,200

Vinyl Pressing: $1,500 (PAID)

Record Jackets: $600 (PAID)

AlbumArt: $500

We’ve invested a couple thousand of our own so far, so we’re going to set our goal to $1,500. If we surpass our goal, we’ll put that money towards hats/shirts and other fun items. ANYONE WHO DONATES $30 OR MORE WILL RECEIVE A COPY OF THE RECORD AND HAND-WRITTEN LYRICS.

story:
About Me​

Hey everyone! I’m Mark Ellis aka Fair Weather Son, a singer songwriter based in London. Through the years I have been a part of many bands, most notably Hamfatter who found fame on Dragons Den in 2008 and more recently Elma who have performed with the likes of Roy Wood, The Beta Band, and The Bible. Now comes the time to make something for myself and I need your help! The EP is called Dude Got Feelings and it’s exactly that, just a dude chewing the fat playing his guitar and letting it all out. The good news is it’s all recorded and digitally ready to go, so no matter what you pledge you will at least receive a digital copy of this EP. My hope is that with your help I can pay to get this musical piece of me promoted properly and when it’s safe get on the road to see you all, also VINYL! It’s a bucket list thing for me to have vinyl made so fingers crossed you can help me achieve that dream!

What I Need & What You Get

Alright then down to the nitty gritty! To fund this project and give the EP the chance I feel it deserves I'm hoping to raise £6800, here's the breakdown : 

That oh so beautiful vinyl : £1300. This gets me 300 units of 10" vinyl, perfect for my 6 track EP and a life long dream achieved! 

PR : £2500. Working with PR companies is still absolutely vital for getting your music heard and I'm hoping this budget will help me make a big impact on the alternative scene! My friend James Parish runs Prescription PR and their latest claim to fame was helping the rise of IDLES and has always said the moment I need him to do represent me he'll be there.  

Tour Management : £2000. Tour management is the vital next step once people start reading about and listening to the EP it's vital I take a band and play some shows.  I have someone specific in mind who runs a company called Blue House Music, I've known James the head of the company for a long time and he's someone I trust deeply! 

Video Recoup : £1000. It is absolutely true that Jonnie animated a music video for me just because he loved my song "This Thing Is Better" that much, but I wouldn't be a very good human if I didn't try and pay back that kindness and I'd love for Jonnie to create another two videos and create a story through them and through the EP as a result. 

Perks for you depending on your contribution could include signed vinyl, signed digital artwork from Jonnie, live Zoom shows, Q&A with myself and Jonnie, a concert at your house, or a full access all areas and have dinner with the band experience. Pretty much whatever you want... I'll do it! 

If I don't manage to raise the full budget there are of course other options regarding the PR and Tour management, I am shooting for the stars here but you've got to dream right?

Vinyl : There's not much wiggle room here, making vinyl is an expensive thing and when I asked for quotes they all say minimum order is 300! 

PR : I have had success with Piranha PR on past projects, they helped Elma achieve radio play on BBC 6 and I know they would give their all again but I feel that Prescription is a better fit for this music which is why I've chosen them. 

Tour management : The worst case scenario I could of course book the shows myself and I'm certainly not work shy. However, having someone represent you can get you into better venues and even opening up for bigger acts which would provide huge exposure and a great opportunity to sell merch and keep this dream alive! 

Jonnies video : Jonnie and the video aren't going anywhere and it's developed a beautiful friendship. I can always buy him coffee for the rest of our lives as a thank you, I just feel that his work should be valued and hopefully you can all help me do that ! 

The Impact

This for me is about more than just the EP, it's part of my journey as a musician and as a person. As I mentioned in my video I've had success in the past with Hamfatter and Elma and I've written and toured with other musicians all throughout the UK and Europe but now it's time for me to be me. During 2020 I had to lean on myself, focus on my writing and find a way to survive. This EP is a result of all that writing and development and I can't wait to have the chance to put myself out there and grow in confidence in myself and my music. 

Risks & Challenges

Of course the music industry is an incredibly hard place to carve out a living and I'm no stranger to what happens when things go wrong. That said through my 20 years of performing and building relationships all over the UK by hook or by crook I know that for me where there's a will there's a way. I'm very lucky with connections that I've made and I intend to use them fully! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you really like what you've heard either musically or through me rambling but can't afford to contribute then please don't worry. I would however love if you could share this campaign on your socials and help me reach as many people as possible! 

 

If you've made it this far down and read every word then thank you so much, just for your time in investigating my plans and my story I'm incredibly grateful! 

All the best, 

Mark xxx

Vinyl : There's not much wiggle room here, making vinyl is an expensive thing and when I asked for quotes they all say minimum order is 300! 
PR : I have had success with Piranha PR on past projects, they helped Elma achieve radio play on BBC 6 and I know they would give their all again but I feel that Prescription is a better fit for this music which is why I've chosen them. 
Tour management : The worst case scenario I could of course book the shows myself and I'm certainly not work shy. However, having someone represent you can get you into better venues and even opening up for bigger acts which would provide huge exposure and a great opportunity to sell merch and keep this dream alive! 
Jonnies video : Jonnie and the video aren't going anywhere and it's developed a beautiful friendship. I can always buy him coffee for the rest of our lives as a thank you, I just feel that his work should be valued and hopefully you can all help me do that ! 

The Impact
This for me is about more than just the EP, it's part of my journey as a musician and as a person. As I mentioned in my video I've had success in the past with Hamfatter and Elma and I've written and toured with other musicians all throughout the UK and Europe but now it's time for me to be me. During 2020 I had to lean on myself, focus on my writing and find a way to survive. This EP is a result of all that writing and development and I can't wait to have the chance to put myself out there and grow in confidence in myself and my music. 

Risks & Challenges
Of course the music industry is an incredibly hard place to carve out a living and I'm no stranger to what happens when things go wrong. That said through my 20 years of performing and building relationships all over the UK by hook or by crook I know that for me where there's a will there's a way. I'm very lucky with connections that I've made and I intend to use them fully! 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you really like what you've heard either musically or through me rambling but can't afford to contribute then please don't worry. I would however love if you could share this campaign on your socials and help me reach as many people as possible! 
 
If you've made it this far down and read every word then thank you so much, just for your time in investigating my plans and my story I'm incredibly grateful! 
All the best, 
Mark xxx

story:
cAbiners

We are a folk duo from Northern Ontario. We've been performing together since 2017, from festivals, bars, weddings, bonfires to special events and private functions. We released our first album in 2018 and is available on all digital platforms. "wAiting for you" was an album with a mix of covers and originals. It was recorded fairly quickly and served us well, but we are now ready and excited to work on our second album!

We need your help to make this happen! Obviously, things have changed a lot for everyone, and it's been even more difficult now for the entertainment industry, so your help is even more important than ever! 

We've been writing tons of songs that we're super excited about, and this next album will help us reach a new level in our musical career. We'll be working with a team of industry professionals on this one so it's really important that we have all the support possible.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping to raise 5000$. This will help pay studio costs, mixing, mastering, CD design and printing! It's a big amount and that's why we need your help! We're turning to you friends and supporters to help us achieve this goal of ours and get us to the next level!

We've put together some really fun perks (like signed CD's, sneak peaks, swag bags, virtual concerts and live performances), so check them out and choose what excites you the most! Please donate if it's financially possible for you, and know that every contribution regardless of size is a huge help and so greatly appreciated! 

If we don't reach the full amount, we will still record this album, we're way too excited about these songs and we're really passionate about this project. It will affect our timeline and we may have to make some compromises on things, so the closer we get to the goal the better for sure!

Impact

It's because of all of you that we got to do our first album, and so we are asking your help to do it again! This would mean so much to us and would be a huge step in a new direction. It's also been really tough not playing live shows because of this pandemic, so this will give us something to work towards and to keep us motivated and driven.

 

Risks & Challenges

Recording and releasing an album takes a lot of work, coordination, time and energy. That's a challenge in itself, but add to that this pandemic which makes everything even more complicated! So we expect additional and unexpected challenges but we are up to the task, and with your help and support, it'll give us the strength to make this all happen. With all these challenges, it's hard to give an exact date for when the album will be finished, so we're using the date of Jan 2021 for the perks, but we'll have to update it as we go.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If it's not possible for you to contribute financially at this time, please help us by sharing this campaign. Please also share it if you can contribute as well! Our community is pretty amazing and we feel so lucky to have you guys. We already have so many great supporters and sharers, but without being able to play live, it's difficult to gain new ones. So any help in sharing this campaign will be huge.

Let's do this!! You guys are the best!!!
