story:
My gift to you...

Hey! Just for taking the time to check out this campaign, I want to share with you the first single on my EP before it’s released on all platforms. Think of it as a little music hug from me to you. Feel free to access and download 'Wounds' here.

Who am I?

My name is Samuel, U.S. born and raised, and I've been writing songs and singing ever since my parents got me an acoustic guitar for Christmas when I was 9 years old. I grew up in Wisconsin for most of my life, but a few years ago, I moved to Amsterdam, where my journey has truly begun as an independent musician. Music is everything to me, it heals me and keeps me balanced in life, and it's served as a beautiful tool that teaches me more about myself every single day. Everything that I write, I write with the purpose of allowing myself and others to reflect on their own lives and hope that in turn we all find ourselves on the path to continued learning and healing. Each and every one of you deserves to live happy and healthy lives, and I feel blessed to be able to share my music with the world.

EP 'Oxytocin'

While writing and recording the songs for EP 'Oxytocin', it was a time in my life when I was reflecting a lot on my past relationships. I wanted to channel those feelings of nostalgia, regret, and longing into something that not only many of us can relate to, but also something that can help other people on their journeys of relationship healing and self-love.

You see, our love life is constantly evolving. Through the ups and downs, I realized we all crave that warm and fuzzy feeling when your crush makes you laugh. Or that feeling of comfort when you fall asleep in the arms of someone you love. Those “too good to be true” feelings are all thanks to a little hormone called oxytocin. Some even refer to it as the ‘love hormone.’ Regardless of your relationship status, we all need a healthy dose of it. Especially after a year of continuous isolation for many people.


Together with my producer, we wanted to create an EP that is healing, and that truly makes you feel comforted when you listen to it. Kind of like getting your daily dose of oxytocin.

This will be my 3rd EP released to date, consisting of 6 songs that were recorded over the course of 2 months, in a studio in the Canary Islands where my producer and I were temporarily living.

Fun fact: With so much more time at home this past year, we thought it would be fun to record and incorporate actual sounds in each song using home supplies like cutting boards, knives, pots, pans, water bottles, + some sounds from the island itself. Can you pick them out?

Your Support

Even by donating a few euro to the campaign, you'll be helping me so much to finalize the overall creation of the EP. That way, it can be released on all platforms at the end of spring. If the end goal of €2,809 is not reached, we may not be able to release the EP in its entirety. Below you can find all costs broken down in further detail:

-Production of 6 songs: €1,300 (approx. €230 per song)

-Mixing & Mastering of 6 songs: €1200 (approx. €200 per song)

-EP album artwork + 2 singles artwork: €309

Total Costs for EP: €2,809

 

THINGS TO FINALIZE

All 6 songs have been written and recorded. They have already been birthed which is beautiful to see!

The only challenge at the moment would be to raise enough funds to finalize the production, mixing, and mastering of each song.

I have a small team of 2 sound engineers, a super talented graphic designer, and 6 years+ of my own experience with digital marketing to finalize EP 'Oxytocin' and release it for the world to hear. Exciting things are coming, and I would love for you to join me on the journey!

Love and light,

-Samuel

story:
Look for "Add-on" Perk options at checkout:

Welcome to our IndieGoGo Campaign!

Our band, Outer Park, is looking for your involvement in completing our second album.

In our pitch video above, we tell you a lot about ourselves and our project, explain why we're seeking sponsors, and even let you hear some sneak-peek snippets of our new music.

Here's the short version:

  • On our first record, “1968 (slight return),” we captured the vibrant collision of styles and genres that was Underground Radio...
  • ... and took it even further, mashing them up and overlapping them and updating them, drawing on musical and life experiences from the past 50 years.
  • Now we're back, to take it to the next level on "Whole Lotta Orange."
  • The work is nearly complete, but in order to get it done well, and dancing around in as many people's heads as possible, we need you!

Please read on for more details - and more things you can do to help.

About this Campaign

Why are we asking for money?

First, we want to engage as many listeners as possible, even inviting you into the virtual sound-booth before we press DONE. We do this for the love of the music, and for the love of sharing our sounds with others.

And second, we want to keep doing this. Even in the age of home studios and digital distribution, quality comes at a cost.  For example, some of the things that still require real money include:

  • A studio and engineer to record most of the music
  • An engineer to mix and master the final results
  • Session fees for the professional musicians in our midst
  • Travel expenses to gather our far-flung band members in New Orleans
  • Licensing fees to use other people’s music (to the songwriters and their publishers, e.g. Joni Mitchell, Patty Griffin, Imogen Heap, and Buffy Saint-Marie)
  • Fees to get distribution on all the streaming and digital download sites
  • Fees for web site design, hosting, and social media advertising
  • Costs of promoting the final product, to get more listeners around the world

In addition, we are hoping to find ways to continue our collaborations, pandemic or no, for years to come. And for that, we need to make these projects both financially sustainable and artistically satisfying. Sustainability is about covering costs, not making a living. Satisfaction is about making great quality recordings AND getting them heard by others who will love them.

With your funds, we can cover our costs and continue to make new good records every year. It's as simple as that!

About Outer Park

Outer Park consists of lead vocalist Chelsea Austin, guitarist Patrick S. Noonan, keyboardist & guitarist Charles Tobermann, and bass player James Singleton. We've had the great privilege of Jason Marsalis providing the drums on both our albums, plus some equally wonderful guest artists. Patrick, James and Charles go way back - they played their first gig together as pre-teens in 1968, in fact - and the band's culture is a multi-generational mashup and remix of underground radio and new sounds.

Our band has always been somewhat virtual - Chelsea and Patrick live in Atlanta, James and Jason are deeply rooted in New Orleans, and Charles lives in *old* Orleans, that is, in France. But we discovered that by gathering in NOLA's beautiful Esplanade Studio for a few days each year, we could bottle an energy and immediacy and spontaneity that could light up a city.

In our October 2019 sessions back at Esplanade, we bottled a lot of new magic. Since then, we've been using our isolation time in our own studios, adding and tweaking and experimenting with the possibilities.

Being an Outer Park Sponsor

We're offering you all sorts of perks: copies of our new record, "Whole Lotta Orange," in whatever form you prefer, exclusive previews, and other exclusive experiences (including virtual club shows and even private event performances). Be sure to look for more "add on" options at checkout!

However, we are hoping you consider this a sponsorship of our musical journey, and the way of spreading some musical joy out into the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course we'd love for you to contribute something during this campaign, so you get be among the first to hear the next record (and get other perks). But even if you can't, there are some things you can do to help support Outer Park (as well as learn about performances, music releases, new videos, etc.)

For example:

  • Share our campaign page with friends and family. (Look for the Share buttons at the top of this campaign page.)
  • Subscribe to our YouTube channel, watch some of our music videos, and share with others.
  • Follow us on Facebook, and invite your friends to do the same.
  • Buy our 1st album, "1968 (slight return)" on Apple Music/iTunes, Amazon Music, at BandCamp, and all major digital sites. (On some of those sites, you also can gift a copy to others.)
  • Stream our 1st album on Spotify or other streaming sites, add it to a playlist, and share it with others.
  • Bookmark our website, and learn more about the artists collective behind the Wild Orchard Record Company label.

  • If you're a music reviewer or promoter, we would love to do some interviews! Please send a message to outerpark1968@gmail.com with the subject line: "Interview" 

 

Thank you for visiting our project. We hope you'll contribute to "Whole Lotta Orange," that you'll enjoy every listen, and that we can bring you more new songs every year!

A Look Back: Examples from our First Album

Until the new album is complete, please enjoy some music and videos from "1968 (slight return)," via our YouTube channel.

story:
Welcome!

My name is Steve Trowbridge and I have been a musician most of my life. I've played in several bands and ensembles, toured the country, and been apart of some amazing projects. Now I'm ready to show everyone what I've got on my own! I have many songs ready to go, but making a quality record takes quality gear, time, traveling, and the services of others. Thus, I made this campaign to try and fund the project.

My new project is called "middleking" and is in a rock band format, but is fully written and performed by myself on recordings - every instrument. (There will be a band for live settings). I have been able to record and release one song through Fourth Sunday Music Co., an Indianapolis based organization that I was lucky enough to team up with for a compilation of local artists recently. Now, though, I am ready to make a whole album. Here is my song if you'd like to check it out and hear what this project will generally sound like:

https://youtu.be/q06mwX67S3k

 

I have set the goal for this campaign to $5,000 because that is the minimum amount that it will take to acquire the appropriate music and recording gear, pay for the recording engineer, artwork, travel expenses to Indianapolis where it will be recorded, to have the album released on streaming platforms, and to have 300 vinyl copies of the album pressed. 

If we can meet that goal, I will deliver an excellent project with great gifts to those who donate! I anticipate this album to be done and released by this next summer, 2021. 

 

If you donate to this campaign, here is what you can expect if the goal is met: 

- $15 and above donation: a digital copy of the album upon completion 

- $30 and above: a digital copy of the album and a physical vinyl record

- $50 and above: digital album, vinyl record, an advanced free download of the Christmas single I will be recording, and a personal thank you note in the mail

- $100 and above: digital album, vinyl record, Christmas single, thank you note via mail, listed in the liner notes of the album as a contributor, and a free ticket to the album release concert in Indianapolis (Covid allowing). 

 

If you are at or above the $30 donation mark, please make sure to send me your mailing address! I will be unable to send the record or thank you notes without it. 

Thank you so much for visiting my campaign!

story:
Hi lovers,

Heidi Anne here, singer-songwriter. I've been doing this about 11 years now and after spending time abroad - I have decided to work on a brand new album.

This will be my first proper album as a solo artist, therefore it's very important to me, I dedicated my time wisely during lockdown to songwriting and arranging, recording and collaborating with producers - and you'll be pleased to know 6 songs are already recorded :)

Will you join me? I am overwhelmed with the support I receive from my fans therefore I just want to keep making more and more music for you to enjoy.

This is not something I am randomly doing, but something I want to be proud to look back on when old and grey and saying 'look, i did that!' (or we did).

Some of you may know, I am also a fulltime healthcare worker, giving to the community is important to me, but following my dreams is too.

Partner with me on this campaign - rewards will be issued for your kindness too ;)

What We Need & What You Get

  • As you probably know, my niche is Soulful R&B infused Pop Music - so this album aims to reflect this perfectly. Emotion in singing and writing is my main goal.
  • I've calculated I will need at least £10,000 to pay for recording services, music production services, mixing, mastering, artwork, merch, videos, marketing, and really try to do things properly as an independent artist.
  • Exclusive T-Shirts, Pre-orders, CD's, Posters, Exclusive material, shout-outs and more, will be available to all of you.

The Impact

  • My music style and vocal is a unique niche, and if you follow me, you hopefully want more. We each have a calling, and this is mine so please help me change the world for the better. When music literally moves people so much that they have tears in their eyes, that's what we want - overwhelming emotion & passion.
  • This will be the first independent step I've taken, but with your help more will follow.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal with contributions, I will continue with my efforts but it will take me longer.

Risks & Challenges

This is something new to me - but I like new, and I wouldn't trust anyone more than you guys to share this journey with me.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a financial contribution, you can always help me by sharing this fundraising video to others who might want to explore my work through contributing to a copy of my CD.

    •    You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Hi lovers,
Heidi Anne here, singer-songwriter. I've been doing this about 11 years now and after spending time abroad - I have decided to work on a brand new album.
This will be my first proper album as a solo artist, therefore it's very important to me, I dedicated my time wisely during lockdown to songwriting and arranging, recording and collaborating with producers - and you'll be pleased to know 6 songs are already recorded :)
Will you join me? I am overwhelmed with the support I receive from my fans therefore I just want to keep making more and more music for you to enjoy.
This is not something I am randomly doing, but something I want to be proud to look back on when old and grey and saying 'look, i did that!' (or we did).
Some of you may know, I am also a fulltime healthcare worker, giving to the community is important to me, but following my dreams is too.
Partner with me on this campaign - rewards will be issued for your kindness too ;)

What We Need & What You Get

As you probably know, my niche is Soulful R&B infused Pop Music - so this album aims to reflect this perfectly. Emotion in singing and writing is my main goal.
I've calculated I will need at least £10,000 to pay for recording services, music production services, mixing, mastering, artwork, merch, videos, marketing, and really try to do things properly as an independent artist.
Exclusive T-Shirts, Pre-orders, CD's, Posters, Exclusive material, shout-outs and more, will be available to all of you.


The Impact

My music style and vocal is a unique niche, and if you follow me, you hopefully want more. We each have a calling, and this is mine so please help me change the world for the better. When music literally moves people so much that they have tears in their eyes, that's what we want - overwhelming emotion & passion.
This will be the first independent step I've taken, but with your help more will follow.
If I don't reach my entire goal with contributions, I will continue with my efforts but it will take me longer.


Risks & Challenges
This is something new to me - but I like new, and I wouldn't trust anyone more than you guys to share this journey with me.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't make a financial contribution, you can always help me by sharing this fundraising video to others who might want to explore my work through contributing to a copy of my CD.
    •    You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hey, Matt Brooker here!

For those of you who don’t know me, I am a classically trained musician that has recently set my sights on becoming a professional jazz singer. Relatively new to Atlanta, GA, I have lived here somewhere around 4 years. In 2017 I was introduced to the Piano Bar at Campagnolo (campagnoloatl.com) and began my adventures singing publicly on a regular basis and really finding my voice. Soon after, in 2018, I performed in shows at a local venue, TEN Atlanta, with Robert Ray (the Piano Bar player) and then started my own gig at Olive Bistro, singing every Sunday. 

Fast forward to March of 2020.  The pandemic seemed to take all of that momentum from me overnight. I couldn't really find my voice singing on livestream and, of course, I couldn't sing anywhere publicly, which affected me in ways I wasn’t ready for. I took it in stride, remembering that over the past year each and every person on earth has been affected by the global outbreak... and that just blows my mind. I know that this has had a personal impact on every single one of my friends, and especially the relationships between them.

As the world is coming out of lockdown, I have decided that now is the time to write my first album. I have learned so much about myself and my relationships with friends and family, and I know there are even more stories that will inspire my music. I need to reconnect with my circle of people and really find out what they went through and what their perspective is. 

I have asked friends and family to share their stories with me through a video diary, and I want people to find strength in sharing their truths. Some of these stories will be a part of a series called Pandemic Perspectives. I will then create new music and curate an album that includes the inspiration I find resonating in their stories.

People Being People. 

The reason I created this Indiegogo Campaign is simple: recording an album is expensive. Now, I have been able to make a down payment to get the ball rolling, but I have quite a ways to go. I am only asking for donations from those who feel comfortable doing so, knowing that everyone in my circle has been affected in different ways.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $12,000 to complete the funding for the album. This will cover the cost of the following:

• Professional music charts to accompany the songs I will write for this album

• The musicians, piano, bass, drums, as well as a few colorful moments with sax, strings and backup vocals. This includes recording time and rehearsal time!

• Three days at an award winning recording studio (800east.com)

• Our amazing Producer for this project (Dunlop Productions)

• Sound Engineers 

• Professionally video taped portions of the recording process

• Album Cover Photography

• CDs to be made for distribution 

Donation Gift Levels:

$25 - Digital Download of the Newly Released Album

$50 - Digital Download, a CD and a Signed Copy of the album Artwork

$100 - Digital Download, a CD, a Signed Copy of the album Artwork and a Custom 

Happy Birthday Video within one year of project completion

$250 - I will come and sing Happy Birthday for your event!  Or, if you are not within a 

local travel radius, I will livestream my performance via your preference of video 

call.

$500 - A one hour Live Performance at your venue with professional Tracks (just like 

Sundays at Olive Bistro!)

$1,000 - I will come to your event and give a 3-hour performance with live music (piano)

 

*All Donations over $100 receive a VIP pass to the Album Launch Party! This includes access to the VIP Bar (shorter lines!) as well as the FREE Signature Cocktail!

story:
Heartsick Family...

We Need You More Than Ever!

You have supported us in so many ways over the years and we come to you once again, humbly seeking your assistance.

We all know that the last year, plus, has been incredibly difficult for so many and Heartsick has done our best to keep pushing. Unfortunately, the band has gotten to a place where we are struggling financially. The inability to play and sell merch has significantly depleted our accounts, and we are operating on basically zero funds at this point.

Instead of asking for donations and not offering anything in return, but our thanks. We have decided to offer several items from our current merchandise, a collection of items from the past, various experiences to be had with us, and we even cleaned out our closet and found a bunch of KNOW LYFE items that we are ready to part with in order to keep growing.

The funds we obtain from this campaign will help Heartsick get back on the road, re-stock our merchandise, and allow us to get more music out to all of you.

What We Need:

Transport Repair:
The van and trailer are in need of several repairs (Trailer Axle, Trailer Tires,
Exhaust Manifold repair, A/C repair, Brakes/Rotors, and the usual upkeep). 
We typically have "emergency" funds set aside for repairs and reserve gas money just in case a tour stop doesn't pan out, but those funds are just not there at this time.

Merchandise:
In order for an independent band to make funds, we have to sell merchandise. This also means that we need to have stock of our selections and reasonable amount of offerings. This campaign could allow us to restock and get back to normal operating capacity

The Music:
We have a lot of cool things in the works and a lot of new material waiting, but without the proper funds, we are unable to move forward on these plans and songs. This campaign goal will provide us the ability to keep moving forward and get more music out to the world.

 

We can not express how grateful we are to have all of you in our corner
 
Love,

Alfonso
Waylon
Jake
Jerred

story:
"Slow down hotshot, tell me about yourself first."

You got it! My name is Spence Hood and I'm a singer-songwriter here in Seattle, WA.  6 months ago I made the heart-pounding decision to move to this good-looking, pine-smelling city with a guitar, a piano, and a pipe dream - to become one of the world's most beloved musical performers.  My style's been described as acoustic pop with flares of jazz and R&B (think Jason Mraz, John Mayer, a little Nat King Cole when I'm feeling dirty) and things have been rockin' here so far!  Between opening for a myriad of acts coming through Seattle and downing bowls of rice & beans (we're on a budget here people) I'm happy to say that my stage reputation is building up, slowly but surely.  I released my debut EP back in February which was a holler and half to make, and have spent every week since then reading through feedback from my fans and finessing the pieces for this next project.  Fast forward to today, and the songs are ready, the producer is on board, the Spence is caffeinated: go time.    

 

"Alright kid, gimme the numbers."

You may be thinking, "why such a fat price tag for just 4 songs?"  Great question - that's because I've got the honor of working with the esteemed Robert L. Smith this time around.  Give him a quick Google and you'll see that he's a past Emmy nominee, has worked on several Billboard charting songs, and (most importantly) treats the craft of music production with the utmost respect and patience.

For those of you who are curious, the song-making process looks a little something like this:

  • Spence makes demos for each of the 4 songs (basically a proof of concept to give the producer an idea of the grand vision)
  • The producer helps Spence record the vocals and base instrumentals for each song, then (quite literally) produces all of the background instruments, sound effects, and other shiny things that really bring the songs to life.
  • Each song is then mixed and mastered, which is essentially a process of fine-tuning the volume and arrangement of ever layer of the song so that they all play nicely together, turning the piece into a nicely packaged, fan-ready product.
  • Spence releases the EP worldwide on all of the major streaming services (Spotify, iTunes, Amazon, YouTube, and the like).
  • Spence opens for Ed Sheeran, forms lifelong friendship, Nobel Peace Prize somewhere along the way probably, etc.

100% of the total $12k I'm aiming for will go to Robert's studio for his work on the songs ($3,000 per song x 4 songs), and any additional funds will be used to help market the finished EP, as well as helping me fulfill all your rewards!

 

"Enough jib-jab, what's in it for me?"

So glad you asked - I freaking love giving rewards, and I've got some cool ones for you.  I'm talking stickers, posters, customized video covers, behind-the-scenes footage, surprises in the mail, early demos of my songs, even live performances.  I don't ask for handouts lightly, and when I do, I'm gonna hand you back something radical.

 

"This really means a lot to you, doesn't it pal?"

You bet your bonnet it does.  Your contribution is more than just the money—it's your way of saying "I give a dang about art and the people who dig deep in order to make it.  I happen to like the fact that I can hop on my phone and see an endless collection of musical expression at my fingertips.  I want to keep living in this beautiful, creative world, and I'm ready to show it."

My promise to you is to deliver music that comes from the most protected recesses of my soul.  I will put out a collection of songs with as much authenticity and majesty as I can muster, because my fans deserve no less.

 

"What if I just wanna be a sweetheart and toss a few bucks your way?"

Well first off, I love you, and second off, there's a way to do that! Donations of any amount can be sent to me via Venmo at @Spencehood, or via PayPal at spencehoodnow@gmail.com.

 

"Any other ways I can help?"

Some folks just can't contribute (trust me, I get it) but that doesn't mean you can't help!  It's free to share this campaign with your friends, and Indiegogo has some super simple tools to help you do so.  Even if you just mention to your buddies at the bar that you found some charming, muscular, suave guy on that one crowdfunding site who's making some cool stuff, that would mean a lot to me.

I'll also be sharing bits and pieces of the EP-making process on my social media channels, so you can always follow me to see what's cooking:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/spencetunes

Facebook: https://www.fb.com/spencehood

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/53rFq0qyTvcEBea...

Website: http://spencehood.com/

 

Thank you so much for reading through all of this, and gimme a virtual *high five* for taking your seat on this rocket ship—let's have one heck of a ride.

Thank you so much for reading through all of this, and gimme a virtual *high five* for taking your seat on this rocket ship—let's have one heck of a ride.

story:
DTW has an amazing opportunity to be part of Noche de Altares in Santa Ana, California. Noche de Altares is a Mexican Holiday held from October 31st - November 2nd in celebration of Day of the Dead, which has its roots in the traditions of Indigenous cultures such as the Aztec, Toltec, and Nahuatl. During this holiday people build altars containing the pictures and  various belongings of the deceased person in order for their souls to return to our world so they can visit their family once again in celebration of both life and death. This is a wonderful and meaningful tradition, one that dates back over 3000 years in Mexican history.

In addition to the traditional celebration of the holiday, the Santa Ana Community throws public concert in the streets of downtown. Artists, vendors, musicians, and other sects of the community gather together to celebrate family, art, music, and togetherness. Our musical brothers from Salvajes, a Santa Ana-based Hip-Hop group, have invited DTW to California to be part this event so we can share our music, as well as our own culture and values, with a new audience. As Freddy touches on in the video, transporting an 11-piece band 1800 miles with a truckload of gear can quickly become an expensive endeavor, which is exactly why we are asking for your help. Any, we repeat, ANY, donation you can make, big or small, will help us make this great opportunity a reality! We are stoked for a chance to get out of the Willamette Valley and share our music at this culturally significant event!

Your money is going to go directly to our travel expenses which will include, but are not limited to: gas, food, lodging, and any vehicle maintenance that might occur on the trip. Money will also be used to support video and social media so we can document and send updates throughout the trip.

By helping us fund our travels to Santa Ana, you are giving us an opportunity, one that we wouldn’t have otherwise, to share our music with new people at a culturally significant event. One of our missions as a band is to tear down cultural and racial divides and unite cultures and generations through the power of Funk, Hip Hop, and Love, and this may be more important right NOW than in recent history. Noche de Altares is beautiful opportunity to further this mission, we are deeply honored to have been invited, and we look forward to hitting the big stage in November!

story:
THE PROJECT

This campaign will fund the release of my first full-length studio album Elevate. It's time to bring this music to life, but I still need your help to do it! 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

I invite you to support this project by pre-ordering the album now. I know you'd be quick to snag a copy of the album anyway once it's released, but by pre-ordering through this online campaign, you'll gain access to exclusive offers and merchandise.  Plus, you'll be my new best friend.

EXPENSES

The expenses associated with creating a full-length studio album can add up pretty quickly. Up to this point, this project has been completely self-funded. 

But here's the good news: this album is already finished.

The goods and services that were required to make this album vary. Here's a general breakdown on where your contribution goes in helping me recoup some of these expenses:

  • Production: $850 per song
  • Mastering: $150 per song
  • Other musicians performing on record: $100 - $300 per song
  • Digital Distribution on Spotify, iTunes etc: $50 per song
  • CD Manufacturing: $350 per 100 CDs

This being a full-length album (8 songs), total expenses for this album reach approximately $10,000 (all paid within a one year timespan).

Proudly, this record was made here in Columbus, OH and features the hard work of local artists, engineers and producers. By supporting the making and release of this record, you're not only supporting me but everyone who helped make this album a possibility. Not to mention, your local music community as a whole.

THE PERKS

This is what's called a "flexible funding" campaign, meaning that I will be able to use whatever money I'm able to raise through this crowdfunding platform IndieGogo. Even in the event that I am unable to reach my goal, I'll be able to keep the profits and use it toward the release of this album and beyond.

Regardless of the final outcome, I am offering a variety of perks with your pre-order contribution to anyone who donates their hard earned money to this project. These include apparel, accessories, private concerts and more!

You can contribute by selecting a perk and continuing through the checkout process. You can also contribute any amount without selecting a perk. Multiple perks can be purchased in separate transactions. 

Here are a few of the exclusive items I'm offering--

  • Handmade t-shirts (design by Merchly)

​

  • Custom stickers (design by Sticker Giant)

​

  • Your very own handwritten & signed copy of my complete song lyrics feautured on the album with illustrations 
  • Private concerts! You've been thinking about having me out for a private concert-- pull the trigger now, and get some great extras with your very own house show!
  • Your name mentioned in the liner notes/digital booklet for the album as a personal "thank you" to my closest supporters

If you don't see a perk you'd like and would like to suggest one, email me at jthilliermusic@gmail.com and I'll see what I can do! I may add some surprise one-of-a-kind perks along the way. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

I understand you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are some other ways to help: 

  • Use Indiegogo's share tools to share this campaign on social media. Use the hashtag #jthilliermusic
  • Send a text or email your friends and others with a link to this campaign 
  • Repeat! News feed items are ephemeral. Repetition is a necessity!

Thank you, thank you, thank you.  - JTH
story_txt:
THE PROJECT
This campaign will fund the release of my first full-length studio album Elevate. It's time to bring this music to life, but I still need your help to do it! 

HOW YOU CAN HELP
I invite you to support this project by pre-ordering the album now. I know you'd be quick to snag a copy of the album anyway once it's released, but by pre-ordering through this online campaign, you'll gain access to exclusive offers and merchandise.  Plus, you'll be my new best friend.

EXPENSES
The expenses associated with creating a full-length studio album can add up pretty quickly. Up to this point, this project has been completely self-funded. 
But here's the good news: this album is already finished.

The goods and services that were required to make this album vary. Here's a general breakdown on where your contribution goes in helping me recoup some of these expenses:

Production: $850 per song
Mastering: $150 per song
Other musicians performing on record: $100 - $300 per song
Digital Distribution on Spotify, iTunes etc: $50 per song
CD Manufacturing: $350 per 100 CDs

This being a full-length album (8 songs), total expenses for this album reach approximately $10,000 (all paid within a one year timespan).
Proudly, this record was made here in Columbus, OH and features the hard work of local artists, engineers and producers. By supporting the making and release of this record, you're not only supporting me but everyone who helped make this album a possibility. Not to mention, your local music community as a whole.

THE PERKS
This is what's called a "flexible funding" campaign, meaning that I will be able to use whatever money I'm able to raise through this crowdfunding platform IndieGogo. Even in the event that I am unable to reach my goal, I'll be able to keep the profits and use it toward the release of this album and beyond.
Regardless of the final outcome, I am offering a variety of perks with your pre-order contribution to anyone who donates their hard earned money to this project. These include apparel, accessories, private concerts and more!
You can contribute by selecting a perk and continuing through the checkout process. You can also contribute any amount without selecting a perk. Multiple perks can be purchased in separate transactions. 
Here are a few of the exclusive items I'm offering--
Handmade t-shirts (design by Merchly)
​
Custom stickers (design by Sticker Giant)
​

Your very own handwritten & signed copy of my complete song lyrics feautured on the album with illustrations 
Private concerts! You've been thinking about having me out for a private concert-- pull the trigger now, and get some great extras with your very own house show!
Your name mentioned in the liner notes/digital booklet for the album as a personal "thank you" to my closest supporters

If you don't see a perk you'd like and would like to suggest one, email me at jthilliermusic@gmail.com and I'll see what I can do! I may add some surprise one-of-a-kind perks along the way. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
I understand you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are some other ways to help: 

Use Indiegogo's share tools to share this campaign on social media. Use the hashtag #jthilliermusic
Send a text or email your friends and others with a link to this campaign 
Repeat! News feed items are ephemeral. Repetition is a necessity!

Thank you, thank you, thank you.  - JTH

story:
Hi, my name is Tynan Davis and my rap name is Rollercoaster Man. For more than a decade I have been writing and performing positive and family friendly hip hop. In 2012, I made a song and video called "I'm In Oakland and I'm Riding My Bike," and the video was played at Portland's Filmed By Bike film festival.

I believe that rap music doesn't have to be about flashing money and disrespecting people, it can be about positive and life affirming things.

I value authentic artistic expression, and I aim to continue to inspire people with my music. I have been recording in my garage and doing my best to mix and master the tracks, but it is time to turn over the technical stuff to the professionals. I also need to purchase the full quality original music from the producers, because I have been downloading their tracks for free at a lower quality.  I've done a few other music videos but without quality mixed audio, they have fell short of their potential.

I hope that someday, families will be blasting Rollercoaster Man in their cars and at parties. At the same time I hope to give people hope for rap music.

Some of the kid appropriate song titles are "Silly in the Bounce House", "Jumper and his friends: A rabbit story", and "Oh my B'gosh."

The goal breakdown is as follows...

$650 for 10 hours of studio time with a sound engineer.

$450 to purchase rights for original music tracks.

$100 for distribution to Spotify and other digital music stores.

Any contributions over the goal will go towards a marketing campaign.

Thank you!

story:
Help bring this new album baby CRYSTAL CALM VOL II into the world to create more Light, Love and Peace!

 

I'm thrilled to launch the birth of this new music during this 2020 Holiday season and to fill the coming year with more peace, calm, faith and light!

Join the team, and partner with me, Theda Phoenix to help launch the new Crystal Singing Bowl meditation music album, "Crystal Calm Vol ll" into the world.

This will be my 5th solo album. And the sequel to Crystal Calm, a deeply immersive, meditative, relaxing sound experience, combining water sounds from the BC Coast, Crystal singing bowls and Theda's ethereal vocals, released in 2010!

I, Theda have been singing intuitively for 20 years, songwriting and recording music as well as performing live sound healing journeys since 2007.  My life is devoted to creating healing and transformational music to empower all beings to connect with the innate healing intelligence within.

2 years ago I envisioned a follow up/sequel to Crystal Calm. Sam Ryan and I got back in the studio and started recording, editing, mixing and mastering. The Project has taken alot more studio time than I expected and I am reaching out to you now to help with the costs of production and manufacturing of this project!

Once again we recorded on binaural microphones, which creates an immersive 3 dimensional sound experience and the album is blessed with the natural sounds of flowing streams and waters of the Mama Ganges River near Rishikesh India, recorded and produced by Sam Ryan - www.sosmusic.biz
Photography was captured by the magic and precision of the talented Jonathan Hanley, hanleymade.com
And the mystical Graphic Design for the CD art was created by Kristall Onee - Unite.love

 

If you have enjoyed Crystal Calm, I know you will love this one too. It is in a similar style, perfect to journey, relax, drift, float, meditate, fall asleep to or use in your healing and massage sessions.

I feel it is especially important to share this music during these stressful times of uncertainty, when we most need to stay grounded and connected to our center and our sense of spiritual source, peace and balance. This music can help regulate the nervous system by entering deep states of relaxation, helping us maintain well-being and calm in times of stress.   

By supporting this campaign, you are both receiving and contributing the benefits of more peace in our often overwhelming world!!

 

As an independent recording artist, I am responsible for all the costs of recording, producing and manufacturing the music, and the costs really do add up!

Breakdown of costs on this project are:

Production              $4843.75 

Manufacturing (500)  $849.17

Indigogo Fees .05%     $284     extra fee  $25

TOTAL Expenses: $6001.92.  Rounding to a final Goal of $6000 for this campaign!

In the case that we raise additional funds, it will go towards Marketing and Promotional Costs to share the album with more listeners!

I deeply thank you for your continued support of my music and for taking the time to contribute, share this campaign and also enjoy the healing benefits of this music.

I look forward to sharing this album with you!


please include your email and mailing address when contributing if possible

Thank you so much, Theda Phoenix

story:
The Prize Foundation: Supporting Artists and Transforming Creative Lives

The award-winning Prize Foundation was founded in 2011 to help filmmakers, musicians, chefs, fashion designers and comedians evolve, transform and amplify their art. The idea has always been to help creative entrepreneurs sustain themselves. 2020 was going to be a great year for the Prize Foundation, and that's when COVID hit and a pandemic threatened the existence of one of the greatest advocates of indie artists on the planet.

But adversity and lack of funding never stopped the Prize. On July 19, we are planning an online music fest and fundraiser called PrizePalooza. Musicians from all over the world are performing at PrizePalooza to help the effort to help fund our education programs, mentorships and festivals. We need your energy, power and dollars to fuel the Prize Foundation's fire! We not only need you to donate, we need you to help spread the word and convince others to do the same!

PrizePalooza Lineup: An Online Music Fest and Fundraiser You Can Attend In Your Pajamas

We are excited to announce our first ever online music festival, PrizePalooza! The event will take place on Sunday, July 19, 5pm-8pm,  on a variety of streaming platforms. A number of national and international acts with ties to the Prize Foundation will perform for the occasion. PrizePalooza is FREE and your contribution on IndieGoGo will not only help us make it a reality, it will also help fund Prize Foundation and allow us to continue engaging, activating and elevating creative entrepreneurs from around the world! 


While the full festival lineup has not been finalized, many high-caliber musicians have already signed on to participate. PrizePalooza is thrilled to announce the following initial artist selection:  

  • Kenny Wayne Shepherd - Kenny Wayne Shepherd continues to create genre-defining blues-infused rock n' roll. Shepherd has built an enviable resume as an accomplished recording artist, a riveting live performer and one of the most talented and distinctive guitarists of his generation. Shepherd has sold millions of albums worldwide, received five GRAMMY® nominations, two Billboard Music Awards, as well as a pair of Orville H. Gibson awards, the Blues Foundation's Keeping The Blues Alive award and two Blues Music awards. He's had seven #1 blues albums and a string of #1 mainstream rock singles.
  • Shinyribs - Shinyribs is the brainchild of Kevin Russell of The Gourds. “A Shinyribs show is an exaltation of spirit,” says Russell.  Shinyribs is the continuation of Kevin Russell’s musical journey that began in Beaumont, TX when, at 14, he found his father’s guitar under his bed, along with a sewing machine, a billy club and a box of comic books. Luckily he chose the guitar. Following his family’s oil boom and bust migratory path he landed in Shreveport, LA where he formed his first band, Picket Line Coyotes.
  • A.J. Haynes - Haynes is the lead singer of The Seratones and winner of the first ever Louisiana Music Prize. She and the band have had their songs used by brands across the globe, including Showtime, while Haynes was chosen as one of the faces of Fender guitars.
  • Beach Slang (James Alex) - Beach Slang is an American punk rock band from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, formed in May 2013 with lead vocalist/guitarist James Alex serving as the band's leader, figurehead & chief songwriter. They have released 4 studio albums and 5 EP's.
  • Kathy Valentine (Go-Go's, Bluebonnets) - Kathy Valentine is a musician and songwriter who made music history as a member of the Go-Go's, the first all-female band to have a #1 album in the U.S. She has maintained a career in music through songwriting, recording, performing and touring as well as additional academic and creative pursuits.
  • *repeat repeat - Hailing from East Nashville, *repeat repeat are the husband and wife duo of Jacob and Kristyn Corder. Often touted as “your favorite band’s favorite band,” they received critical acclaim after their 2018 premiere at Bonnaroo Music and Arts Festival.  They headlined  Music Prize in 2017 and kicked off Music Prize Live Series last summer as part of our all ages showcase in downtown Shreveport.
  • Airpark - Nashville based brothers Ben Ford and Michael Ford Jr. are the minds behind Airpark. This is far from their first appearance on the Music Prize stage, where they’ve been fan favorites for years.
  • Bayou Punks - Brady Blade and the Bayou Punks are based in Sweden. Blade is an award-winning music producer and performer from Shreveport, LA who has previously worked with artists like Dave Matthews, Jewel, Indigo Girls, and Emmylou Harris.
  • Malcolm "Papa Mali" Welbourne - An American record producer, guitarist, singer, and songwriter who grew up in Shreveport and lives in New Orleans, Louisiana.  His debut recording Thunder Chicken, produced by Dan Prothero, has been referred to as "one of the few truly wild and unruly records to come from the rock & roll tradition in the 21st century."
  • And more!

We greatly appreciate anything you can give. Here's where your dollars are going:

  • Your dollars will help create PrizePalooza, and fund the efforts of the award-winning Prize Foundation.
  • Our primary goal is to fund the PrizePalooza online concert, and then earn back as much of the Prize Foundation's annual budget as we can. We are also giving part of our proceeds to the local NPR station.
  • What do you get? Aside from shoutouts, on-screen sponsorships and a grab bag of Prize swag bag, we are also offering up access to the award-winning Prize Fest (October 1-3, 2020), a celebration of indie film, music, fashion and comedy. All passes will include entrance into the festival and online access to streamed events.

Your Dollars Create Impact in Artists and Creative Entrepreneurs' Lives

Every dollar of your donation will go to the Prize Foundation, and every dollar will create maximum impact in the world of creative entrepreneurs...

  • The Prize Foundation is nationally renowned for evolving, transforming and activating indie filmmakers, musicians, chefs, comedians and fashion designers.

 

  • Your dollars will fund educational events, free online content and meetups of creative entrepreneurs around the nation.

 

Over the years, the Prize Foundation has helped...

  • ...over 750+ film teams from across the world for the Louisiana Film Prize, giving out almost $500k in grants and cash prizes, generating over $5 million in economic impact to the state of Louisiana with over 50% of creators being women and/or persons of color.
  • ...over 300+ musicians, 15 national acts, 2 bands signed with producers for the Louisiana Music Prize with over 35% of Music Prize winners being persons of color.
  • ...over 375+ companies, 700+ entrepreneurs for the Louisiana Start-Up Prize resulting in over 40 funding offers from investors and connecting over 75 mentors. 
  • ...over 80+ local chefs for the Louisiana Food Prize, with 40+ celebrity chefs resulting in 3 restaurants launched.
  • ...hundreds of students across Louisiana for Film Prize Junior, giving away over $30,000 in grants and scholarships while helping create film programs at schools across the state.
  • And much, much more!

 
 

PrizePalooza: A Bright Spot in a Dark, Challenging Year

With the COVID pandemic looming over us, 2020 has challenged Prize Foundation like we've never been challenged before. As a result, we have been innovative in our funding of the our organization. 

  • First and foremost, PrizePalooza will help us fund our efforts to activate, evolve and transform independent creative entrepreneurs.
  • During this pandemic, the Prize Foundation has quickly pivoted to an online media and education non-profit, and we are now working on grants and other sponsorship opportunities to help us get to the other side of this global health pandemic.
  • We believe that this pandemic has opened our minds and eyes to the opportunity to speak to a wider audience and influence more entrepreneurial activity around the US and beyond. As a result, with your support of PrizePalooza, we hope to be a global catalysts for filmmakers, musicians, fashion designers, comedians and chefs everywhere. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, no worries, you can still help:

  • Please raise your voices and help your friends and family aware of our campaign!
  • Use those Indiegogo SHARE tools to help spread the PrizePalooza and Prize Foundation gospel.

Thank you for anything you can do to help make PrizePalooza happen, and thank you for your support of the Prize Foundation!

#PrizePalooza #VivaLaPrizeFoundation #VivaLaFilmPrize

story:
Deine erste Liebe, Deine erste Trauer, Staubsaugervertreter & Familienfeste.
Le Magnetophone klingen wie das wütende Herz Deines Alltags.

Le Magnetophone sind eine sieben Menschen starke Post-Singer/Songwriter Band aus dem Brandenburg des Westens. Dem Saarland.

Sie bewegen sich irgendwo zwischen Why?, Sigur Ros und Die Türen. Irgendwo zwischen dem wütenden Herz Deines Alltags und Punchlines, wie man sie sonst nur aus Rapsongs kennt, entsteht eine vertraute Wärme in Dir. Wie wenn man sich gerade in die Hose macht.

Ein Karton unterm Arm mit den letzten Sachen aus dem Büro, Fastfood beim Gehen, dein Grundschulfreund der sich totgefixt hat, der Metzger in deinem Heimatort macht zu und die Edeka Filiale auch.

Das neue Le Magnetophone Album “Qualitätsmanagement” klingt wie ein Sampler zum Thema “Alles geht in den Arsch”. Am Ende der Welt, dort wo sich Folk, Indie und Noise gute Nacht sagen, gibt es nur eine stilistische Maxime: Es gibt keine stilistische Maxime.

So wirkt die Platte wie eine konzertante Collage des Verfalls mit einer Dynamik zwischen Augenreiben vor einem plattgefahrenen Igel bis zum Flugzeug, das nach einer durchzechten Nacht in deinem Kopf rumfliegt.
Laut, kaputt, aber irgendwie auch schön.

Ein entspanntes Ausatmen, wenn man nach der Apokalypse nochmal das alte Fotoalbum rauskramt und merkt, dass jetzt eigentlich alles besser ist.

Le Magnetophone veröffentlichen Anfang 2016 ihr zweites Album „Qualitätsmanagement“ . Und Du kannst jetzt Teil dieser wundervollen Platte werden!

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Wir haben eine CD aufgenommen, die wir jetzt pressen lassen wollen. Außerdem wird es zwei wahnsinnige Musikvideos geben und wir wollen, dass eine professionelle Promoagentur den Menschen von unserer Musik erzählt. 

Das Geld hier gesammelte Geld fließt in:

- Aufnahme, Mix und Mastering der CD

- Pressung und Vertrieb der CD 

- Drei phänomenal pompöse Musikvideos mit hochkarätiger Besetzung

- Ganz normale Promomoves, damit sich den Kram auch irgendjemand anhört

- Indiegogo & Paypal Gebühren

Natürlich unterstützt ihr uns nicht umsonst - wir haben großartige Dankeschöns/Perks für euch, wow!


Wie ihr uns unterstützen könnt:

- Kauft euch eins unserer fantastischen Dankeschöns
- Teilt diese Kampagne in den sozialen Netzwerken dieser Welt
- Kauft unser letztes Album "ne marche plus", am besten direkt bei uns: http://lemagnetophone.bandcamp.com/releases
- Werdet Teil des Teams: werdet Le Magnetophone Ambassadeur! Wir suchen Street Teams in ganz Deutschland, die wir mit Aufklebern, Plakaten, Flyern und tollen Überraschungen ausstatten, um unsere Botschaft in die Welt zu tragen. Ambassadeur könnt ihr werden, wenn ihr uns eine kurze Mail an info [at] lemagnetophone [dot] de schickt mit dem Betreff "Le Magnetophone Ambassadeur".
- Kommt auf unsere Konzerte
- Bucht uns auf eure Veranstaltung
- Folgt uns bei Facebook und Twitter
story_txt:
Deine erste Liebe, Deine erste Trauer, Staubsaugervertreter & Familienfeste.Le Magnetophone klingen wie das wütende Herz Deines Alltags. 
Le Magnetophone sind eine sieben Menschen starke Post-Singer/Songwriter Band aus dem Brandenburg des Westens. Dem Saarland.
Sie bewegen sich irgendwo zwischen Why?, Sigur Ros und Die Türen. Irgendwo zwischen dem wütenden Herz Deines Alltags und Punchlines, wie man sie sonst nur aus Rapsongs kennt, entsteht eine vertraute Wärme in Dir. Wie wenn man sich gerade in die Hose macht.

Ein Karton unterm Arm mit den letzten Sachen aus dem Büro, Fastfood beim Gehen, dein Grundschulfreund der sich totgefixt hat, der Metzger in deinem Heimatort macht zu und die Edeka Filiale auch.
Das neue Le Magnetophone Album “Qualitätsmanagement” klingt wie ein Sampler zum Thema “Alles geht in den Arsch”. Am Ende der Welt, dort wo sich Folk, Indie und Noise gute Nacht sagen, gibt es nur eine stilistische Maxime: Es gibt keine stilistische Maxime.
So wirkt die Platte wie eine konzertante Collage des Verfalls mit einer Dynamik zwischen Augenreiben vor einem plattgefahrenen Igel bis zum Flugzeug, das nach einer durchzechten Nacht in deinem Kopf rumfliegt.Laut, kaputt, aber irgendwie auch schön.
Ein entspanntes Ausatmen, wenn man nach der Apokalypse nochmal das alte Fotoalbum rauskramt und merkt, dass jetzt eigentlich alles besser ist.

Le Magnetophone veröffentlichen Anfang 2016 ihr zweites Album „Qualitätsmanagement“ . Und Du kannst jetzt Teil dieser wundervollen Platte werden!

   Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst 
Wir haben eine CD aufgenommen, die wir jetzt pressen lassen wollen. Außerdem wird es zwei wahnsinnige Musikvideos geben und wir wollen, dass eine professionelle Promoagentur den Menschen von unserer Musik erzählt. 
Das Geld hier gesammelte Geld fließt in:
- Aufnahme, Mix und Mastering der CD
- Pressung und Vertrieb der CD 
- Drei phänomenal pompöse Musikvideos mit hochkarätiger Besetzung
- Ganz normale Promomoves, damit sich den Kram auch irgendjemand anhört
- Indiegogo & Paypal Gebühren
Natürlich unterstützt ihr uns nicht umsonst - wir haben großartige Dankeschöns/Perks für euch, wow!




    Wie ihr uns unterstützen könnt:
- Kauft euch eins unserer fantastischen Dankeschöns
- Teilt diese Kampagne in den sozialen Netzwerken dieser Welt
- Kauft unser letztes Album "ne marche plus", am besten direkt bei uns: http://lemagnetophone.bandcamp.com/releases

- Werdet Teil des Teams: werdet Le Magnetophone Ambassadeur! Wir suchen Street Teams in ganz Deutschland, die wir mit Aufklebern, Plakaten, Flyern und tollen Überraschungen ausstatten, um unsere Botschaft in die Welt zu tragen. Ambassadeur könnt ihr werden, wenn ihr uns eine kurze Mail an info [at] lemagnetophone [dot] de schickt mit dem Betreff "Le Magnetophone Ambassadeur".
- Kommt auf unsere Konzerte
- Bucht uns auf eure Veranstaltung
- Folgt uns bei Facebook und Twitter

story:
Irma Seleman


Songwriting has been part of my musical life growing up and with the ability of presenting my music through my singing, production and music arrangement, I have written a large number of songs particularly for my first debut album “My World”. Currently residing in Brooklyn, New York, I have been performing in various venues in Boston and NYC area for the past 3 years after moving to the United States in Fall 2011.

Graduated from Berklee College of Music with a dual major in Contemporary Writing and Production and Music Performance, I have produced an Extended Play (EP) consists of 5 songs in Fall 2012. My biggest achievement so far would be the tours that I had in Malaysia and Singapore in Summer 2013 promoting my EP and also the European Tour that includes my participation in the Close Encounters Festival 2014 in Finland and St. Petersburg, Russia. I also spread my wing to the West Coast of American and did a short tour in California.

My music translates my experiences in life, love and music journey. My goal is to bring back the soul in music that we’ve lost in today’s music such as the music by the great Stevie Wonder, Donny Hathaway, Anita Baker and many more and to fuse it with today’s music technology and not forgetting my Malaysian roots. All those elements won’t only be heard through my music but the interpretation of my singing and the development of the music production itself. Being a music student who has a large knowledge in writing and also music technology gives me more headroom to expand my sound in terms of creating a new sound that can be accepted in the mainstream and yet is still different. My view in life changes as I was brought up in a smaller village not knowing English language and had the opportunity to move to the city to further my studies and what more after moving to the United States and to one of the largest and fast moving city in the world, New York City. Those huge steps that I took has taught me so much in being independent, a hustler, and appreciating every single opportunity that has been given to me. Touching people’s heart and soul is one of my biggest aspiration. Through the years of being a musician, I have been inspired by a lot of musicians, artist, writers, and individuals and I'm looking forward for the opportunity for me to inspire people through my music and share my life journey.

 


The ALBUM "My World"


A couple of years back, I started this crazy idea of putting together my album ON MY OWN without any help of any record labels. I wrote over 70 songs for the making of this album and finally it has been down listed to a full length album (12 songs). It's basically a combination of my old and new sound, which was carried through each experiences I've had from moving from one country to another and by going through life changes.

In this album, it will feature both organic and electronic sounds of music. As a huge fan of classic R&B music, I've infused some of the elements with some modern music and also not to forget my Malaysian root. This album represents my journey in life as a person, musician and a lover. It can be seen through each songs that I wrote. Each melody and lyrics mean more than just putting words into a song. Life has been a roller coaster for me but I know that it will always get better each time I fall. This album is about bringing people together, letting them know that they're not alone and if they're scared to speak their emotions, they have a song to add to their playlist to represent exactly how they feel. This album is about standing up stronger and believing in yourself, myself, ourselves. 
As for the progress of the album, the first phase of having all 12 songs rearranged has been done. We will proceed with the recording sessions as soon as this project is funded. 

For the single, it is currently in the mixing process. I'll start shooting the music video in early February and it will be out as soon as the music video is ready. Currently it is "on hold" as I'm still looking for sponsors to sponsor the making of the music video
 

The TOUR


The 2 weeks tour will cover the "East Coast" of the United States in April 2015 that includes:

I will be joined by three more amazing songwriters Aleksandra Denda, SA and Shubh Saran.



What The Album Needs & What You'll Get


The "FUND"


I am always scared when it comes to asking funds from others but this dream of mine is definitely worth fighting my fear and hopefully it'll be worth your time and financial support. With this fund I raise, it will be channeled to 

  • Recording Studio Sessions - $2500
  • Session Musicians - $2000
  • Mixing Session - $3000
  • Mastering Session - $1500
  • Album Printing - $3000
  • Marketing & Promotions - $2000
  • East Coast Tour (Per Diem) - $7000

As you can see, the total amount of each production procedure costs way more than what i'm raising as I'm putting together my own savings into this project, but it is not enough to support this whole process of making an album.

The recording sessions, mixing sessions and mastering sessions will take up to $9k as I'm looking to record and get a professional mixing and mastering engineer to get the best quality I can get. The recording sessions will be held in both New York and Boston, which will be in Eidolon Studio (Boston) and Riro Muzik (New York City)

The cost for album printing, marketing and promotions can go up to $2k for me to be able to get my album and single out on the websites, iTunes, Spotify, Music Stores, Radios and most probably Televisions.

As for the tour, I will be getting outside sponsors to cut as much cost as possible and the balance of the remaining fund will go to both the tour and the music video.


You'll get..


There are many different perks that I'm giving to whoever kind enough to help me out in supporting this campaign. It is broken down in more detail on the perks section :)

But here are some example of the perks that you'll get!

  • Digital Download
  • Physical Copy of the Album
  • Couple sets of the Physical Copies of the Album
  • Physical Copy of the Album with a personalized message
  • Poster
  • Tshirt (designed by ME)
  • Album Signatured Mug
  • A live video session
  • A video specially dedicated to you
  • Ticket to the Album Release Party
  • Special "skype" interview session
  • Be in the studio with us (if you're not in NYC, we can have a skype session)
  • The title of the "Executive Producer" of the album (your name will be featured in the album booklet and cover)
Merchandise Design


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially at this time, but still want to help, it will be great if you can help spread the words out either through social media or friends and family.

Thank you so much,

Irma Seleman

story:
Deck is coming (with a little help from you)...

I’m about a month away from completing my next CD. Don't rush this, I keep telling myself - so we're adding new parts as we mix. Making it better, I think. But it's not far off.

I think the music feels lovely, and the songs feel honest and good. I’ve been lucky enough to enlist the help of some fantastic musical friends, including Hannah Sanders, Matt Kelly, Lizzie J Taylor, Nick Blishen, Greg Camburn, Lucinda Fudge and Brian Harvey. 

But now we need to master it and design it and press it. That’s the costly bit and I’m appealing for help from anyone who thinks they might be interested in the album, in the form of a pre-order pledge.

Many have donated already but there’s still a way to go. The deadline for the campaign is March 7th and by then I hope to have raised £1200. Or thereabouts: that’s the top target, but every pledge will count. If we don't hit the target by then the campaign will remain open - mainly because I want to do a good job and a little extra time never hurt. Just so long as it's not too long...

You can pledge through Indiegogo with a credit card or Paypal (the credit card route is preferable), or you can just hand me some cash when you see me and I’ll make sure you’re added to the list. 

When it's complete, the album will sell for £10. So a £10 pledge gets you a guaranteed copy, in the snail mail or at a lovely launch event, just as soon as the finished discs arrive at Clunk and Rattle Records. 

Of course a little extra always helps. So if you can stretch to £13 or more you’ll also have booked a copy of a limited edition three-track EP, scheduled for completion shortly after the main album is done. To date I'm not entirely sure what will be on the EP, so that'll be a wee surprise for all concerned. 

Just so you know, the album will be called Deck, and the EP will be called Alt. 

I do hope all that makes sense. Please please please please email me at markgsongs@gmail.com if you’ve got a question!

story:
Who We Are

Refreshment UK is based in Manchester and is a Christian charity working both in the UK and across the world.

We are a small charity with a big vision.

Our passion is to help people to retreat, rejoice, respond and be resourced.

To retreat, we organise conferences, training events, holidays and retreats, many of which are free of charge for people to attend. These happen in the UK and last year, we took a group to Malta.

To rejoice, we help people by running nights of music and Christian worship music, as well as take a light-hearted look at how hymns and songs have been written for centuries.

To respond, we enable and equip people to make a difference in the world by actively doing mission work, and organise trips to India where people work alongside leprosy sufferers, orphans and dedicate wells in the area.

And to help resource these people, we write books and courses that they can use – often free-of-charge.

What We Are Looking For

At the start of January 2015, we moved our head office and operations from Worcester to Manchester. It was a big move and a completely different area. Consequently, we are looking to start afresh in Manchester and increase the work significantly.

We are looking to increase our team and are planning to employ four people – The

Refreshers - who will help to grow the work across the UK. As a charity, it is not always easy to attract funding just for salaries, but we are running the Drops in the Ocean Appeal to help fund that.


To run Refreshment for two months, it costs approximately £10,000 including new salaries. On top of that, we will look to supply electrical equipment and phones for the new starters – an extra £2000. So when you give to this campaign, you are investing into employment and also, a charity that is looking to grow.

What Are We Offer 

Each donation from £1 upwards is a drop in the ocean but will contribute to a significant work. Many drops, of course, make an ocean!

Also included in the perks are some Refreshment branded goodies – sports bottles, and lip balm – and then for larger amounts, we are giving away gift vouchers that can be used in 21,000 stores UK-wide. All of these will be delivered in March 2015 to you.

Any funding against this project will go to the ongoing costs of Refreshment UK – if we raise the total, it will be great, but if not, you will still get to support our vision.

The Impact

By supporting our work, you will make a difference to everything we do. Firstly, you are contributing to the economy by reducing those out of work – in theory! But by being able to employ members of staff, we will be able to do more refreshing. For example, we will be able to support more work in India – before Refreshment went in 2014, no UK-based charity had been to the part of India we were in. There were wells planted in villages that had never had clean water, and children who were made to feel special.

Also, in the UK, by having an increased team, we will be able to accommodate more in our already busy schedule. From helping people to respond, our events have led to people to new work in communities and new jobs. We believe that it is something that an active Christian sector needs and we believe that we can help in the refreshing.

Risks & Challenges

We know that finding the right team members will not be easy as demand will be high and we need people who are self-motivated. We are running a good mentoring scheme to make sure that the people who are employed receive spiritual support. Our chief executive is qualified in mentoring and has worked alongside mentees for nearly a decade.

We also know that as a charity, funding is not always there – but part of the team increase will mean a great awareness of our work and a higher profile.

Other Ways You Can Help

Raising the profile is something that you can do. Even if you can’t contribute, you can make a difference by sharing this campaign with your friends across social media, when you are down the pub or even at work! We need your support and your little drop can help build an ocean.

Thank you for reading – if you need to know any more about what we do, please leave us a message.

story:
Welcome! 


The Story

Hi! My name is Alana Klatt. I'm a singer/songwriter/worship leader with a deep passion and desire to release my voice and songs to the world!

My desire? I want to record an album full of songs that are raw in vulnerability, honest about the process, and fierce about God's hope & goodness. 

Phase II

My goal for Phase II?To raise $8000 so that I can record my next 3 songs in studio. This will cover the recording process, hiring musicians, production, and studio costs.

I am privileged to continue working with producer Ryan Worsley and hit songwriter Laurell Barker to produce my next 3 songs! 

Ryan is a Vancouver-based producer and the mastermind behind Echoplant Sound Studio. Ryan has worked with artists such as Dear Rouge and other worship artists locally and globally. His ability to take a song from its raw form and actualize it with colour and contour is effortless!

Laurell is a prolific songwriter and recording artist with more than 6 chart-topping songs to her name. She is passionate about artist development and has lent herself to co-writing this album with me! I am so grateful for her influence and her heart for this project!

The Why :: Impact

My hopes for this album:

1) That it would be a blessing to the local church.
2) That it would touch people in times of personal worship and encounter with Jesus.
3) That it would reach anyone who finds themselves in a season of struggle - that they would hear God's voice of HOPE and be drawn into a tangible experience of His mighty love.

Phase II
My goal for Phase II?To raise $8000 so that I can record my next 3 songs in studio. This will cover the recording process, hiring musicians, production, and studio costs.I am privileged to continue working with producer Ryan Worsley and hit songwriter Laurell Barker to produce my next 3 songs! Ryan is a Vancouver-based producer and the mastermind behind Echoplant Sound Studio. Ryan has worked with artists such as Dear Rouge and other worship artists locally and globally. His ability to take a song from its raw form and actualize it with colour and contour is effortless!Laurell is a prolific songwriter and recording artist with more than 6 chart-topping songs to her name. She is passionate about artist development and has lent herself to co-writing this album with me! I am so grateful for her influence and her heart for this project!The Why :: ImpactMy hopes for this album:1) That it would be a blessing to the local church.
2) That it would touch people in times of personal worship and encounter with Jesus.
3) That it would reach anyone who finds themselves in a season of struggle - that they would hear God's voice of HOPE and be drawn into a tangible experience of His mighty love.

story:
We are The Blank Canvas

We are a rock band from Jacksonville, Florida.  We go to Douglas Anderson School of the Arts.  Carson Hall is on lead vocals and guitar, Taylor Neal on lead guitar, Andre Delellis on bass, and Brian Lester on drums.  We love music and get inspired from artists like Manchester Orchestra, Title Fight, and Balance and Composure. 

 Music is more than a love, it is who we are at our core.   With this album you will hear a new fresh sound from a band out to impact our community.  We have a pure rock sound, not robotically corrected to where it is "perfect", but to where the music is real. Real music, real lyrics, and real people for our real fans. 

Making the album

For our debut album we want to do something different.  Something that is uncommon in today's music. We want to make an album the way bands made records pre-2000's.  Modern records are typically performed one instrument at a time and one section of a song at a time.  Then in a computer, they are cut and pasted together to make the song.  Parts are clinically perfected.  Everything is "auto tuned" and quantized.  Simply put, the life is sucked out of the music!  

We want to put the life back into music.

Our album will be made without the aid of computers.  We will all be in the room performing together as a band.  The same energy and groove that we have live will be on the album.  What you hear on the record will be exactly how it was performed, by us. 

Why are we doing this? 

Because you deserve to hear music the way music was meant to be heard, and because we can!  We want our fans to experience what it feels like to have the hair stand up on the back of their necks because the groove feels so good.  We hope to be part of a music revival bringing a return of amazing and authentic music.  

Be a part of the recording process

All this is great, but we need your help to make it happen.  We need $3000 to make this record at the quality that our fans deserve and we need you to help us raise the money.  

What can you do to help?

First, choose a reward on this page and buy it.  It's that simple.  Only have $10?  Pre-order the album! Are you a super fan and want us to do a private house party for you and your friends?  You can purchase that reward (which would be AWESOME).   Contribute as much or as little as you'd like, but please contribute.  Everything helps.  

Second, be our promotional team.  Share our Indiegogo campaign with everyone you know.  Ask them to share it with everyone they know.  Convince them to contribute.  Get your friends together and contribute.  Plan a friend's night out and get a reward with tickets to the album launch concert!  

Last, stay connected.  Subscribe to our Facebook or Instagram We will be making regular updates throughout the campaign to let you guys know how it's going.  

The $3000 goal is to cover the following:

  • 1 Day of tracking (recording)
  • 1 Day of Mixing
  • An assistant for 2 days in the studio
  • Lodging for 3 days
  • Mastering
  • Manufacturing
  • Indiegogo and Paypal fees

Shows

Currently we have two shows that you can come out and see as the indiegogo is going. 
February 27th at The Birdhouse: https://www.facebook.com/events/1580231015556144/?ref_dashboard_filter=upcoming
March 1st at Murray Hill Theatre: https://www.facebook.com/events/1433528403606049/?ref_dashboard_filter=upcoming

Thank you!

Thank you so much for backing our project.  We are excited to make this album for you!  

The Blank Canvas.
